story:
There are werewolves among us! We'll stab each other and try to avoid getting bitten, but when a human receives their third bite, they secretly become a wolf and turn against us!
 
  • GROWL is like Werewolf (aka Mafia), but as a quick 10-15 minute card game for 4-10 players of all ages
     
  • The cards in your hand reveal whether you are a human or a werewolf
     
  • Humans turn into werewolves if they get bitten 3 times!
  • Everyone gets to bite, stab, heal, and give gold, so we all have power, not just the loud people 
     
  • Doesn't require a moderator or phone app

 

Downloads

*** RULES (English) ***

*** RULES (French) ***

*** RULES (German) ***

*** RULES (Spanish) ***

*** RULES (Swedish) ***

*** RULES (Chinese) *** (draft)

*** RULES (Japanese) ***

*** RULES (Portuguese - Brazilian) ***

***RULES (Thai) ***

Coming Soon: Dutch, Danish, Hungarian, and more!

**Message me if you want collaborator access to the translations!**

Try the Tabletop Simulator version! (Requires Steam and TTS)

Try the low-ink Print and Play version to print out at home!  
  • "The most tense 10-15 minute game I've ever played in my life" – Bower's Game Corner (video review)
     
  • "A new generation of werewolf" – Nushura (Board Game Geek)
     
  • "A hilarious and compelling party game, good to the last Bite" – Jeff Siadek (Designer, Lifeboat)
  • "GROWL is certainly going to be one of my new favorites. It hits all the right spots, scratches all the right itches, has just the right amount of intensity, and player interaction, keeping me guessing and debating from start to finish." - Cyrus Kirby (Father Geek)
     
 
To see the designer, Joey Vigour, discuss GROWL strategies with famed designer, Jeff Siadek (Lifeboat), click here.

To see the replay of the live playthrough with Unfiltered Gamer, click here.

 


This the best price you'll get, since buying directly from us will cut out the middlemen. You'll be supporting indie games, and you will get your copy probably months early. Some Add-Ons may not be available again.

We have plans to support retail and distribution if our margins work, so please message us if you have an opportunity or offer. We aren't sure what the future holds for GROWL, but we love the game and hope you'll support us today.

 

 

Shipping is charged after the campaign (when the product is finalized). The game will be about 10 ounces, 6x4x2.5 inches.

I will try my absolute hardest to charge the lowest shipping, including shipping from fulfillment centers within those countries or regions when possible. Due to unknown factors that can affect shipping costs, I can at best promise to warn you via update (and email) what the real costs will be prior to charging you. And of course you will be given the opportunity for a refund if you wish. I apologize, but I will also have to reserve the right to refund any pledges that I don't think my shipping partners will be able to fulfill. I will reach out to you directly if this becomes necessary. 

Here are the countries my shipping partner won't deliver to. I can still try to ship there directly, but I can't make promises you will get your packages in a timely or cost-effective manner: Afghanistan, Brazil, Congo, Ivory Coast, Democratic Republic of Congo, Eritrea , Guinea-Bissau, Haiti , Iran, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Myanmar (Burma), North Korea, Russia, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, Ukraine

Thank you.
-Joey

 

 

GROWL was created by Joey Vigour, who has produced several big-box games like Chaosmos and Battlestations Second Edition. The Community Manager is Halley Kim, and feel free to say hello or message us with any questions.

Sign up for the quarterly newsletter!

The art was created by Angelina Chernyak. Additional art by Rob Joseph.

Molly Ferguson drew the infographics. Dom Smith is the graphic designer responsible for all the behind the scenes design mockups. Thank you guys. Sagar Kinkar made some of the renderings, thank you!

Special Thanks to Sam Vest, and our whole community at First Play: L.A. Board Game Playtesters.

Music by Kevin Macleod and Ikson. Thank you.

story:
About this project


Royal Art Games via Rolljordan Miniatures design is pleased to release the coolest Orc team on the market. We have successfully created and delivered both with RJ and the MK1881 line 10 different teams in the past 2 years on Kickstarter and another crowdfunding platform.

The Miniatures

 LEVEL 1 - Lone Brutos - You get a model of your choice (excluded the troll) you choose if resin or metal cast. 9€ shipped worldwide 9€ + free shipping, no track code

 LEVEL 2 - Big Brutos - You get a big guy of your choice from the ones unlocked. You will be able to choose either resin or metal cast. 18€ shipped worldwide 18€ + free shipping, no track code 

 LEVEL 3 - Brutos Sampler - You get 4 models of your choice (excluding the Troll or the Black Orcs) either in metal or resin cast. 33€ shipped worldwide 33€ + free shipping, no track code 

 LEVEL 4R - Brutos Team Resin - You get 12 models to include, 3 blitzer, 3 black orcs, 1 goblin, 1 thrower and 4 lineman all cast in resin. MQR 70€ + free shipping KS 49€ + free shipping 

 LEVEL 4 - Brutos Team Metal - You get 12 models to include, 3 blitzer, 3 black orcs, 1 goblin, 1 thrower and 4 lineman all cast in metal. MQR 86€ + free shipping KS 65€ + free shipping 

 LEVEL 5R - Brutos Horde Resin - You get 16 models to include, 4 blitzer, 4 black orcs, 1 goblin, 1 troll, 2 thrower and 4 lineman all cast in resin This perk includes all the stretch goals marked as FREE. MQR 90€ + free shipping KS 70€ + free shipping 

 LEVEL 5 - Brutos Horde Resin - You get 16 models to include, 4 blitzer, 4 black orcs, 1 goblin, 1 troll, 2 thrower and 4 lineman all cast in metal. This perk includes all the stretch goals marked as FREE. MQR 115€ + free shipping KS 85€ + free shipping 

LEVEL 6R - Brutos Overlord - 5 x LEVEL 5R MQR 395€ + free shipping KS 270€ + free shipping

LEVEL 6 - Brutos Overlord - 5 x LEVEL 5 MQR 520€ + free shipping KS 350€ + free shipping
 

  

 Our plan is to complete all the models by November/December 2016 and complete shipping no later of February 2017. This delivery date is an estimate as several factors may influence the production time. Depending on the success of the campaign the number of models to be cast can raise significantly potentially leading to unexpected delays. Stretch goals that unlock new models might also slightly delay the estimated delivery time in order to finalize the sculpture. So far we have been pretty good in meeting our deadline and our last 2 campaigns we ran on another crowdfunding platform where shipped either earlier than estimated or on time.

Resin models: 

All models will be available both in metal or resin. We have just partnered with a new firm who delivers extremely high quality casts. 

Size Comparison:

Size comparison

 All models shown where painted by Axia-Fish Painting Studio. Anyone buying and asking for the team to be painted by him will get some exclusive painting discounts. You can contact him directly through FB here:  https://www.facebook.com/axiafishpainting

Design: 
All the models were sculpted based on the amazing work done by Jean Hubert Rouppillard who has helped us to achieve such amazing result. Some of his sketches here:

https://www.facebook.com/jeanhubert.rouppillard

 Please note: due to several instances the actual models may differ slightly from the ones pictured. Molding, sculpting or casting needs may require small alterations of the models shown in this Kickstarter. So far we have always successfully produce models without making any substantial changes to the models shown in pre-production stage. In many cases we were able to improve the final models by reducing the number of parts required to assemble the models and in several cases obtaining single piece casts. All models (unless specified) will be cast in metal

story:
"I like your project."

- Steve Jackson of Steve Jackson Games.

The world needs more hex maps!

Thanks to decades of popular role-playing games, RPGs on square grids are plentiful and readily available.  Sometimes, though, you want to play on a hex grid.  Hex maps are scarce, despite growing demand for them.  Tactical Hex Maps by Grognard's Realm is a beautiful, 24-page, 8x10 booklet featuring 25 maps for dungeon exploring, man-to-man (or man-to-beast) combat, and daring adventures.

  • Grognard's Realm is run by "Tollenkar", the administrator of the Discord server The Fantasy Trip, a social network for players of the classic game by Steve Jackson Games.  (Tollenkar is a registered trademark of Steve Jackson Games.)
  • As a fan of hex-and-counter games, Tollenkar began hand-drawing his own hex maps to fill the void.  The intent was always to share these maps with the Fantasy RPG community.
  • By contributing to this campaign, you will help proliferate the availability of tactical hex maps, and grow this resource for the community.

While these maps were designed with The Fantasy Trip in mind, they can be used with any FRPG system.

A modest goal

The goal for this campaign is a mere $800.

  • If only 75 people bought only one copy of the book, the goal will be met.
  • Some of these hex maps are available as professionally-printed hex boards.  Five of these maps are available in this crowdfunding campaign, with those maps' scenarios described in the books.  These map boards are available as add-ons to those who purchase at least one book.
  • If the goal is not met, the funds will be used to produce a first edition short print run of this book, making it a rare collector's item!

A much-needed resource

Your contribution to this project will make a difference.

  • By bringing this project to fruition, the RPG community will have greater access to varied hex maps.
  • If successful, this will encourage Grognard's Realm, and others, to increase hex maps' availablity.
  • Books like this will help grow the fantasy RPG  community.

Risk management

The goal is to produce this book in numbers that adequately meet demand.

  • This crowdfunding campaign will help to gauge the demand for this item.
  • By partaking in this campaign, we can better assess the optimum quantity to produce, and predict if there is a demand for more such books.

If you can't contribute...

Even if you don't plan to, or are unable to make a purchase, there are ways you can help make this project a success:

  • Spread the word of this campaign!  Share the link to this URL everywhere: your social media, Discord servers, rest room walls, your FLGS: wherever you think people will love this.
  • Consider just pledging at the $1 level, and do a good deed.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Items ship to the USA only.

YES.... STRETCH GOALS!!!!

This project's stretch goals are also at modest levels!

$1200

Everyone gets a free 5mm d6 die!

$1500

4 additional pages of maps will be added, with 5 new maps, including 3 hand-drawn maps and 1 village map.  (28 pages total)

$1600

Everyone gets a second free 5mm d6 die!

$2000

4 additional pages of maps will be added, with 6 new maps, including 4 hand-drawn maps and 1 village map.  (32 pages total)

$2400

Everyone gets a third free 5mm d6 die!

$3000

4 additional pages of maps will be added, with 5 new maps, including 3 hand-drawn maps and 1 village map.  (36 pages total)

$3600

The three dice get an upgrade from 5mm to 8mm!

story:
Hasbro has picked five great games to round up their "Next Great Family Game!" challenge! Chibi Quest! is one of those five finalists! The winner will have an amazing opportunity to work with Hasbro and make his or her game a reality! Chibi Quest! is truly a great family game! Show your support for it today by backing a perk! 

Please understand, I am not selling retail copies of the game. Unfortunately, since Chibi Quest! is a board game with lots bits, it is very expensive to make, unless I order at least 1500 copies. And I have no where to put 1500 copies! If you'd really like a copy, please pledge $1 to let Hasbro know you'd like Chibi Quest! to get printed!  If you'd really like a copy, I will have a very limited print run of a professionally printed, prototype version of Chibi Quest, but it's expensive! If you'd rather wait for a retail version of Chibi Quest! it is important to show your support by backing one of the other perks to let Hasbro know how much you'd like a copy of Chibi Quest! in your home! Of course we'll send you some great Chibi Swag as a thank you for supporting this game! Please pick the perk that is right for you! Thank you for checking out Chibi Quest! Read all about it below! Any money raised will go to making the swag, storybook, and to my amazing Artist Mibu! who has done such a wonderful job making Chibi Quest! a piece of art! 

Everyone who supports Chibi Quest will get their name in the Storybook! As a special thank you for supporting Chibi Quest! everyone who chose a perk to back, whether it's $1 or $250, will have their names printed in the Storybook credits!

Chibi Quest! is a short, exciting game where you play as a Chibi and it is your quest to vanquish the monsters from your lands! Each Chibi wakes up to a new day of saving the world, but you can’t go into battle in your PJ’s! You must equip your Chibi properly! However, saving the world doesn’t wait on you, so you must do this quickly! You will have one minute to equip your Chibi with awesome weapons, special powers, and even cool mounts! Then it’s up to you to save the world from as many monsters as you can before you get tired and go back to bed. 

Chibi Quest! is relatable to the whole family. There is a bit of nostalgia for the older generations who may remember growing up with paper dolls. It also plays very much like a video game (taking on the role of a character, fighting monsters, and leveling up!) There is even an epic boss fight at the end in which all players must work together to triumph! But only one of you will be crowned the Champion Chibi!

Oh, you mean besides monsters? 

  • 6 different Characters, with boy/girl versions of each one! So 12 different Chibi's to choose from!!!
  • 30 Chunky Battle Dice!
  • A BIG stack of fierce (and sometimes cute) monster cards!
  • Treasure!
  • 120 equipment cards with cool weapons, special powers, head gear, foot gear, chest plates, mounts and more!
  • 1 minute timer
  • Damage tokens
  • An EPIC BOSS!

INCREDIBLE HIGH QUALITY BEAUTIFUL ARWORK By

How to play overview : 

  1. Equip! You quickly search through the available armor in market, paying for any armor you wish to keep! Some armor will protect you and give you lots of hit points, some will give you better dice to fight with, and others will give you special powers! But you must decide quickly... because you only have 1 minute to equip your Chibi for battle!
  2. Battle! Then you battle monsters! You do this by collecting all the dice shown on your armor cards. Some monsters are stronger than others and you must meet the sword requirements to beat the monster, otherwise they damage YOU! If you defeat a monster you then follow the actions listed on that monsters card. Sometimes they give you gold, sometimes they cause you to loose armor, and sometimes they become your sidekick and help you fight!
  3. Shop until you drop! Or in this case, fight until you faint! The first Chibi to cover up all his or her hit points faints! At this point you finish out the round so everyone has an equal number of turns.
  4. BOSS FIGHT! Then everyone will have another minute to equip their Chibis with fresh, undamaged armor.  Afterwards, you must fight together to defeat the BOSS!
  5. WIN or LOSE! If you defeat the BOSS you are all winners! But there is only ONE Champion Chibi. You count up all your points, and whoever has the most is known throughout the lands as the Champion Chibi!

I really want to make this game a reality, because frankly, you're gonna love it. Chibi Quest! will be a fun epic experience that you can't wait to play again, and again. 

So what can you do to help?

  • Support Chibi Quest! Choose a perk that is right for you! I tried my best to make a variety of perks! Many of which have bonus material that can only be acquired here on this campaign!
  • Follow me on facebook, twitter, or sign up for updates to stay in the loop!
  • Tell your friends and family about Chibi Quest! and how to back it! 
  • Get in touch with me via social media, email, or by commenting. I'm happy to reply to your questions or concerns - or simply chat about the game and process. 

  • Share this campaign by using the share icons at the top of this page!

Twitter @boardofplaying 
Website : http://kellynorthadams.com/
Email : kel@boardofplaying.com

I have been playing tabletop games for almost a decade! I have a huge board game collection and I play with family and friends multiple times a week! I am a professional board game designer with 4 exciting games in my portfolio, one of which of which is coming out Spring 2017. I am excited to announce, that there are promos for it being released on the Dice Tower Indiegogo! (which you should also totally support, by the way! The Dice Tower community is such a wonderful one!) Chibi Quest! is my newest addition and I am thrilled with how it turned out! It's just a lot of fun to play and I can't wait to have a final version on my board game shelf to enjoy for many years to come!


Mibu (known on the interwebs as Mibu-no-ookami) is an amazing artist from Spain. She specializes in Chibi illustration with an emphasis on popular culture. Her Chibis' quirky expressions and the detail she puts into her craft makes Chibi Quest! not only a game, but also a box full of Art! Some of her latest works include Chibis inspired by Assassins Creed, Overwatch, Walking dead, Star Wars, Pokemon, Disney, DC and Marvel! Be sure to follow her on instagram (@mibunoookami1) and Facebook (/mibunoookamichibi) to see all the stunning Art she posts! I am so happy to have her illustrating Chibi Quest! because she is the best Chibi artist on the planet! (in my humble opinion...)

Remember any perk level helps this game become a reality! 

  1. $1 Chibi Support - This perk is to show your support for Chibi Quest! As a thank you, you will receive a lovely Digital Wallpaper by Mibu!
     
  2. $5 Chibi Support x 5! - If you'd really like to see a copy of Chibi Quest! in stores, you can show your support FIVE times! You will receive a lovely Digital Wallpaper by Mibu! and a thank you post card from the Designer! This Postcard will have a beautiful piece of artwork from "A Chibi Story!"
     
  3. $10 Chibi Swag! - A bunch of fun Chibi stuff! A cute Chibi sticker to stick on your laptop, notebook, or wherever you want to show your love. A cool car magnet for your car, fridge... or anything else magnetic (except magneto, he tends to destroy stuff) and a blank post card with an art print by Mibu selected from the Storybook! Pin it up for display or mail it to a friend! 
     
  4. $15 Hydralic Expansion Pack! - If Chibi Quest! is popular enough, it will definitely get made whether through a great company like Hasbro, or by a future campaign specifically designed for the mass printing of Chibi Quest! This expansion will only be offered on Indiegogo! So when you get your copy of Chibi Quest! in the future, you'll have a Bonus Chibi to play with and Boss to fight, right from the start!
  5. $35 Chibi Swag + Expansion + Storybook - Receive a limited edition signed copy of "A Chibi Story!" a delightful short story about the Chibi's in your game and the adventures they go on. Great to read with your family to bring the Characters you play to life!  Display it with your board games or on your coffee table for guests to enjoy. Beautifully illustrated by Mibu! This is a limited edition book! You'll also receive the Hydralic Expansion and EVERYTHING from the "Chibi Swag" Perk!
     
  6. $150 Chibi Quest! Game - Want one of the very first copies of Chibi Quest! in the world? The Designer will have a tricked out version of Chibi Quest professionally made for you. Includes bonus promo cards not to be sold with the base copy (shown below) and a thank you note from the designer! Plus you'll get the expansion, a copy of the Storybook, and all the Chibi Swag too! 

  7. $200 Meet the Designer - I will be at Dice Tower Con 2017, and if you are also going... I'll personally deliver your copy of Chibi Quest to you at the con, signed. I'll also be happy to stick around and teach you how to play so you don't have to read the rules (even though they are fun to read... *spoiler*). I will also bring you some Chibi presents :) 
     
  8. $250 Custom Chibi - Mibu will special make a Chibi to the likeliness of you, dressed in PJ's, to use in your Chibi Quest! game!! This is limited to 10 backers only, so if you want one act fast! You'll also receive the tricked out version of Chibi Quest! with all bonus material and ALL the Chibi Swag too! Please contact me after claiming this perk!

Why aren't you offering copies of Chibi Quest! at a retail price on this campaign? To sell a copy of Chibi Quest! at a retail market price of lets say... $39.99 or less - that means I have to place bulk orders of the game. This requires a lot of capital and space...which I’m not set up to do...yet! But if Chibi Quest! is popular enough, it will definitely get made whether through a great company like Hasbro, or by a future campaign specifically designed for the mass printing of Chibi Quest! 

How much is shipping? 

  • If you buy a special prototype copy of Chibi Quest, it will cost $15 to ship domestically within the United States, and $35 for International shipping.
  • ​The Swag will cost between $5 & $7 shipped priority mail to the United States only. Unfortunately it is $25 for International shipping :(

When will I receive my perks? Because this is not a mass printing of a game, the turn around will be pretty quick. Expected delivery date will be in April! The Custom Chibi Perk will be delivered a month later, in May, to give Mibu time to make you into a really great Chibi!

If you have any other questions, feel free to email me at kel@boardofplaying.com!

story:
Now Available!

Though the initial site is complete, you can continue contributing to the campaign to add more data and improvements! The site is freely accessible at s15.darksunstudio.com.

Who are You?

I'm Liz Courts, and I've been gaming for a while, but as I got more involved with the creating part of gaming, I discovered there are certain niches that could be expedited and made more efficient. I have a history of making those tools and aids, and now I need your help to bring them to life!

What I Need & What You Get

Dollar bills, y'all. As a full-time freelancer, I get the luxury of deciding how I spend my time and what I spend it towards, but that sometimes comes at the cost of not getting a paycheck. I've built this particular tool for myself, but I know there are plenty of folks that could take advantage of this tool too! But good hosting isn't cheap, and that's what this campaign is for, as well as paying for my programming and data entry time. A third of the initial funding cost will go directly into paying for a year of hosting, and the remainder compensating me for my time.

But Why?

One of the earliest and best lessons that I learned during my time in IT is that you should always strive to work smarter, not harder. My time in the creative fields and operations taught me that you should work to make the next person's job easier, not harder. Generating the Section 15 section for the required Open Game License statement is by far one of the most tedious parts of being a third-party gaming publisher, or a writer.

With this site? Click click boom. You're done.

No more hunting down multiple books, copy-pasting, sorting, deleting. It's all done for you (with a bit of minor cleanup on your side, because the data is subject to human error).

And guess what? Your support keeps the site available for everybody to use, beginner publisher or veteran.

Risks & Challenges

This tool already works: all of the core hardcovers from Paizo's Pathfinder Roleplaying Game line are already plugged into it, as well as Dreamscarred Press's Ultimate Psionics and Psionic Bestiary, as well as Green Ronin Publishing's Advanced Bestiary (which is my standard setup for my game writing). I do have plans for additional data...but we'll get to that in a bit.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the spare cash (and believe me, I get that), spreading the word about it will help. If you're a game writer or third-party publisher yourself, this helps make your job easier—and who doesn't want that? Give yourself more time to create new worlds and share them with like-minded people.

story:
1 for All- Break the Ice! 

* you don't need to know KSL to play this!

3 Undeniable Appeals 

 

What's in the Game

  • Number Cards #1~12 

- 4 sets of cards in red, yellow, green, and blue 

- Each set has 2 of the same number 

- All set have 1 Change and Repeat cards each

- All sets have 2 All in cards each 

- Total 108 cards 

 

The Cards

  • Number Cards: #1~12 
  • Black Cards: 

- Three sets of special black cards 

- Change (4): With this card, the next player will skip the turn.

- All in (8):  This card is like the Joker. You can add this to any runs or sets of cards.

- Again (4): This Card allows the player to discard their cards again.

How to Play (4 Main Variations) 

  • Trash it 
  1. Get at least 2 players 
  2. Shuffle all the cards 
  3. Distribute the cards to players (minimum 6 cards each)
  4. Put the rest of the card in a pile
  5. Put this card pile in the center 
  6. Choose the first player and the rotation 
  7. Player #1 : If you have 3 of the same number cards, lay them down (ex: 3,3,3) 
  8. Player #1 : If you have 3 consecutive number cards, lay them down (ex: 2,3,4) 
  9. Player #1 : Take one card from the card pile 
  10. Player #1 : Choose to trash one card from your set of cards 
  11. If a player uses an All In card(Joker)...
    • With a run of 3 - (ex: If the laid out run of cards from previous turns is 2,3,4 and you have a joker, you can "lay" out your joker card next to the 4. The All In card will act as a 5)
    • With a set of 3 - (ex: If the laid out set of cards from previous turns is 3,3,3 and you have a joker, you can "lay" out your joker card next to the 3. The All In card will act as a 3
  12. If a player uses a Again card... They can go again! Have the opportunity to lay out or trash another card. 
  13. If a player uses a Change card, the next player in the rotation has to skip. 
  14. Next players should repeat step 7-10. Step 11-13 applies for all players. 
  15. Congrats, the player that trashes all cards wins! 
  •  Number Tag 
  1. Gather at least 2 players
  2. Shuffle All the cards
  3. Distribute the cards to players (minimum 6 cards each) 
  4. Put the rest of the card in a pile 
  5. Put this card pile in the center 
  6. Choose the first player and the rotation
  7. Player #1: set down one card from their set 
  8. Next player: set down another card that "tags" the previous player's card 
    • Ex) If the first player set down card #2, the next player would set down #3 if they had it 
  9. If a player uses an All In card(Joker), they can substitute it as another number 
  10. If a player uses an Again card, they can go again!
  11. If a player uses a Change card, the next player skips a turn 
  12. The player that has no cards left to tag wins! 
  •  Mathematics Game (Addition/ Multiplication)
  1. Gather at least 2 players 
  2. Distribute the cards among players 
  3. All players reveal one of their cards at once 
  4. The player who adds/ multiplies the fastest shouts out the answer 
  5. If the answer is correct, the player collects the cards 
  6. The player with the most cards wins! 
  • 3X3 Bingo

 

Our Story 

The game was originally created as a simple device to encourage the understanding between the deaf and the non-deaf community through fun activities. But, with simple KSL numbers, 1 for ALL is a fantastic icebreaker game to be universally enjoyed. 

Break the ice!

The Perks! 

Special Offer: If you are a backer and you share our project on any SNS platform and send us a picture of confirmation, you can enter into a raffle competition to win a free 1 for ALL card set!

- All in (8):  This card is like the Joker. You can add this to any runs or sets of cards.
- Again (4): This Card allows the player to discard their cards again.
How to Play (4 Main Variations) 
Trash it 

Get at least 2 players 
Shuffle all the cards 
Distribute the cards to players (minimum 6 cards each)
Put the rest of the card in a pile
Put this card pile in the center 
Choose the first player and the rotation 
Player #1 : If you have 3 of the same number cards, lay them down (ex: 3,3,3) 
Player #1 : If you have 3 consecutive number cards, lay them down (ex: 2,3,4) 
Player #1 : Take one card from the card pile 
Player #1 : Choose to trash one card from your set of cards 
If a player uses an All In card(Joker)...
With a run of 3 - (ex: If the laid out run of cards from previous turns is 2,3,4 and you have a joker, you can "lay" out your joker card next to the 4. The All In card will act as a 5)
With a set of 3 - (ex: If the laid out set of cards from previous turns is 3,3,3 and you have a joker, you can "lay" out your joker card next to the 3. The All In card will act as a 3


If a player uses a Again card... They can go again! Have the opportunity to lay out or trash another card. 
If a player uses a Change card, the next player in the rotation has to skip. 
Next players should repeat step 7-10. Step 11-13 applies for all players. 
Congrats, the player that trashes all cards wins! 

 Number Tag 

Gather at least 2 players
Shuffle All the cards
Distribute the cards to players (minimum 6 cards each) 
Put the rest of the card in a pile 
Put this card pile in the center 
Choose the first player and the rotation
Player #1: set down one card from their set 
Next player: set down another card that "tags" the previous player's card Ex) If the first player set down card #2, the next player would set down #3 if they had it 

If a player uses an All In card(Joker), they can substitute it as another number 
If a player uses an Again card, they can go again!
If a player uses a Change card, the next player skips a turn 
The player that has no cards left to tag wins! 

 Mathematics Game (Addition/ Multiplication)

Gather at least 2 players 
Distribute the cards among players 
All players reveal one of their cards at once 
The player who adds/ multiplies the fastest shouts out the answer 
If the answer is correct, the player collects the cards 
The player with the most cards wins! 

3X3 Bingo
 
Our Story 
The game was originally created as a simple device to encourage the understanding between the deaf and the non-deaf community through fun activities. But, with simple KSL numbers, 1 for ALL is a fantastic icebreaker game to be universally enjoyed. 
Break the ice!

The Perks! 

Special Offer: If you are a backer and you share our project on any SNS platform and send us a picture of confirmation, you can enter into a raffle competition to win a free 1 for ALL card set!

story:
Welcome!


We would like to invite you to support our third crowdfunding campaign dedicated to miniatures. All of them are compatible with Fantasy Battles: The 9th Age.

 

During our first two campaigns we showed our possibilities and strong orientation for reaching customers needs and vision of miniatures. Also projects presented in this campaign were started some time ago and developed with The 9th Age community to be as good as it was possible. Our very talented sculptors, artists and manufacturers are doing all their best to provide you with the best products possible. We have hope, and strongly believe, that you will enjoy what you see below.

 

Your support is very important for us. While we see that our products are still needed we will run future releases. So thank you in advance to give us that possibility.
 

 

What our process look like:

1. 3D sculpt

 

1b. 3D sculpt of alternative options (as stretched goal)

 

2. Printing than casting resin models

 

3. Professional painting (as special option)

 

All 3D sculpts has already been made. We need your help to invest in production molds and materials. Also stretch goals will help us raise finds to make some alternative versions and options for our miniatures, which for sure you will also like as base versions. 

We would like you to contribute during the development with your ideas. Please send emails (hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com), make comments here or post on Facebook, telling us any suggestions you may have. Your ideas will be base of mentioned before alternative options. Some of them we noticed during the development process but there is still a chance to integrate yours. You will feel that your ideas are coming alive.

As mentioned in the process example, for those of you that don't particularly enjoy painting miniatures and view it more as a chore that needs to be done, Hidden Dreams will also paint your miniatures with a color scheme of your choice and send you the finished models.



One last thing: the delivery times are an approximation. Everything should be delivered in time, but some things could be delayed, while others could be faster. The delivery times are flexible at this point and will be changed based on the demand for specific miniatures. We will do our best to provide them at least in May 2017 and this is a very real date.

 

So if you like the look of the miniatures below, please support us, so we can create them for you. If you know someone who might be interested, tell him/her about this crowdfunding campaign. Visit and like our Facebook page and please spread the word wherever you can.

And last but not least we would like to thank everyone who supports our company. We would also like to thank the crew of The 9th Age, and everyone who is involved in the development of that great project. See you all on battlefield!

 

Offer:

I - RAVEN CLOAKS

5 miniatures 20€

 

1b. Alternative will be unlocked after 200 sold Raven Cloaks models

 

 

II - Granadiers

20€ for Set of 4 x bodies; 5 x heads; 16 x hands; 4 x tails

35€ for Set of 8 x bodies; 10 x heads; 32 x hands; 8 x tails

65€ for Set of 16 x bodies; 20 x heads; 64 x hands; 16 x tails

 

III - Models from Lord and Heroes campaign

1. Scourge of Wrath / Daemon Prince

35€ standard / 90€ painted

 

2. Duke / Knight

15€ standard / 55€ painted

 

3.Lord of Fightin'

10€ standard / 30€ painted

 

IV - Models from Sylvan Elves campaign

You can find it here https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/hidden-dreams-sylvan-elves-miniatures-fantasy/x/14742063#/

and buy them by support that campaign with mentioned on Sylvan Elves site.

If you want some, let us know, we'll guide you.

 

With bigger orders it is possible to negotiate prices. Do not hesitate to email us. hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com or via other media

Payment is through PayPal, but if you prefer some other way, email us at hiddendreamsminiatures@gmail.com
 

Visit us also on

https://www.facebook.com/HiddenDreamsMiniatures

story:
Stay The Night!

Book of Taverns Three: Lion Rampant and Four Winds

Your heroes are going to be stopping at a tavern sometime; make it an interesting experience! With Book of Taverns Three you have a choice of two exciting places to stay the night and find adventure. Both of these unusual places offer NPCs to interact with, history and descriptions to add verisimilitude to your world, as well as hooks for adventure.

Lion Rampant, by Chris Jones, is a high-end tavern that caters to the local aristocracy and wealthy merchants, though they'll take the coin of well-heeled adventurers as well! Among the regular patrons is a deposed king from millennia in the future brought back by bizarre magics and the loyalists who want to help him back on to his throne. The tavern has a magical pantry that maintains a constant cold temperature, so be sure to try the iced drinks and out of season meats.

Four Winds, by Chris Jones, presents a tavern at an interdimensional crossroad. The place was created by — or perhaps is just under the ownership of — an enigmatic god of travelers and hospitality known as the Whiskey Man. Just step through an unassuming door in a wall and find yourself in this tavern of seemingly infinite floors and rooms. While the Whisky Man and his otherworldly staff will welcome you, be wary — creatures from all over the planes come here and not all are willing to abide by the law of peace. There is food and drink from a thousand worlds, but the grilled flying monkey is simply to die for.

________________________________________

The Project 

Necromancer Games  projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Book of Taverns: Volume Three and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the [ Necromancer Games / Frog God Games ] website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the [ Necromancer Games / Frog God Games ] web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping.

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different from the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

story:
Vanguard d100 is a set of role playing game rules and mechanics, which allow the players and Game Masters alike to play in just about any fantasy setting. Its potential lies in the introduction of game mechanics that allow an enormous freedom when it comes to creating and improving characters, rather than forcing players to wait dozens of game sessions before they can do so. No more ‘waiting months before leveling up’ or having to ‘end a story arc before gaining experience points’, sometimes only to get a small or an insignificant benefit.

It also gives great freedom when creating campaign settings, allowing you to remove certain sections and chapters without breaking game balance. For example, you could play a gritty historical campaign where magic has no place in the world and also without other fantasy inspired races. And if you want to play a “pirate inspired” campaign, you can find rules for early firearms as well!

In addition, the game's combat system is built around a system of quick turns which makes the gameplay extremely fast and fun.

 

The game itself is ready and this campaign is meant to help funding the costs of editing, proofreading and obviously to pay for the artwork. The more money it collects, the more it goes towards making it better and perhaps even expand it with rules for modern and sci-fi settings!

 

What is Vanguard d100 exactly?

Vanguard d100 is a role-playing game system that uses the d100 dice. Unlike many other, you don't try to roll 'under' a value, instead you use the easy-to-understand-and-handle rules of adding a modifier to your dice result and trying to beat a 'difficulty number' in order to succeed on your task. It has no classes, no levels and provides a set of rules that allow you to build your own spells.

 

A role playing game

In this type of game, players work together with the Game Master to create a story. The Game Master controls the world and all other characters while each player controls his or her own character and acts according to his or her interpretation of that character's personality. All players can work together or have hidden agendas.

As for the Game Master (GM), his or her job is to act as a referee and decide how the world and its characters/creatures react to the player's actions. The GM is the master, controlling the game flow to some extent and even deciding when, where and how rules apply or don't. If something doesn't fit the GM's vision, then that must be changed or removed.

Together with the players, the rules and the common sense, an adventure will be created which can last for many game sessions or just a few. In the end, the goal of the game is for everyone to have fun.

Neither the players nor the GM are forced to memorize the rules to play this game. Understanding the basics is more than enough to start playing, while using the rulebook as a reference tool during the game, to check things you don’t know.

 

Fantasy oriented rules

For the moment, Vanguard d100 covers only rules that can be used in fantasy or historical settings. The game includes many important features such as spells and unique magical items, runes, sigils and so on. All characters can count on several attributes and skills as their core abilities. Talents and equipment make up the rest.

In its pages you will find information about 16 different races! Unlike many other games of the genre, it includes several 'uncommon' races in its core rulebook, such as ogres and centaurs, which are balanced with all others.

The rules themselves are easy to understand: roll a d100 dice, add modifiers and compare the result with the number 100. If your total result is higher, you succeed in the task, otherwise you fail. However, there are degrees of failure and success, so be careful when attempting a task in which your character is weaker!

The rules cover many details like illumination and visibility, losing body parts, and even sanity for the lovers of horror-heavy campaigns! But as the GM you can skip many of the secondary rules and sections and use your best judgement. The core rules are simple.

 

No classes, no character levels

While classes and levels are an easy way to handle character progression, they are also the biggest barrier for character development. In many other RPGs, attempting to build mixed characters would make them very weak. Being a warrior for several levels and then taking a level as a spellcaster would weaken your warrior abilities while providing only a few meager spellcasting abilities (with spells that barely match the current level of the character). To counteract this, the publishers of such games eventually release dozens of other books with many variants in an attempt to provide 'character builds' that still fail to fulfill the needs of many players.

In Vanguard d100 you don't have to worry about that. Since you only use experience points, you can improve your characters anyway you want to, including mixing 'character roles'. And since you can build your own spells, you can be a skilled warrior and still have decent spells without weakening your character, as you would in the example above.

 

Fast and realistic combat

Vanguard d100 has various details that make the combat fast and more realistic when compared to other roleplaying games. Per turn, all creatures have one normal action, used to either attack, move, use abilities, items, etc, which speeds up the game. But don't worry, there are plenty of options to prevent you from simply spending your turns just moving to hit your enemy (attack while moving, charge, attack multiple opponents, etc). Thus the combat gives the feeling of every turn happening at the same time.

You won't roll many different attacks. Instead, a single attack roll means you attempt to hit as many times as possible, depending on your character's 'Attack Speed' (the higher, more re-rolls to hit you get).

Should you hit, you get to roll damage equal to 1d100 plus modifiers. Damage doesn't vary with weapon, instead what varies are statistics like critical hit, attack speed and armor penetration. In addition, every creature's Vitality starts at 100 + modifiers, so without significant increases, each blow has the potential to kill (especially if the blow turns out to be a critical hit or a massive hit that cuts off parts of the body)! Or at least to injure significantly causing the creature to suffer effects from pain. Fortunately, armor and the creature's physical resistance grant it a measure of 'Damage Reduction'.

All this is but a small taste of how combat works in Vanguard d100. It requires significant tactical thought as it can be very dangerous. But this also means your attacks are deadlier as well, so you get to dispose of your enemies faster and in greater style!

 

Build your own spells

With Vanguard, you will be able to build your spells anyway you want them to be. The rulebook presents you with many different spell components and all you have to do is add them together to create your spell. So yes, you could have a starting character capable of creating entire fire-storms over a city.

But with this freedom come great risks! As you create more powerful spells you increase their relative power (Spell Level) making it far more difficult to cast and control. Cast a spell too powerful and things can quickly get out of hand, with the spell backfiring and creating a different effect than intended (many of which can be quite fun, while others extremely harmful even for you). As an option, if you don't want rules for spell backfire, you can opt for a simpler one where spells will simply fail to take effect (also included in the rules).

Many more details

One thing you can count on: this game covers many details. From character advantages and flaws, to backgrounds you can select when creating your character. In many RPGs, age isn't a factor while in Vanguard d100 it is. Building an older character means more starting XP but less gained during the campaign. It also means more years lived, so more time to spend on many different backgrounds.

You can also find rules for cutting or breaking arms and legs as well as prosthetics, rules for improving weapons and armor without using magic, mechanics to handle 'luck' in your game, sanity rules to break the minds of your characters or simply give them access to incredibly powerful effects, early firearms such as cannons and muskets and so on.

And if you want to create races for your own settings, you can find rules for creating your own races.

 

Modular Game

Vanguard was created to be played in many different game settings, so its rules are generic. They are not tied to a specific world. Thus, you can remove various elements from the game without breaking its balance. For example, you can choose to remove magic completely from your game. 

There are more examples, of course. Luck and sanity are completely optional. You can choose to use only certain races, remove specific talents and skills, ignore rules for details like illumination, losing body parts, objects’ hardness, environmental hazards, magical runes, etc.

The rules are generic enough that can be used in many existing fantasy settings, with little adaptation.

 

Why use crowdfunding?

The book itself has more than 350 thousand words and it is estimated to have nearly 550 pages once illustrations are added.

 

The costs

Producing a RPG book carries a lot of costs and we are asking for your help and contribution. The campaign has no fixed goal, many of the costs have already been paid in advance. The funding goal is meant to recover some of those costs and cover as much of the rest as possible.

Here's a breakdown of some of the costs involved in this project.

  • Cover Art: $ 450.00
  • Logo Design: $ 150.00
  • Editing and Proofreading: $ 2,200.00
  • Interior Artwork: estimated around $ 7,500.00
  • IndieGoGo and Credit Card fees will accrue about 8% of total funding (plus 25 dollars from raising money in dollars to deposit in a Portuguese bank).
Obviously, reaching the initial goal won't be enough to cover all of these, since printing and distribution of manuals for backers will be necessary. But those costs will be supported by myself.
 
 

Pledge benefits

This crowdfunding campaign has many different pledges, all of which (including the smallest 1$ pledge) include benefits. All of them, including the 'rookie' pledge will give you a high-resolution print of the Vanguard d100 rulebook cover, created by Pedro I.

In addition, all the 'Knight' backers will be listed in the game’s website (which will be created if the stretch goals reach that level) while the 'Dragon Hunter', 'Archmage' and 'King' backers will be listed as such in the website and the rulebook itself.

Rookie - US$ 1

This pledge gives you access to the cover print.

Adventurer - US$ 15

If you only want a PDF version of the rulebook, then this pledge is for you.

Knight - US$ 55

This pledge will give you a PDF version of the rulebook, as well as a hardcover copy shipped to where you live.

Dragon Hunter - US$ 100

Want to see one of your characters come to life? With this pledge you will gain the PDF and the hardcover version of the rulebook, but we will also create a custom character, tailored to your vision and according to the Vanguard d100 rules, and an illustration will be created for it as well! The characters will be delivered to you in a PDF version of the character sheet.

In addition, if the stretch goal reaches that level, we will present the characters in the website created for this game (properly identified of course).

Archmage - US$ 150

This pledge is for those who want to have a character created for them, but also want to see that character in the rulebook itself! In addition, you will receive the PDF version of the rulebook, as well as the hardcover version printed in premium color!

King - US$ 200

In addition to the benefits of the 'Archmage' pledge, you will also receive a Game Master screen, which will include all the important tables and notes regarding the rules. Essential for those who want to have a complete experience when playing Vanguard d100 as the Game Master!

Emperor - US$ 250

In addition to the benefits of the 'King' pledge, you will also be invited to design unique magic items, weapons and abilities that will be introduced to the rulebook and properly identified as being your creation.

 

Fulfilled by DriveThruRPG

This project will be fulfilled through DriveThruRPG platform. PDFs will be sent as a coupon to add them freely to each contributors account. Contributors who pledge for print copies will receive a coupon to print their books at cost at DriveThruRPG website.

Expected retail cost of PDF version will be around US$ 25. The hardcover will be around US$ 40 plus shipping.

 

Stretch Goals

As previously stated, this flexible crowdfunding campaign has a main purpose: to cover many of the costs as best as possible, so the final rulebook will be an amazing work. However, there are many other things that can be done with increased funding.

US$ 5,000.00 - If this amount is reached, while not yet enough to cover all the illustration costs, a website will be created for this game. The website will include updates, news, lists of backers and possibly sample characters. In addition, depending on how this game is received, some monsters and enemies will be released for free in the website for everyone to use.

US$ 12,000.00 - Reaching this stretch goal will cover all the estimated costs to release an amazing rulebook and the rest will be used to create Vanguard d100 Spellcasting App. This App will allow you to easily create spells, using the rules from the Vanguard d100 rulebook. The app will be freely distributed for all those with the 'Knight' pledge or higher.

US$ 14,000.00 - Several monsters and NPCs will be released in a PDF free for all 'Dragon Hunter', 'Archmage' and 'King' backers. Also, the Vanguard d100 Spellcasting App will be released free for those with the 'Knight' pledge.

US$ 16,000.00 - With this stretch goal, a pre-made adventure will be created and distributed for free via website.

US$ 17,500.00 - A Vanguard d100 Digital Character Sheet will be created if this stretch goal is reached. It will be delivered for free to all backers regardless of pledge level. Also, the Vanguard d100 Spellcasting App will be released free for all backers regardless of pledge.

US$ 22,000.00 - If this stretch goal is unlocked, the Vanguard d100 Bestiary, which will include all monsters and NPCs, will be created and released. A PDF of the Bestiary will be delivered free for the 'Dragon Hunter' pledge or higher. All monsters released for free in the website will remain there and a few more will be added.

US$ 26,000.00 - With this stretch goal, a second pre-made adventure will be created and distributed for free via website.

US$ 30,000.00 - By reaching this goal, large scale warfare will be covered in the Vanguard d100 rules, in the form of a PDF supplement. It will be distributed free for everyone via the website!

US$ 40,000.00 - Vanguard d100 is a set of rules that can be used for any fantasy setting. But if this stretch goal is reached, the game will expand to cover rules for 'modern' settings! An entire new book will be created, with its own images and design. It will cover rules for modern vehicles, weapons, computers, modern buildings, sports and so on, and will give you rules to combine magic with the modern world. 

A PDF of this ruleset will be delivered free for 'Dragon Hunter' pledge or higher. Creating an entire new set of rules takes time, but I will dedicate my entire time to it, so this ruleset can be released no later than 12/2019.

US$ 60,000.00 - If this stretch goal is reached, Vanguard d100 will expand to have a sci-fi ruleset! Like the previous stretch goal, an entire new book will be created to cover rules such as cyber-warfare, spaceships, space travel and battles, futuristic weapons, space magic, exploration of strange new worlds, and many other rules!

A PDF of this ruleset will be delivered free for 'Dragon Hunter' pledge or higher. Creating an entire new set of rules takes time, but I will dedicate my entire time to it, so this ruleset can be released no later than 12/2020.

 

Other ways to help

There are other ways to help this project. Sharing it in your social media, mentioning it to your friends who like RPG and so on, will help spread the word about this project. And the more people know about it, the greater the chances of making it greater and better for everyone!

 

The team

João Paulo da Vinha Santos - The creator of Vanguard d100 with experience in creating roleplaying games. He is an engineer and an experienced Game Master with the luck of being able to play roleplaying games at least once a week.

Slaven Kovacevic - The graphic designer of the manual who is also a lover of roleplaying games. You can see some of his professional works here: https://www.behance.net/Zerror

Ignacio Corva - An extremely talented illustrator who loves to create fantasy-inspired images. You can find more of his work here: http://ncorva.daportfolio.com/gallery/802087

Pedro I. - Also an illustrator who excels in creating hand-drawn, highly detailed illustrations. You can contact him by his e-mail: pedroinock@gmail.com

 

Artwork credits

Most of the artwork used here and in the video was created by Ignacio Corva (colored images) and Pedro I. (cover, black & whites, sanity image) and will be used in the Vanguard d100 rulebook. Exception goes to the image of the medieval battle (which depicts the Battle of Toro), the photo of the flintlock pistol and the photo of the space shuttle. The print of another book's page was taken from the other game I created (see my profile for more information).

The music for the video was created by Samuel Cadima  (https://samuelcadima.bandcamp.com/)

Vanguard d100 logo designed by Spire Eaton: htps://twitter.com/spiremint?lang=ptt

 

Where we are

You can find a bit more information about Vanguard d100 in its Facebook page: 
https://www.facebook.com/VanguardIndigogo/
story_txt:
Vanguard d100 is a set of role playing game rules and mechanics, which allow the players and Game Masters alike to play in just about any fantasy setting. Its potential lies in the introduction of game mechanics that allow an enormous freedom when it comes to creating and improving characters, rather than forcing players to wait dozens of game sessions before they can do so. No more ‘waiting months before leveling up’ or having to ‘end a story arc before gaining experience points’, sometimes only to get a small or an insignificant benefit.
It also gives great freedom when creating campaign settings, allowing you to remove certain sections and chapters without breaking game balance. For example, you could play a gritty historical campaign where magic has no place in the world and also without other fantasy inspired races. And if you want to play a “pirate inspired” campaign, you can find rules for early firearms as well!
In addition, the game's combat system is built around a system of quick turns which makes the gameplay extremely fast and fun.
 
The game itself is ready and this campaign is meant to help funding the costs of editing, proofreading and obviously to pay for the artwork. The more money it collects, the more it goes towards making it better and perhaps even expand it with rules for modern and sci-fi settings!
 

What is Vanguard d100 exactly?
Vanguard d100 is a role-playing game system that uses the d100 dice. Unlike many other, you don't try to roll 'under' a value, instead you use the easy-to-understand-and-handle rules of adding a modifier to your dice result and trying to beat a 'difficulty number' in order to succeed on your task. It has no classes, no levels and provides a set of rules that allow you to build your own spells.
 

A role playing game
In this type of game, players work together with the Game Master to create a story. The Game Master controls the world and all other characters while each player controls his or her own character and acts according to his or her interpretation of that character's personality. All players can work together or have hidden agendas.

As for the Game Master (GM), his or her job is to act as a referee and decide how the world and its characters/creatures react to the player's actions. The GM is the master, controlling the game flow to some extent and even deciding when, where and how rules apply or don't. If something doesn't fit the GM's vision, then that must be changed or removed.
Together with the players, the rules and the common sense, an adventure will be created which can last for many game sessions or just a few. In the end, the goal of the game is for everyone to have fun.
Neither the players nor the GM are forced to memorize the rules to play this game. Understanding the basics is more than enough to start playing, while using the rulebook as a reference tool during the game, to check things you don’t know.

 

Fantasy oriented rules
For the moment, Vanguard d100 covers only rules that can be used in fantasy or historical settings. The game includes many important features such as spells and unique magical items, runes, sigils and so on. All characters can count on several attributes and skills as their core abilities. Talents and equipment make up the rest.
In its pages you will find information about 16 different races! Unlike many other games of the genre, it includes several 'uncommon' races in its core rulebook, such as ogres and centaurs, which are balanced with all others.
The rules themselves are easy to understand: roll a d100 dice, add modifiers and compare the result with the number 100. If your total result is higher, you succeed in the task, otherwise you fail. However, there are degrees of failure and success, so be careful when attempting a task in which your character is weaker!

The rules cover many details like illumination and visibility, losing body parts, and even sanity for the lovers of horror-heavy campaigns! But as the GM you can skip many of the secondary rules and sections and use your best judgement. The core rules are simple.
 

No classes, no character levels
While classes and levels are an easy way to handle character progression, they are also the biggest barrier for character development. In many other RPGs, attempting to build mixed characters would make them very weak. Being a warrior for several levels and then taking a level as a spellcaster would weaken your warrior abilities while providing only a few meager spellcasting abilities (with spells that barely match the current level of the character). To counteract this, the publishers of such games eventually release dozens of other books with many variants in an attempt to provide 'character builds' that still fail to fulfill the needs of many players.
In Vanguard d100 you don't have to worry about that. Since you only use experience points, you can improve your characters anyway you want to, including mixing 'character roles'. And since you can build your own spells, you can be a skilled warrior and still have decent spells without weakening your character, as you would in the example above.

 

Fast and realistic combat
Vanguard d100 has various details that make the combat fast and more realistic when compared to other roleplaying games. Per turn, all creatures have one normal action, used to either attack, move, use abilities, items, etc, which speeds up the game. But don't worry, there are plenty of options to prevent you from simply spending your turns just moving to hit your enemy (attack while moving, charge, attack multiple opponents, etc). Thus the combat gives the feeling of every turn happening at the same time.
You won't roll many different attacks. Instead, a single attack roll means you attempt to hit as many times as possible, depending on your character's 'Attack Speed' (the higher, more re-rolls to hit you get).
Should you hit, you get to roll damage equal to 1d100 plus modifiers. Damage doesn't vary with weapon, instead what varies are statistics like critical hit, attack speed and armor penetration. In addition, every creature's Vitality starts at 100 + modifiers, so without significant increases, each blow has the potential to kill (especially if the blow turns out to be a critical hit or a massive hit that cuts off parts of the body)! Or at least to injure significantly causing the creature to suffer effects from pain. Fortunately, armor and the creature's physical resistance grant it a measure of 'Damage Reduction'.
All this is but a small taste of how combat works in Vanguard d100. It requires significant tactical thought as it can be very dangerous. But this also means your attacks are deadlier as well, so you get to dispose of your enemies faster and in greater style!
 



Build your own spells
With Vanguard, you will be able to build your spells anyway you want them to be. The rulebook presents you with many different spell components and all you have to do is add them together to create your spell. So yes, you could have a starting character capable of creating entire fire-storms over a city.
But with this freedom come great risks! As you create more powerful spells you increase their relative power (Spell Level) making it far more difficult to cast and control. Cast a spell too powerful and things can quickly get out of hand, with the spell backfiring and creating a different effect than intended (many of which can be quite fun, while others extremely harmful even for you). As an option, if you don't want rules for spell backfire, you can opt for a simpler one where spells will simply fail to take effect (also included in the rules).


Many more details
One thing you can count on: this game covers many details. From character advantages and flaws, to backgrounds you can select when creating your character. In many RPGs, age isn't a factor while in Vanguard d100 it is. Building an older character means more starting XP but less gained during the campaign. It also means more years lived, so more time to spend on many different backgrounds.
You can also find rules for cutting or breaking arms and legs as well as prosthetics, rules for improving weapons and armor without using magic, mechanics to handle 'luck' in your game, sanity rules to break the minds of your characters or simply give them access to incredibly powerful effects, early firearms such as cannons and muskets and so on.

And if you want to create races for your own settings, you can find rules for creating your own races.
 

Modular Game
Vanguard was created to be played in many different game settings, so its rules are generic. They are not tied to a specific world. Thus, you can remove various elements from the game without breaking its balance. For example, you can choose to remove magic completely from your game. 
There are more examples, of course. Luck and sanity are completely optional. You can choose to use only certain races, remove specific talents and skills, ignore rules for details like illumination, losing body parts, objects’ hardness, environmental hazards, magical runes, etc.
The rules are generic enough that can be used in many existing fantasy settings, with little adaptation.
 



Why use crowdfunding?
The book itself has more than 350 thousand words and it is estimated to have nearly 550 pages once illustrations are added.
 
The costs
Producing a RPG book carries a lot of costs and we are asking for your help and contribution. The campaign has no fixed goal, many of the costs have already been paid in advance. The funding goal is meant to recover some of those costs and cover as much of the rest as possible.
Here's a breakdown of some of the costs involved in this project.


Cover Art: $ 450.00

Logo Design: $ 150.00

Editing and Proofreading: $ 2,200.00

Interior Artwork: estimated around $ 7,500.00
IndieGoGo and Credit Card fees will accrue about 8% of total funding (plus 25 dollars from raising money in dollars to deposit in a Portuguese bank).

Obviously, reaching the initial goal won't be enough to cover all of these, since printing and distribution of manuals for backers will be necessary. But those costs will be supported by myself.
 
 

Pledge benefits
This crowdfunding campaign has many different pledges, all of which (including the smallest 1$ pledge) include benefits. All of them, including the 'rookie' pledge will give you a high-resolution print of the Vanguard d100 rulebook cover, created by Pedro I.

story:
The InDemand campaign is over! Visit www.lostagegames.com to order Life & Legend! 

Hello! Thanks for taking a look at Life & Legend--The Adventure Card Game Of A Lifetime!

If you're interested, we have a free demo print & play, as well as review and playthrough videos. We'd also love it If you'd check out the kickstarter campaign page and our past updates to see how everything came to be.

If you have any questions please let us know!

It's great to be here on Indiegogo and we can't wait to connect with you! Thanks for your time and have a great day!

Adam & Cassandra @lostagegames

 

 

1 Custom Six-Sided Die, 1 Rules Reference Card, 3 Background Reference Cards

4 AI Opponent Cards, Adventures x 21, Relics x 23, Events x 29, Life Stories x 12

Life Paths x 12, Life Achievements x 12, Traits x 21, Exceptional Traits x 6

Traumas x 8, 1 Rulebook

 

 

 
 

 

Boardgames & Bourbon

" Existential dungeon crawl that uses word combos to achieve victory in an interesting way. "

" The game has enough different paths to victory that you can play it multiple times and it will feel fresh. "

 

Shuffle & Play

" Really nice. And I'm not just saying that because we've been recommended it. "

" The  {Background System}  is quite unique, and changes how you'll play your

game. "

" Some really nice elements...probably the print and play I've enjoyed most. " 

" Has some really, really neat mechanics. "

" Genuinely lovely artwork on the cards. " 

{Life & Legend portion begins around 1 hour 12 min mark}

No money has exchanged hands for these reviews

 

 

 

All stretch goals have been unlocked!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Adventurer Tier 

   (1 copy of Life & Legend + unlocked stretch goals.)

   USA: Free Shipping

   Canada: $10 (Canada Friendly Shipping)

   Global: $15 (EU Friendly Shipping)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

As life-long gamers, we've worked hard over the past three years to bring Life & Legend to the same level of quality as our most cherished tabletop games. The art and graphic design is finished, the game has been thoroughly playtested, and production has begun.

The only difficulties we anticipate would be on the production-side. Production delays are beyond our control, but we've taken every precaution to ensure that you will receive your product on time. We've done and will continue to do everything we can to make your experience with Lost Age Games hassle-free.

We want to bring Life & Legend to gamers all over the world. Your support will help and allow us to bring more of our exciting games to life.

We are very proud of what we've been able to accomplish here—not only in starting a new business and creating a fun new card game, but in experiencing all of the personal growth as a result. We've been challenged to learn many new skills, develop new relationships, and generally step outside of our comfort zones—because of this, Lost Age Games and Life & Legend has already been a massive success.

With Sincerity and Thanks,

The Lost Age Games Team

story:
Amazons Spartans decks (Ephebes and Ephoros editions) have been successfully funded on Kickstarter and will be printed by USPCC. 

 

The work on the design and art of this deck took almost a year. The idea of ​​making a deck dedicated to the Amazons arised a long time ago because these women warriors were a real historical fact. When creating the heroines, I did not try to strictly adhere to any rigorous historical reconstructions and costumes, but tried to imagine how beautiful these ancient warriors could have been. However, the characters' costumes and weapons are almost authentic. I made every effort to get really high quality cards and boxes, the most meticulous detailing and decoration.

The tuck box has its own insignia - it has the symbols of the shield and the spear, the minimal architectural components, as well as the Latin expressions of that era.

This deck will be the first in series of female Amazons. So far, the next two decks will be dedicated to Amazons Samurais and Amazons Vikings. This deck has 2 editions - Ephebes and Ephoros. Ephoros edition is the stretch goal - when unlocked you can choose any edition in your pledges.

Main features:

  • Printed by USPCC
  • 2 editions: Ephebes and Ephoros
  • Golden, Green and Black foils on the tuck box
  • Embossing on the tuck box
  • Custom Tuck Box, cards and back
  • Linen Finish
  • Classic Paper
  • Fulfillment through Gamblers Warehouse

 

 

Seventh Nation Atelier Team

Risks and challenges

This is the first time we're going to print the cards in the USA remotely and to send your card through fulfillment company Gamblers Warehouse. However, we do believe that there won't be any problems as we deal with professionals in this field. 
There are always risks related to production delays, shipping and sourcing issues, but there's nothing more important for us than getting your rewards delivered on time and as advertised. 
Colors in the final design may vary from those you see on your screens.
story_txt:
Amazons Spartans decks (Ephebes and Ephoros editions) have been successfully funded on Kickstarter and will be printed by USPCC.  The work on the design and art of this deck took almost a year. The idea of ​​making a deck dedicated to the Amazons arised a long time ago because these women warriors were a real historical fact. When creating the heroines, I did not try to strictly adhere to any rigorous historical reconstructions and costumes, but tried to imagine how beautiful these ancient warriors could have been. However, the characters' costumes and weapons are almost authentic. I made every effort to get really high quality cards and boxes, the most meticulous detailing and decoration.The tuck box has its own insignia - it has the symbols of the shield and the spear, the minimal architectural components, as well as the Latin expressions of that era.This deck will be the first in series of female Amazons. So far, the next two decks will be dedicated to Amazons Samurais and Amazons Vikings. This deck has 2 editions - Ephebes and Ephoros. Ephoros edition is the stretch goal - when unlocked you can choose any edition in your pledges.Main features:
Printed by USPCC
2 editions: Ephebes and Ephoros
Golden, Green and Black foils on the tuck box
Embossing on the tuck box
Custom Tuck Box, cards and back
Linen Finish
Classic Paper
