story:
Let the Stretch Goals Continue!!​

Every listed Backer quantity reached unlocks another unique creature into the compendium with draft level art. Every Funding level reached unlocks a Unique Creature and adds full-color art to one of the unlocked Creatures.

Whenever we reach one of these goals, the first person to announce it in the public comments, chooses which creature to unlock. If you are first to report it, choose a number to be unveiled. If I report it, I will generate a random number.


 

See the original campaign HERE:


  1. ​Leave your Mark! - Leave your signature, logo, or personal mark in the pages of After. The people that fund our projects in the year 2020 have the opportunity to forever be marked in its pages.
  2. There are 2 PDFs being created that you will have access to as perks, After 5e Scavenger's guide & After 5e Compendium. 
  3. The main perk and the goal of our 2020 Campaign is the production of a Limited Edition After 5e 2020 Core Book.
  4. Additionally, there is a quick adventure called The Scavenglands that you are eligible to receive.

This is the beginning of After, which is a sandbox waiting to be filled with various art to express the world that spans from the horrific and grotesque to the beautiful and serene. Keeping this project manageable while also providing a quick turn around with low-cost shipping was a HUGE goal, so I am only offering media items that are 90% completed.

After 5e Compendium

This document initially contains 8 Short Stories, 20 pieces of concept art displayed with its development phases and commentary, 38 Unique Creatures, & 30 NPCs of After. This item will increase in size as new creatures, and other contents are unlocked through stretch goals and follow-up campaigns until it is ready to become a printable book on its own. 

By selecting a pledge offering this item, you are eligible for FREE PDF UPDATES as new versions are released until this item is finalized in print.

We all have busy lives, get the characters created that we want to play and get to the story! Player's no longer need to roll stat blocks and hope they roll dice well enough to make the character they want to play. With the Genesis System, you choose a class and race combination that provides a stat array with Genesis Points to customize your in-game character. 

The Genesis System allows for diverse character development. You may even select multiple backgrounds because everything is negotiable using Genesis Points, enabling the GM to say, "Yes! For the right amount of Genesis Points, you may start your character the way you wish!"

Not every characteristic of your in-game character needs to cost Genesis Points. One of the most important choices is how your character looks and acts. If you utilize the mutation system, a player character may look any way the GM allows. It is not until a characteristic effects gameplay that Genesis Points will need to be involved.

While on the topic of mutations, each mutation changes based on the stage selected. No matter what stage the mutation is at, it is highly likely it scales with level as your character becomes more in tune with their abilities, making the mutation a real part of character development.

Being designed as a 5e-based system, there is nothing forcing any game table to use all the system mechanics listed in After. However, we took a different approach with magic, leaving the memorization of spell lists and minute details in the past.

Now, someone new to the game can play a character with magic ability without spending the entire session researching the book for the details of what they can and cannot do. Again, the GM may say, "Yes, you can try to create that effect. It is, after all, magic!"

Part of the approach is keeping the power-level of magic in the GM's hands, and since magic ebbs and flows, nothing is guaranteed, allowing the GM to keep the players in the story of each scenario.

There is much more that I cannot wait to discuss with everyone in detail.

  • Quick Mob Combat System
  • Customizable weapon creation
  • Greater Damage Dice
  • Simple Barter System
  • Luck
  • Story-Based Leveling
  • And a few more mods that add flavor to both environment and creature encounters 

There is so much to explore. The forgotten calamities, technology breakthroughs, and cultural shifts of the past make After so different from the world we knew while still providing a hint of familiarity adding that extra hint of excitement at the discovery of each new landscape.

The events of the past have left the world separated and fragile. Cultural and religious differences, as well as physical differences, tend to cause more strife than unity among people no longer at the top of the food chain.

Games in After are encouraged to start with the concept that the population has diminished to the point where 6,000 people is a large civilization, and where beyond 60 miles if another civilization exists, it likely embraces a very different culture centered around strict rules or some piece of technology that helped them survive over the centuries. One does not simply walk 60 miles in After without the real threat of being swallowed by the world or its many inhabitants.

We aim to keep discovery as thrilling as ever, where the unknown and fantastic waits around every turn. 

The timeline begins after the horde swarms have subsided, giving civilization a chance to rediscover the surface world; however, there are specific challenges that make a complete reboot of civilization near impossible.

The Wastkeen

Kord'emuri

These antagonists are unstable and unpredictable with their varying shapes and mutations. Kord'emuri are the most feared because of their proximity being virtually anywhere and the possibility they could be stalking you at any moment.

Dra'ken

The heights belong to the Dra'ken, but that does not mean they stay there. Creatures herding together or moving quickly across the terrain tend to attract their destructive attention. Similar to the Kord'emuri in temperament, like a moth to the flame, cannot resist the destruction of amassed technology.

International Shipping Friendly 

By limiting the scope of this project to media only enables us to ship international orders through Amazon at the above listed costs. We will do everything we can to get shipments to you at a reasonable cost.

USA Shipments

With current Postal Pricing US Shipping is estimated around $5. Larger packages may reach $15.

 

Risks & Challenges

I am extremely busy with work and family, but I am also very committed to satisfying expectations. With the help I have gained from Kickstarter, I believe all goals will be met readily, and with even more support and interest, we will get there so much quicker!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know this year has been difficult financially, and not everyone can contribute in that way, but your interest is enough and joining us online at Discord, Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram sharing your excitement for the project and forming a community developing art and concepts is what I would really love to see.

Also, Indiegogo provides tools to share the campaign to social media, so if you want to be a part please consider sharing what makes you excited about the coming of After!!

International Shipping Friendly 
By limiting the scope of this project to media only enables us to ship international orders through Amazon at the above listed costs. We will do everything we can to get shipments to you at a reasonable cost.
USA Shipments
With current Postal Pricing US Shipping is estimated around $5. Larger packages may reach $15.
 
Risks & Challenges
I am extremely busy with work and family, but I am also very committed to satisfying expectations. With the help I have gained from Kickstarter, I believe all goals will be met readily, and with even more support and interest, we will get there so much quicker!

Other Ways You Can Help
I know this year has been difficult financially, and not everyone can contribute in that way, but your interest is enough and joining us online at Discord, Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram sharing your excitement for the project and forming a community developing art and concepts is what I would really love to see.Also, Indiegogo provides tools to share the campaign to social media, so if you want to be a part please consider sharing what makes you excited about the coming of After!!

story:
Buying Add-ons: After the campaign ends you will then be able to select your options through your Backerkit survey. Backerkit will give you the option to add the extras at the cost labeled below. 

 

You'll play as your favorite Evil Dead 2 characters (and Jake) as you explore the cabin for missing pages of the Ex-Mortis. If you find all of the pages, you can open a portal to banish the Kandarian Demons and win the game. But you will have to face Deadites, demons, Ash’s Freaking Hand!, that tree, and the deadite versions of your fellow players to do it!

Print and play Cards: http://evildead2boardgames.com/wp-content/uploa...

Rules: http://evildead2boardgames.com/wp-content/uploa...

 

 

 

 

                     

 

 

 

Created in 2006, Space Goat Productions has decades of combined experience producing comic books, TV, animation, video games, commercial art, and concept design. This past year, Space Goat began production on board games for both the Evil Dead and Terminator franchises, and has since acquired The Howling along with a few other top secret licenses soon to be announced. Space Goat has transformed from the industry's premier service provider, to a highly successful comic book and board game publisher.

Some of the top game and horror press outlets like Comic Book Resources, Deadites Online, HorrorFuel, iHorror, Bloody Disgusting, Popcorn Horror and MovieWeb have covered the game, and here's what other press has had to say about it:

"Our dream of giving deadite scum a fistful of boomstick from the comfort of our own living rooms is about to come a reality." - Dread Central

"An 'Evil Dead 2' card game is coming—and it looks super groovy" - The Daily Dot

"...an official tile and figure based survival game that every Evil Dead fan is going to want to own." -GoresTruly

"Much like a more bad-ass, interactive version of Clue.." - Wicked Horror

"[With} the idea that the players are working together but they can turn against their friends and you have an interesting concept for a game" - Beasts of War

"Smells like a cash-in." -Some guy on Reddit

"As unappealing as any form of game is to me at this point in life, I’d jump at the opportunity to pick this one up...I’m certain a great deal of genre fans would strangle a Deadite to get their hands on this beauty!" - HorrorFreak News 

"Here’s one that, I’m sure, will get a lot of people going, 'Oh, I’m soooooo going to be backing that!!'" - Tabletop Gaming News

"[It] looks like it will be a frightening twist on family game night." - Daily Dead

Here's a listicle from our boss you can read and share around social media.

Shipping will be charged after the Indiegogo Campaign ends based on actual shipping costs and is collected via Backerkit. This allows us to charge shipping fairly for all backers and avoid a 'one size fits all' mentality to shipping. 

Below are shipping estimates for the core game (estimated to be around 3lbs). These are just estimates. Costs may rise due to weight increase as more items are unlocked via stretch goals and add-on purchases you choose. This will be calculated by Backerkit after backer surveys are turned in.

  • USA - $20
  • EU (including UK) - $20.00
  • Canada - $20
  • AU - $35
  • Mexico - $35
  • Most other countries - $35

We proudly offer EU-Friendly shipping!

story:
THE CONCEPT

The Cluebox is an interactive, manually assembled wooden box with various puzzles, which have to be solved one after the other to open the box. Very much like an Escape Room in a handy format! The solution to each and every puzzle is based not on randomness, but only on logical decisions.

The Cluebox is an intriguing challenge. It's difficult to solve, satisfying to hold, and beautiful to display.

 

 

The facts about the game:

Special edition in multi-color available only for Kickstarter campaign

  • Size: 11*11*12 cm
  • Age: 14+
  • Players: 1-2
  • Play time: 60-90 minutes
  • Can be reset and solved again by other players
  • Can also be used as a sophisticated gift wrap (size of the gift space is 45mm*60mm*10mm)
  • Language independent

THE STORY

Davy Jones' Locker.

London, 1720. Ian Kensington, captain of the British Engineering Forces, is responsible for the first successful recovery of a sunken ship. In the report to His Majesty King George I of England, Kensington mentions Davy Jones' locker for the first time.

 

Despite it being a real artifact, he describes the locker in the context of a legend about the sea devil Davy Jones, who supposedly locks away the wandering souls of all sailors who lose their lives at the sea. It is told that on each sunken ship, he hides a replicate of the locker, promising to release all souls if someone manages to open the box.

 

Since the first find, similar lockers were found in shipwrecks scattered around the world. Some of them are still kept in private collections, others in museums. However, nobody has been able to reveal their secret so far.

We are sure that you are the one, who will finally be able to open the locker and force Davy Jones to admit his defeat.

 

THE DESIGN AND PRODUCTION

 

According to Davy Jones he decided to create a special version of the box and release it to the community of Kickstarter. His crafty and intrepid team of developers has spent the last eight months designing and testing this special version of the locker. The team explored a wide variety of interlocks and functionalities, and ultimately settled on a final version which was confirmed by Davy Jones as the most sophisticated version of his locker. 

 

We will not hide that our team participated in the creation of the box, but even we don't have the details how to open it as the final mechanisms were personally crafted by the Sea Devil. In any case the Cluebox „Davy Jones Locker“ is our most complex project to date— both from a design and manufacturing perspective. The puzzle is made with loving care out of birch wood and wood oil, consists of 72 individual parts assembled with care by hand.

 

TEAM

Our international team of game and puzzle enthusiasts, mainly based in Germany, established in 2015 company  and developed several innovative board game and puzzles focusing in escape games niche. Today we're very excited to present our first Kickstarter and will appreciate your support to bring our product to life. 

 

Pirate music theme credit to Ross Bugden

Package design Federico Meloni/Chris Lattner

Meet our team member locked in Davy Jones' cabinet and requested to announce start of the campaign.

 

Other iDventure Puzzles

 

  •  Cluebox - Schrödinger’s cat 

Schrödinger’s cat is a thought experiment by the Austrian physicist Erwin Schrödinger that illustrates the problem of quantum mechanics in every day objects. In this experiment, a cat and some poison are locked in a closed box.

According to Quantum Mechanics after a while the cat will be both dead and alive. Only by looking at the object, in this case the cat, the status will be determined. 

Unfortunately, Schrödinger completely forgot the cat because of his busy daily routine.

We are sure that the cat is still alive, and you must save it!

  • Box size: 11*11*12cm
  • Secret space size: 1,5*4,5*8cm
  • Play time: 45-60 min

 

  • Cryptex (wooden kit)

Cryptex is a portable vault used to hide secret messages. We have produced it as wooden kit, giving you the opportunity to build it on your own, get insights on it's mechanics and of course hide secret message as a present or as part of the a game. 

Size: 10,5*6 cm

Our Cryptex can be easily reset and the secret word can be set to any word up to 6 letters. 

Secret space size: 2*2*8 cm

 

REWARDS

TIMELINE

Delivery will be in February-March 2021

Shipping and Taxes

Every backer is important to us, regardless of location. The reality is that shipping and sales taxes are expensive. To offset this we worked with our shipping partners to get the best conditions for our bakers.  

For the EU your rewards will be sent duty-free from within your region - there will be no additional customs charge. We cannot guarantee customs-friendly shipping in areas outside of the EU. There maybe additional duties and/or fees charged by your country’s governmental agencies and/or shipping partners. Those fees are solely your responsibility, and we can neither cancel a shipped pledge, nor will we pay those fees. In the event that a package is returned or destroyed due to the non-payment of such fees, your pledge will be considered fulfilled.

Shipping charges will be added after the campaign ends - every backer will be responsible for paying these in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.

Approximate shipping prices listed in the table below, but subject to change based on the pledge size.

 

Risks and challenges

At iDventure, we have a lot of experience fulfilling large orders on strict timelines. After the overwhelming success of our first Cluebox and delivery to over 20 countries we are even more confident in our ability to deliver the Cluebox to our backers on time. In the unlikely scenario that unexpected delays arise, we will maintain clear and open communication with our supporters to keep them informed.

We have produced it as wooden kit, giving you the opportunity to build it on your own, get insights on it's mechanics and of course hide secret message as a present or as part of the a game. Size: 10,5*6 cmOur Cryptex can be easily reset and the secret word can be set to any word up to 6 letters. Secret space size: 2*2*8 cm REWARDSTIMELINEDelivery will be in February-March 2021Shipping and TaxesEvery backer is important to us, regardless of location. The reality is that shipping and sales taxes are expensive. To offset this we worked with our shipping partners to get the best conditions for our bakers.  For the EU your rewards will be sent duty-free from within your region - there will be no additional customs charge. We cannot guarantee customs-friendly shipping in areas outside of the EU. There maybe additional duties and/or fees charged by your country’s governmental agencies and/or shipping partners. Those fees are solely your responsibility, and we can neither cancel a shipped pledge, nor will we pay those fees. In the event that a package is returned or destroyed due to the non-payment of such fees, your pledge will be considered fulfilled.Shipping charges will be added after the campaign ends - every backer will be responsible for paying these in the pledge manager after the campaign ends.Approximate shipping prices listed in the table below, but subject to change based on the pledge size. Risks and challengesAt iDventure, we have a lot of experience fulfilling large orders on strict timelines. After the overwhelming success of our first Cluebox and delivery to over 20 countries we are even more confident in our ability to deliver the Cluebox to our backers on time. In the unlikely scenario that unexpected delays arise, we will maintain clear and open communication with our supporters to keep them informed.

story:
A notorious treasure-hunter seeks brave adventurers to assist him in acquiring valuables from a recently discovered ruined temple in the middle of the sea. The ancients of Atrotiri were said to have incredible knowledge, power, artifacts, magic, and more … before the sea swallowed their civilization. It was said they made pacts with evil beings and reaped tremendous rewards, now lost to history. Can your heroes retrieve the lost treasures — or will they and their belongings add to a future archaeologist’s find?

Temple of Dagon by James Thomas is an adventure for 5e D&D, Swords & Wizardry (OD&D), and Pathfinder 1e. Recommended for four to six characters of levels 6–8.

Temple of Dagon features: 

  • An adventure on the salty sea with Atlantean-styled mysteries and history 
  • 25 encounter areas in sunken ruins, an observatory, and the Temple of Dagon. 
  • 4 new mundane and magic items 
  • Two useful handouts 

The Project 

Necromancer Games  projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarters with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We still use Kickstarter frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Temple of Dagon and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing Indiegogo perk PDF items. The PDF files are distributed directly into your Frog God Games Library through our web store. You will need to have a customer account at www.froggodgames.com to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this at help@lessergnome.com

After the project ends a second coupon is provided allowing supporters' digital rewards to be included in their DriveThruRPG.com PDF library.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

For the last several months, as those of you who follow us on Discord know, we have been grappling with the issue of high costs on shipping to locations outside the USA. We have decided that the most cost-effective way for our overseas customers to get books is by printing the books in print-on-demand format. This does not affect the USA, where we will continue ordinary printing and shipping.

The print-on-demand books international customers will be receiving are high quality, but please be aware that they are different from the premium-quality books we are advertising for sale in the USA.

We have tremendous love and respect for our international customers, and this is the most workable way we have been able to find to keep you supplied with books with reliable delivery times at a reasonable price.

story:
It is midsummer, and the remote mountain village of Ilgaardd is preparing to throw an epic celebration to honor the anniversary of its independence from the tyrannical rule of Killoran the Red. While most of the villagers are happy with the new leadership and are excited about the prospect of hosting a major event, droves of raucous outsiders, bitter loyalists, and an unprecedented heat wave are causing tensions to mount.  You have been hired by the local sheriff to keep the peace. To do your job, you will have to contend with rowdy villagers at each other’s throats and a towering force on the cusp of raising its haunted form high above the Village Green! 

Inspired by (dangerous!) early American traditions of lighting bonfires to celebrate Independence Day, the characters are the only hope that Illgaardd will remain standing by dawn’s early light.

The characters are hired by Jax Blueskin, chief constable of the remote village of Ilgaardd, to keep the peace during the village’s Independence Day celebration. The characters must contend with increasingly rowdy villagers only to discover a nefarious plot devised by Killoran the Red, the village’s presumed-to-be-dead former ruler. If not stopped, this plot will unleash a force so terrible that the village — and possibly the region — may be utterly destroyed. By Dawn’s Early Light is a short adventure for 4–6 low-level characters.

We are on schedule to deliver the PDF by July 4th to light up your Independence Day!

New for Dawn’s Early Light: Roll20® Compatible Version!

You can purchase this complete Roll20® Compatible adventure at the discounted price of $9 (it will be $10 on the Roll20® Marketplace) during the IGG. This version includes all the maps, art, and text as the PDF and print 5e versions, as well as tokens.  If you want just the Roll20® compatible package select that perk and finish your checkout. If you want a PDF and/or print version AND Roll20® (and really, why wouldn’t you), please purchase the PDF or Print version and then add the Roll20® Compatible during check out.

Note: Roll20® is not responsible for the creation or timely delivery of this content. 

The Project 

Frog God Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print-on-demand printing that does not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for By Dawn's Early Light and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Roll 20 Files

A code allowing you to purchase By Dawn’s Early Light directly from the Roll20® Marketplace at no additional cost will be emailed to you after the closing of the IndieGoGo project. It will be provided via a Constant Contact communication to the email address you provided to Indiegogo.

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
An Adventure for Fantasy Role-Playing Games

Adventure in an Interplanar Realm

Lost Menagerie is a challenging adventure for characters of 7th to 9th level*, written by Mike Mearls, one of the two Lead Designers of Fifth Edition Dungeons & Dragons.

In the distant past, the great wizard Arfaleo the Seeker claimed favors from four mighty elemental lords to create a self-contained world. The wizard populated his microcosm with strange creatures, to monitor what changes might occur to them over time, even bringing a small settlement of humans into the interplanar cavern. Eventually, though, the wizard’s interest in his experiment waned and he moved on, leaving behind the bizarre anomaly he had created.

Since this time, the microcosm has changed in many ways, for it did not remain isolated from other planes of existence. New creatures have made their way into the wizard’s carefully-maintained experiment, and — there is no other way to say it — things have gone very wrong.

This adventure module is available for 5th edition, Pathfinder first edition, and Swords & Wizardry (OD&D).

*For Swords & Wizardry, the module is for characters level 6-8.

What's inside? Adventure!

  • A lost plane of existence, abandoned for centuries by its creator
  • Another sun, shining upon a strange, jungle oasis.
  • The realm of a bizarre lich, and his twisted zoo, filled with mutated creatures
  •  A sandbox adventure where terrible creatures dwell, and the tribes of the deep wander free
  • Designed to fit into any fantasy setting
  • Contains three adventure locations (all mapped), a small village under threat, and many challenges to overcome.

 

COVID-19 Effect: The printing for this adventure is done by a family-owned shop in Arizona, where a shelter-in-place order is in effect, making us one of their largest customers. Sales like this also allow us to keep a stream of income moving to our freelance artists, authors, layout artists, and editors during the shut-downs. Frog God will come out of this crisis intact, so this isn't a "keep the doors open" plea, but we want to let you know that your purchase is one that you can feel comfortable about. It directly affects small businesses and households. We hope that all of you remain safe and well for the duration!

 

The Project 

Necromancer Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

 

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for Lost Menagerie and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Necromancer Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Necromancer Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

It directly affects small businesses and households. We hope that all of you remain safe and well for the duration! The Project Necromancer Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.
Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
Limited to a single title
Have options priced between $5-$30
Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit
*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.Why the Tiny Print Run?Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.Why not use Kickstarter?We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions. Product enhancements tied to project success During the funding period for Lost Menagerie and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.Examples of improvements made to earlier products:
Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.
 Project DeliveryPDF PerksWe will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Necromancer Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Necromancer Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.Softcover PerksSoftcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo.  Overseas ShippingNOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
The Devil of the Murder Cliffs

The Devil of the Murder Cliffs is an adventure for mid-level characters available now for print in 5 th edition, Swords & Wizardry, and classic Pathfinder for the first time!

NOTE: There is no PDF only option as the 5e and Swords & Wizardry versions of the PDF versions of The Devil of the Murder Cliffs are currently available. When the promotion ends the finished PDFs will be distributed. The Pathfinder version will deliver as soon as it is finished.


 

Overview

Tribes of bandits stalk the mountain passes along the Murder Cliffs, bringing the flow of precious silver to the civilized lands below to a trickle. Adventurers are quickly called upon to handle the bandit menace. Their target, the notorious bandit lord, Captain Kraties, the self-styled Devil of the Murder Cliffs. Their exploration quickly leads them into the haunted peaks where they face challenges both physical and supernatural as they seek to bring their quarry to justice.
Frog God Games is proud to introduce to print for the first time The Devil of the Murder Cliffs in 5th Edition, Swords & Wizardry, and classic Pathfinder. Previously available in small digital release for 5th Edition the manuscript has been re-formatted from its digital release with additional artwork and better presentation quality.

What to Expect

The Devil of the Murder Cliffs pays homage to silver age pulp fantasy authors of the 1960’s and 70’s and has many plot twists and turns to keep the characters on their toes. It is written by RPG adventure design stalwart Casey W. Christofferson, author of City of Brass, Bard’s Gate and dozens of other products for various publishers over the last 18 years in the gaming industry.
Within its cover you will find:

  • New creatures and magic items
  • A challenging man-hunt through bandit infested mountains
  • Supernatural foes
  • NPCs who may be allies or antagonists
  • Full-Color Map by Robert Altbaur
  • Interior art by Casey Christofferson, Josh Stewart, and Lloyd Metcalf
  • Brilliant cover art by newcomer phenomenon Adrian Landeros


The Devil of the Murder Cliffs uses the same formula introduced in previous Indiegogo releases. These focused enhancements (stretch goals), improve the product as total funding increases with new art, extra written encounters, and digital play enhancing extra such as player handouts, NPC profiles, and interviews with creators.

 

The Tiny Print Run

Why Indiegogo?

Frog God Games is continuing the use of this indiegogo crowdfunding method for The Devil at Murder Cliffs This method is almost the inverse of how we design our crowdfunding projects on Kickstarter. We call it the 'Tiny Print Run'.

Thus, Indiegogo projects by Frog God Games will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Design all stretch goals and project bonus' affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means 100 pound glossy interior pages with a thick, glossy cardstock cover. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects. These smaller projects are happening in response to the feedback we have heard from both fans and 'almost' fans alike. We hear the request for less expensive options for our projects and products all the time. A second frequent desire expressed to us, whether at conventions, on social media or in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not necessitate a full two year campaign.

Additionally, Frog God Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. 

 

Project Reward

With the wishes of the fans in mind, this and future Indiegogo projects will fund standalone projects that are both affordable and fun. This project, as well future Tiny Print Run projects, is narrowly focused with all stretch goals adding resources to the principle reward which traditionally would not be feasible for a publisher our size. 

Examples of Enhancements from Higher Funding

During the 14 day primary project period for The Devil at Murder Cliffs and after the $1000 goal is met the focus will be to improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of the planned extras that increased funding would bring to The Devil at Murder Cliffs -

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project, Mystery at Ravenrock, added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
Discover the myths and legends of Irish folklore in the MourneQuest boardgame, which is based on the novel by Garry McElherron.
A cooperative game for 1 to 4 players with an average playing time 60-90 minutes.

Players assume the roles of the book's heroes and must journey in the Mourne Mountains to work together to defeat the evil Shimnavore before it is too late.

On their quest they’ll encounter many enemies, including infuriating Bogbeans and terrifying Nightmares like the Banshee, the Changeling and the Dullahan. To triumph, heroes must gather charms, equipment and magical relics, to increase their powers and use their skills and combat abilities effectively.

Comments from industry leading reviewers


There are six hero characters to choose from.

Each brings something different to the game with various levels of Courage, Strength & Magic and a unique skill they can use during the quest. Heroes can also find some relics such as weapons, jewelry and perhaps a magical dandelion clock left behind by the Elder-folk, which they can use to improve their chances against their enemies. 

At the start of a game players chose a hero to play, and take the matching Character Card and miniature. During the quest, they must make sure to visit the Nexus Points to gather weapons and items to increase their starting abilities and make themselves into more formidable warriors. By the end of the quest, your team of heroes should be ready to take on the Shimnavore with all the skills and weapons they’ve accumulated! 

During MourneQuest many enemies will be out to hinder, hurt or destroy the heroes.

First it will be the pestering Bogbeans, who will more often attempt to steal than to kill; but as the heroes strive to free the terrifying Nightmares, tougher Bogbeans will be spawned and stand in their way. If the heroes cannot Cast-out the Nightmares before they are released into the Kingdom of Mourne, they will then be forced to fight them and suffer misery or even death, from their evil powers. On the Enemies’ Phase, enemies move and attack the nearest hero, more are spawned and occasionally relics are revealed. But do you risk collecting a relic when a Nightmare is close by?

There are three types of Bogbeans in MourneQuest.

The first, and smallest are the Snipes. They stand about one foot in height and have mottled brown skin with yellow stripes. The second type are Speedwells. They look a lot like a white mole, but despite having a well know taste for worms, they are far from harmless. Beware ….

Finally, there are the Worts! Worts are tough, three legged creatures that like to sneak up on you, do their devilment and leave you in a very bad way… Bogbeans are out to steal your loot, but if you fend them off, they will probably drop items that they were carrying, so you can grab it for yourself.

And then there are the Nightmares!

These powerful foes are at the behest of the Shimnavore and if not Cast-out from its grip, will break into the Kingdom of Mourne and hunt down the heroes. Irish mythology has foretold of these creatures, no-one believed it…but they are real, terrifying and wanting to destroy. Each Nightmare has an Evil Power which they get to use on the heroes during the Enemies Phase.

Nightmares attack with great power and must be beaten on each ability of Courage, Strength and Magic before being defeated. So, its best to gather the Charms required to cast them out before they come after you.

The dreaded Shimnavore, trapped within the Silver Orb, bound by the Mighty Mourne Wall is stirring. It calls to all manner of evil nightmares to aid in its escape. The Elderfolk wizards are long gone, so it’s up to young Jack Turner and a few friends of the Hawksbeard Clan to stop them. But time is not on their side, evil magic is being used against them and their skills are untested against such formidable enemies.

Can they release the Nightmares, defeat the Shimnavore and save the Mourne Wall before it’s too late?

All combat in MourneQuest is resolved with a single dice roll. There are four levels of Combat dice. Players add the dice results, together any extras from equipment, to their chosen ability level for each fight, (either Courage, Strength or Magic). They must equal or better their opponent's ability level which can vary depending on the current phase of the Moon to win. 

Relics can give heroes additional power or abilities to increase their chances in battle.

MourneQuest will be manufactured in China, with one of Backspindle Games' long-term production partners, ensuring the highest quality of game components. The most complex components are the miniatures. Poducing quality miniatures is a long process, which will require us to approve samples and then check the final production quality. Estimated production start date is about 3-4 weeks after the campaign ends and the lead time for most components is 90 days. The custom dice, miniatures and all deluxe edition components may add up to 25 extra days, but we're confident that final delivery time will not be affected.

We plan to have copies for UK Games Expo 2019, so the turnaround on this will be as fast as we can manage.

story:
Stay The Night!

Book of Taverns One: The Trireme and Vain Robert's Gibbet

Your heroes are going to be stopping at a tavern sometime, right? All adventurers need a drink some time, and with this book it's not hard to turn a pint of the local ale into a memorable gaming experience! Book of Taverns One  gives you a choice of two exciting places to stay the night, find adventure, and (let's face it) probably burn the place down. That's why we include two of them - one's a burn-down, and the other one is for hiding from the city watch. Both of these taverns offer NPCs for the characters to interact with (or slay), a diverting history, and convenient descriptions, as well as adventure hooks that will be so irresistible to the greedy characters that the clerics and paladins will have no choice in the matter.

 

The Trireme (11 pages, color cover, color interior) by Chris Jones presents a quiet tavern just outside of town, dedicated to philosophical debates, epicurean delights, and a private drinking room. Local philosophers are welcomed here as long as they can pay their tab, and visitors to the tavern can expect to be embroiled in some lively debate as to the nature of the world and the soul. Try the pecan cakes, but save some money for the extensive wine list. Or burn the place down - it's always an option.

 

Vain Robert's Gibbet (11 pages, color cover, color interior) by Chris Jones is a scurvy dive bar on the docks. Those passing by usually speed their steps, for only the lowest class of sailors stop in for a drink here. The tavern keeper doesn't mind at all, since Vain Robert's Gibbet is only the front for a coven of elite seafarers who battle a growing evil out in the depths of the sea. Note: this one would be more dangerous to burn down.

The Project 

Necromancer Games is continuing the use of this INDIEGOGO with The Book of Taverns: Volume One. Necromancer Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short, designed for easy, flexible use at the game table.

Thus, INDIEGOGO projects by Necromancer Games will-

  • Be short in duration
  • Be limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Designed so that all stretch goals and project bonuses affect the principle reward ONLY (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

 

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012, our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious, with massive page counts, numerous add-on options, and plentiful stretch goals. Many of these supported primary titles with as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarters with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books, often with dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome, BUT ... they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We still use Kickstarter for our large-scale projects. Smaller projects like this one are happening in response to feedback we've gotten from fans like you. We hear the request for less-expensive options for our projects and products all the time. Another thing people have asked for at conventions, on social media and in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not require long time commitments.

Additionally, Necromancer Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. 

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the 14 day primary project period for The Book of Taverns: Volume One and after the $1000 goal is met we will  improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements or additional content increased funding would bring to The Book of Taverns: Volume One -

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Necromancer (Frog God) Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Necromancer Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS
story_txt:
Stay The Night!

Book of Taverns One: The Trireme and Vain Robert's Gibbet
Your heroes are going to be stopping at a tavern sometime, right? All adventurers need a drink some time, and with this book it's not hard to turn a pint of the local ale into a memorable gaming experience! Book of Taverns One  gives you a choice of two exciting places to stay the night, find adventure, and (let's face it) probably burn the place down. That's why we include two of them - one's a burn-down, and the other one is for hiding from the city watch. Both of these taverns offer NPCs for the characters to interact with (or slay), a diverting history, and convenient descriptions, as well as adventure hooks that will be so irresistible to the greedy characters that the clerics and paladins will have no choice in the matter.
 
The Trireme (11 pages, color cover, color interior) by Chris Jones presents a quiet tavern just outside of town, dedicated to philosophical debates, epicurean delights, and a private drinking room. Local philosophers are welcomed here as long as they can pay their tab, and visitors to the tavern can expect to be embroiled in some lively debate as to the nature of the world and the soul. Try the pecan cakes, but save some money for the extensive wine list. Or burn the place down - it's always an option.
 
Vain Robert's Gibbet (11 pages, color cover, color interior) by Chris Jones is a scurvy dive bar on the docks. Those passing by usually speed their steps, for only the lowest class of sailors stop in for a drink here. The tavern keeper doesn't mind at all, since Vain Robert's Gibbet is only the front for a coven of elite seafarers who battle a growing evil out in the depths of the sea. Note: this one would be more dangerous to burn down.

The Project 
Necromancer Games is continuing the use of this INDIEGOGO with The Book of Taverns: Volume One. Necromancer Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short, designed for easy, flexible use at the game table.
Thus, INDIEGOGO projects by Necromancer Games will-

Be short in duration
Be limited to a single title
Have options priced between $5-$30
Designed so that all stretch goals and project bonuses affect the principle reward ONLY (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
Be the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
Have simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color in the cover illustrations. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.
Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.
 
Why the Tiny Print Run?
Since 2012, our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious, with massive page counts, numerous add-on options, and plentiful stretch goals. Many of these supported primary titles with as many as 990 pages.
This has resulted in Kickstarters with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books, often with dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome, BUT ... they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.
Why not use Kickstarter?
We still use Kickstarter for our large-scale projects. Smaller projects like this one are happening in response to feedback we've gotten from fans like you. We hear the request for less-expensive options for our projects and products all the time. Another thing people have asked for at conventions, on social media and in email, is for a larger selection of smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions and not require long time commitments.
Additionally, Necromancer Games has grown in both sales and brand awareness.  This opportunity will give us the additional resources to invest in the very best books in all of our formats. 
Product enhancements tied to project success 
During the 14 day primary project period for The Book of Taverns: Volume One and after the $1000 goal is met we will  improve the delivered product. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases the better the final product will be for everybody.
Examples of improvements or additional content increased funding would bring to The Book of Taverns: Volume One -

Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
Printed Player map(s)/Insert. This is one we would love to do but it would require a substantial increase in overall project funding.
Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 
Project Delivery
PDF Perks
We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Necromancer (Frog God) Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.
The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Necromancer Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.
Softcover Perks
Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 
 
Overseas Shipping
NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.
To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
Kraken miniatures would like to present their BB / fantasy football Halloween - Carnival 28 mm miniature range

Boo!!

my name is Rykar Jové I'm the sculptor on this project I have worked on a number of projects within the Fantasy Football gaming industry. My most recent large scale project was the Necronomicon set of miniatures that was produced and retailed by Impact Miniatures

 

I would like to present my first solo project through my company Kraken Miniatures. The goal was to provide some alternative fun miniatures that could be used in a variety of fantasy football games
I hope you like them!!!
 
 
 
The miniatures that will be produced in this initial range are as follows:-
 
-The secret weapons set (4 minis):

Orc Leather-Face Chainsaw

Bomber Green Gobbo

Gobbo Spider-Pogo

Gobbo Thor – Ball & Chain

 

-The Halloween - Carnival set (4 minis):

Iron Dwarf

Master Gobbo

Gobbo Gremlin chainsaw

elf scissorshands

 

-The Mekanik Troll (model Mad-Max)

 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
All of these miniatures will be limited run of maximum 300 units in metal for each miniature, for the set secret weapons and 150 units in metal for the set Halloween - Carnival
 
 
PROJECT GOAL = $3500.00
 
 
 
Pledge $8.00 or more for your choice of 1 Gobbo Miniature (either Iron dwarf or elf scissorshands, master Gobbo or Gobbo gremlin chainsaw; Chain your choice)
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 for Europe and $8,00 from U.S.A. and Australia
 
 
 
Pledge $9.00 or more for your choice of 1 Gobbo Miniature (either Orc leather face ,Bomber Green Gobbo, Gobbo Spider-Pogo or Gobbo Thor Ball & Chain your choice)
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 for Europe ,$8.00 from U.S.A. and Australia
 
 
 
 
Pledge $15.00 or more for the Crazy Drivers package which includes 1 x  Bomber Green Gobbo and 1 x Gobbo Spider-Pogo
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 for Europe ,$8.00 from U.S.A. and Australia
 
 
 
 
Pledge $22.00 or more for the Gobbo Group package which includes all 3 Gobbo miniatures (1 x Bomber Green Gobbo, 1 x Gobbo Spider-Pogo & 1 x Gobbo Thor Ball & Chain)
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 for Europe ,$8.00 from U.S.A and Australia
 
 
 
 
 
Pledge $28.00 or more for the Complete halloween - Carnival package which includes all 4 miniatures (1 X Iron dwarf, 1 x elf scissorshands, 1 x master gobbo &amp; 1 x gobbo gremlin chainsaw)
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 for Europe ,$8,00 from U.S.A. and Australia
 
 
Pledge $30.00 or more for the secret weapons complete Carnival package which includes all 4 miniatures (1 X Orc Leather Face Chainsaw, 1 x Bomber Green Gobbo, 1 x Gobbo Spider-Pogo & 1 x Gobbo Thor Ball & Chain)
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 from Europe, $8.00 from U.S.A. and Australia
 
 
 
 

 Pledge $28.00 or more for the Mekanik Troll model Mad-Max
multicomponent miniature, 4 parts (body, head and arms)
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 for Europe ,$8,00 from U.S.A. and Australia

 

Pledge $50.00 or more for x2 the Mekanik Troll (same miniature) model Mad-Max
multicomponent miniature, 4 parts (body, head and arms)
For shipment outside of Spain please add $5.00 for Europe ,$8,00 from U.S.A. and Australia

 

For the one off pledge for $3600.00 or more

 You will receive the original greens of the following miniatures. Orc Leather Face Chainsaw, Gobbo Spider Pogo, Gobbo Thor Ball & Chain, Mad Max Troll Mekanik, Gobbo Force Master and Elf Assassin Scissorhands. In addition you will also receive 2 complete sets of miniatures including all those in the stretch goals listed below. One set will be unpainted and one will be professionally painted

This will not include the production rights for these miniatures, these rights will still be held by Kraken Miniatures / Rykar Jove

 

We would also like to expand this range further and would therefore like to offer the following Stretch Goals

 

 
 Stretch Goal #1 –set of new miniatures Halloween - Carnival. if we achieve the stretch goal target of $6800, I intend to produce a set of 4 new miniatures Halloween(photo of green to follow shortly). If we achieve this goal the miniature can be added to your perks at an additional cost of $8.00 for each

 

Stretch Goal #2 –Doktor Orktopus.If we achieve the stretch goal target of $7200, I intend to produce a Doktor Orktopus miniature. The mini will be an Orc based miniature with multiple Bionic arms (concept sketch of miniature to follow shortly) and can be added to your perks at an additional cost of $9.00

...and more new miniatures

 

Concept art :

The Troll Mekanik  ,miniature multicomponents 4 parts (body ,head and arms )

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
We are hoping that your support and help could see these miniatures brought into production
