story:
The Savage Company Campaign Setting is a compendium of military and monster-themed action designed to be compatible with the rules and campaign settings found in the First Edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. We’ve played for years, writing our own rules to expand on this type of content because the material we were looking for just didn’t exist. Now we have taken all these things, greatly expanded upon them, and built the concept into a fully-fledged campaign setting that can be played on its own or placed into any existing campaign setting.

Designed to expand options, but not necessarily power-creep; these crazy orcs with their guns and loud rumbling alchemical engined vehicles can be played alongside your traditional swords and sorcery content without much adjustment. The goal has been to add a lot of new content, that works with all of the existing content that is out there.

Evenly mixed with vibrant artwork and thrilling stories throughout the book, this will be a joy to read even when you’re not playing the game.


Savage Company Campaign Setting Book

 


 

Starting with the city of Tombstone, we have a large region that serves as both a setting for adventures and a home base to send parties to places anywhere in the world. Tombstone is full of locations and NPCs and as a rough and tumble frontier town, it can be quite dangerous.

We have added new races, variants of existing races, and more racial options and feats. Currently, we have about ten races fully written, with a few ideas for more.

There are over 20 classes and archetypes encompassing every type of character, with a heavy focus on archetypes that enable firearm use in new and exciting ways for classes that normally do not get to use guns. To go with these classes are new feats, skills, spells, and additional class options like talents, deeds, and discoveries.

Speaking of guns, we have about 50 weapons fully ready and play-tested, and much more ready to roll out. The focus has been to add weapons that don’t exist in the current game, are balanced to existing weapons, and have a historical flavor somewhere between the wild west, and the Vietnam war.

Along with those guns; are new types of armor, gear and equipment, and a large range of alchemical creations as well. Some of these are non-magical items that have the same effect as magic items currently in the game, and others greatly expand on the military theme. Have no fear, we didn’t forget about the magic. There are many new magic items and magical weapons as well.

Additionally, we have packed the book with iconic characters that showcase the new classes, gear, and short stories that expand upon the world; as well as accurately demonstrate their abilities and equipment in the course of narrative fiction. These characters also have fully built stat blocks at multiple levels, and can be used as pre-generated, or as a base to build your own for many adventures.

Along with our characters we have supplied new vehicles and a modular vehicle customization system that will allow you to quickly design hundreds of robust and wildly different types of vehicles. With these rules also comes the Rolling Road Combat ruleset. Rolling Road brings easy and fast-paced, fluid vehicle combat rules that make fighting on the move fun and deadly. To top it all off, you’ll also get Thrashcans and Thumpsters, unique vehicles that serve as mounts and have no facing rules allowing you to stomp across the battlefield in a mobile armored weapon platform.


Thrashcan Pilot

 


 

Currently, we have 90% of our book completed, comprising of over 400 pages of finished material. Writing the rest will be easy, but we need help funding the remaining art, and having the professionals at Fat Goblin Games format everything into a nice PDF.

We are guys with full-time jobs, and families; however, this hasn't hindered our efforts to fund the core project out of our own pockets. It is our intention to continue to do so. Your pledge will go towards the additional 40 pieces of art we still need inside the book and the layout artists who take our rough documents and turn them into gorgeous PDFs for you.


FINANZES IZ HARD

 

Additionally, renowned map artist Michael Tumey has agreed to create large detailed city maps of Tombstone and it’s undercity, this will breathe life into the setting and make it much easier to run adventures there.

We’ve also decided to make a second bonus version of the book, FM 420-69(named by Facebook fan submission), an art and lore free and printer-friendly quick reference field manual.


FM 420-69 Field Manual

Working with Q-Workshop, makers of the official Pathfinder dice sets, we’ve created custom sets of Savage Company dice, designed to look like they are made of bone and hand-scrawled with indicator numbers.

Polyhedral Set

d6 Set

 


 

We have a free preview of the book, the Savage Company Recruit Orientation Guide, that you can download now and check out! It contains 4 iconic characters, their stories, artwork, race, class, and all the new equipment each one is carrying. As well as detailed information about the setting and each section of the finished book. If you want to play some Savage Company now instead of waiting, everything you need to get started is right here: for free. 

https://www.drivethrurpg.com/browse/pub/15528/SHM-Publishing


Savage Company Recruit Orientation Guide FREE!

 


The base goal of $3400

Goals

Our base goal of $3,400 is what we need to get the minimum amount of art to complete the book. We will still be providing our own funds while the campaign is ongoing, but this is just enough to push us over the hump and get the book completed. We’re working hard on the book now, and will continue to do so during the campaign in order to deliver the books quickly. We are running dual campaigns and they will be totaled together for determining stretch goals.

We have also partnered with Q-Workshop, the makers of the official Pathfinder dice to produce exclusive Savage Company dice sets for backers. We will be working closely with those on the War Council, General, and Founder levels to design new content and host playtest game sessions. Print copies will be made available through DrivethruRPG.

Estimated delivery Q1 2020


$5000 stretch goal

Stretch goal of $5000

We have a series of planned adventures at multiple levels that can be played with the pre-generated Iconic characters or your own original characters. If we reach this level we will include these for free to all backers who have purchased the Campaign Setting book a set of hand-tailored adventures set in Savage Company Campaign setting including more artwork and full battle maps by Michael Tumey. We will also expand the Bestiary section to include a full listing of encounters added.

Estimated delivery Q1 2020


$7500 stretch goal

Stretch goal of $7500

At this level, we will be able to bring in some extraordinary artists and add additional art to the book that we would love to, but isn't really possible on our current, mostly self-funded budget.

We will be able to create panoramic full scenes packed with action, and characters; really putting you inside the world. There are several well-known artists who we are talking to, but we don’t want to name them until we get them under contract. One we can name however is Marc Lee, who did our cover art and currently does a lot of work for the Warhammer 40k Black Library series. We will update you all as the campaign progresses and are able to release more information.

Estimated delivery Q1 2020


$10,000 stretch goal

Stretch goal of $10,000

Dungeons and Dragons 5th Edition.

If we reach this stretch goal, we’ll hire a professional developer to help us convert all of the rules to D&D 5e and we will give this additional 5e version of the book for free to all backers who purchased the Campaign Setting book.

Estimated delivery Q2 2020

 


Backer Tiers and Rewards

Backer tiers

Ghost $5

At this level, your name will become one of the “Ghosts of Tombstone” and you'll be listed as a backer in the book. You will also get a Discord invite and a special backer role on our official server. This level is perfect for those who want to follow the project for a while before deciding what to pledge.

Vanguard $15

At this level, you will receive the full-color Savage Company Campaign Setting PDF at a reduced rate for being one of our first backers, along with all the rewards from Ghost tier. This early bird tier is limited in quantity for early backers.

Recruit $15

You will receive the printer-friendly field manual PDF along with a Discord invite and specialized role. This is the most basic tier that grants access to the new rules and content in the campaign setting.

Enlisted $20

At this level, you will receive the full-color Savage Company Campaign Setting PDF with all the beautiful artwork and awesome stories, along with a Discord invite and specialized role and your name published in the book. Don’t miss out; support us at this level to receive the entire Campaign Setting PDF along with all the rewards from Ghost tier.

Lance $30.

At this level, you will receive the printer-friendly field manual and the full-color Campaign Setting. You will also receive all the rewards of the Enlisted tier such as Discord roles and being listed in the book. This is the most comprehensive digital book tier.

Sergeant $50 - limit 100

As a Sergeant, you will get the full-color Savage Company Campaign Setting PDF, the printer-friendly Field Manual and a set of 8 custom Savage Company d6 Dice.

Staff Sergeant $50 - limit 100

As a Staff Sergeant, you will get the full-color Savage Company Campaign Setting PDF, the printer-friendly Field Manual, and a custom Savage Company Polyhedral 7-Dice Set.

Commander $70 - limit 100

At this level, you will get the full-color Savage Company Campaign Setting PDF, the printer-friendly Field Manual, a set of 8 custom Savage Company d6 Dice, and the Savage Company Polyhedral 7-Dice Set.

Field Marshall $100 - limit 100

The Field Marshall tier grants you first-run copies of the softcover editions of both books, as well as all previous rewards. Every PDF and both sets of custom dice, special Discord access, and your name in the book. This is the lowest physical book tier.

War Council $250 - limit 6

A seat on the War Council: You’ll get all previous rewards and special admittance to the War Council on Discord, with sneak peeks at yet-to-be-released content and input on design, along with an online playtest session with the developers and your friends.

General $500 - limit 4

As a General, you get all the rewards of the War Council tier, but you also get to help design a unique NPC that will be included in the book that comes with its own artwork.

Founder $1000 - limit 2

The Founder tier receives the same rewards as the War Council tier and will get to work closely with the writers to design an Iconic Character, develop a short story for that character, and weigh in on special art that will go in the final book.

 

Risks and challenges

Our biggest challenge will be to complete the artwork on time for our publishing goal, to help mitigate this we are working on it now, even before any Kickstarter funds will arrive. Less funding will mean it takes longer, but the book will be completed even without meeting any crowdfunding goals. 


Another concern is the lead time from Q-Workshop, they often take anywhere from 60 to 120 days to manufacture the product and a lot of the timeframe is dependent on their current workload and backlog. If there are delays in manufacturing that will only postpone the shipping of those items, and will not impact the rest of the project. 


We have been very wary about the potential to over-promise, which is why we waited until nearly all of the book was written before choosing to launch any funding campaigns.

 

Please visit us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/wekillpeopleformoney/, Instagram at https://www.instagram.com/wekillpeopleformoney/ or find us at https://www.wekillpeopleformoney.com
story_txt: The Savage Company Campaign Setting is a compendium of military and monster-themed action designed to be compatible with the rules and campaign settings found in the First Edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. We’ve played for years, writing our own rules to expand on this type of content because the material we were looking for just didn’t exist. Now we have taken all these things, greatly expanded upon them, and built the concept into a fully-fledged campaign setting that can be played on its own or placed into any existing campaign setting.Designed to expand options, but not necessarily power-creep; these crazy orcs with their guns and loud rumbling alchemical engined vehicles can be played alongside your traditional swords and sorcery content without much adjustment. The goal has been to add a lot of new content, that works with all of the existing content that is out there.Evenly mixed with vibrant artwork and thrilling stories throughout the book, this will be a joy to read even when you’re not playing the game.Savage Company Campaign Setting Book  Starting with the city of Tombstone, we have a large region that serves as both a setting for adventures and a home base to send parties to places anywhere in the world. Tombstone is full of locations and NPCs and as a rough and tumble frontier town, it can be quite dangerous.We have added new races, variants of existing races, and more racial options and feats. Currently, we have about ten races fully written, with a few ideas for more.There are over 20 classes and archetypes encompassing every type of character, with a heavy focus on archetypes that enable firearm use in new and exciting ways for classes that normally do not get to use guns. To go with these classes are new feats, skills, spells, and additional class options like talents, deeds, and discoveries.Speaking of guns, we have about 50 weapons fully ready and play-tested, and much more ready to roll out. The focus has been to add weapons that don’t exist in the current game, are balanced to existing weapons, and have a historical flavor somewhere between the wild west, and the Vietnam war.Along with those guns; are new types of armor, gear and equipment, and a large range of alchemical creations as well. Some of these are non-magical items that have the same effect as magic items currently in the game, and others greatly expand on the military theme. Have no fear, we didn’t forget about the magic. There are many new magic items and magical weapons as well.Additionally, we have packed the book with iconic characters that showcase the new classes, gear, and short stories that expand upon the world; as well as accurately demonstrate their abilities and equipment in the course of narrative fiction. These characters also have fully built stat blocks at multiple levels, and can be used as pre-generated, or as a base to build your own for many adventures.Along with our characters we have supplied new vehicles and a modular vehicle customization system that will allow you to quickly design hundreds of robust and wildly different types of vehicles. With these rules also comes the Rolling Road Combat ruleset. Rolling Road brings easy and fast-paced, fluid vehicle combat rules that make fighting on the move fun and deadly. To top it all off, you’ll also get Thrashcans and Thumpsters, unique vehicles that serve as mounts and have no facing rules allowing you to stomp across the battlefield in a mobile armored weapon platform.Thrashcan Pilot  Currently, we have 90% of our book completed, comprising of over 400 pages of finished material. Writing the rest will be easy, but we need help funding the remaining art, and having the professionals at Fat Goblin Games format everything into a nice PDF.We are guys with full-time jobs, and families; however, this hasn't hindered our efforts to fund the core project out of our own pockets. It is our intention to continue to do so. Your pledge will go towards the additional 40 pieces of art we still need inside the book and the layout artists who take our rough documents and turn them into gorgeous PDFs for you.FINANZES IZ HARD Additionally, renowned map artist Michael Tumey has agreed to create large detailed city maps of Tombstone and it’s undercity, this will breathe life into the setting and make it much easier to run adventures there.We’ve also decided to make a second bonus version of the book, FM 420-69(named by Facebook fan submission), an art and lore free and printer-friendly quick reference field manual.FM 420-69 Field ManualWorking with Q-Workshop, makers of the official Pathfinder dice sets, we’ve created custom sets of Savage Company dice, designed to look like they are made of bone and hand-scrawled with indicator numbers.Polyhedral Setd6 Set  We have a free preview of the book, the Savage Company Recruit Orientation Guide, that you can download now and check out! It contains 4 iconic characters, their stories, artwork, race, class, and all the new equipment each one is carrying. As well as detailed information about the setting and each section of the finished book. If you want to play some Savage Company now instead of waiting, everything you need to get started is right here: for free. https://www.drivethrurpg.com/browse/pub/15528/SHM-PublishingSavage Company Recruit Orientation Guide FREE! The base goal of $3400GoalsOur base goal of $3,400 is what we need to get the minimum amount of art to complete the book. We will still be providing our own funds while the campaign is ongoing, but this is just enough to push us over the hump and get the book completed. We’re working hard on the book now, and will continue to do so during the campaign in order to deliver the books quickly. We are running dual campaigns and they will be totaled together for determining stretch goals.We have also partnered with Q-Workshop, the makers of the official Pathfinder dice to produce exclusive Savage Company dice sets for backers. story:
Destroy These Cards is a party game where every card features unique art and a challenge. Take turns nominating other players (or the entire group) to complete the challenges for points. Players quickly find themselves doing several challenges at once, desperately trying not to get overwhelmed during their quest to get the most points. 

In Destruction Mode, wield the power of natural selection to create the best possible game for you and your group: 

Create your own cards - Make your own challenges and get rewarded for creativity: earn a bonus point any time another player uses a card you've created. 

Destroy cards - Someone make a stupid card? Rip it up. Want to give a legendary card the send-off it deserves? Give it a viking funeral. Each player can destroy up to the amount of cards they created during that game.

Survival of the Fittest - As the best cards thrive and the worst cards die, the game becomes personalized to your group's playing style, making it as silly, strategic or NSFW as your group wants it to be.

  • 1 two-piece box
  • 196 Master Deck cards
  • 98 blank cards
  • 50 bomb-shaped cardboard point tokens
  • 6 pencils
  • 1 notepad
  • 1 instruction manual
  • A ton of cool art made by over 30 different artists


Destroy These Cards is a collaborative effort including the work of many artists. These artists were chosen for their style, talent and sense of humor. At the bottom of each card, you can find the artist’s name along with a URL where you can follow the artists and get access to more of their work. We want you to find some artists who you want to support.

story:
YARPS helps you master the challenges of creating lively fantasy worlds, planning and evolving exciting stories and exchanging RPG-related ideas in an entirely new way with the assistance of our uniquely crafted digital tools.

YARPS is not just another world or another story. Also, it is not just a cloud storage for your notes. YARPS is a smart application that understands and manages your role-playing worlds and stories. It provides everything you need to bring your kind of role-playing to the next level of immersion and vividness. It is the forge where your fantasy becomes a living universe. 

The YARPS Prototype is available to everyone for free until the final release in Autumn 2020. If you want to get a first impression, just give it a try! Even after the release your work will remain safe and you'll be able to keep your instance running for free.

To learn even more about YARPS, head on over to yarps.net and visit our blog / news section to find out more about our latest updates! There you can also sign up for our Newsletter to stay up to date.

Have a question? In case your question is not resolved by checking out our FAQ page, you can get in touch with us via email to support@yarps.net, at the YARPS Community Hub or via Facebook.

For partnership inquiries, please contact partners@yarps.net.

We can’t wait to bring the entire, feature complete YARPS experience to life! You can also find our latest roadmap considerations on our website which will be updated regularly.

Although our campaign on Kickstarter has ended and our exclusive Kickstarter lifetime instances are therefore not available anymore, you can still get great advantages by pre-ordering YARPS instances here, on Indiegogo! Our pre-order possibilities reach from early access to our feature releases to discounted premium instances. Check it out!

What are YARPS Instances?

Summed up, one instance consists of everything related to one RPG setting you play. You can learn everything about instances here.

What does a Premium Instance contain?

Long story short: Everything YARPS currently has – and what YARPS 1.0 will have – to offer!

Via the Instance Configurator Page on our Website you can find more details about our price model and how an instance can be tailored to your needs!

Future Pricing

There will be a basic free version allowing some features to be activated in order to have them either tested or run productively on a small scale. To give you a solid overview about the whole topic, we created a dedicated page on our website - check it out!

Essentially YARPS' feature set can be clustered in 4 key components. Each filled with functionalities tailored for the components purpose: 

 

(Deutsche Version zur Enzyklopädie auf Youtube ansehen)

(Deutsche Version zu 'Entity Linking' auf Youtube ansehen)

(Deutsche Version zu 'Attribute Customization' auf Youtube ansehen)

 

 

 

(Deutsche Version zu 'Story Management' auf Youtube ansehen)

 

 

(Deutsche Version zu 'Interactive Maps' auf Youtube ansehen)

(Deutsche Version zu 'Portrait Generator' auf Youtube ansehen)

(Deutsche Version zu 'File Manager' auf Youtube ansehen)

 

Building the YARPS Prototype requires time and hard work, which usually translates into money — as you might have guessed. 

We’d love to have YARPS in a feature-ready state as early as possible. With money as an undeniable constraint our backers on Kickstarter helped us to focus explicitly on developing YARPS towards its final, feature-complete state and keep the prototype instances running in the meanwhile. 

Our small software company already invested a lot of time — and money — and we will continue to do so because we believe in what we are doing. What we are asking for is your support to speed up the YARPS development. Any pre-order will help us focus on YARPS' development! That said, you can find our current release roadmap on our Website.

YARPS is an ambitious project, and we are glad to have great companions on our side! Besides our great beta testers, all volunteers and supporters, we want to introduce you to the partners who have supported us during our Kickstarter campaign and beyond.

To get the latest news on our partners please check out the partners page on our website.

THE DESIGN MECHANISM

We proudly announce that The Design Mechanism – producer and publisher of the Mythras roleplaying game – joined our journey!

We are highly confident that this partnership will result in awesome and outstanding content for you, the players, in our Content Hub. Especially as we decided to integrate the Mythras Imperative rules in YARPS complemented by even more Mythras content.

Together with The Design Mechanism we are delighted to bring Mythras to GMs and players in a new way!

PINNACLE ENTERTAINMENT GROUP

Just recently we won another companion on our journey: Pinnacle Entertainment which is the group publishing the Savage Worlds rulebook and plenty other intriguing content.

Despite we did not had a chance to work out the details yet, we are excited about the many potentials in which this partnership can enrich your RPG experience!

THE DARK EYE - ULISSES SPIELE

We can proudly announce that Ulisses Spiele joined us on our journey, one of Germany’s leading publishers of role-playing games! Ulisses Spiele produces the most successful German RPG, The Dark Eye. After our Kickstarter Campaign we’ll offer a prototype version of YARPS specifically tailored to TDE. Furthermore, Ulisses Spiele will offer a selection of TDE content in the YARPS Content Hub after the final release!

SONOR VILAGE

Sonor Village deals with audio production and musical creativity for every type of project. In the past years the team, consisting of Antonio Affrunti (director), Daniele Siscaro, and Gianluca Siscaro, has focused on the production of environmental sounds and background soundtracks for pen & paper and digital role-playing games, becoming one of the largest Italian music producers in the industry.

For our Kickstarter campaign, Sonor Village will support YARPS with a set of twenty high-quality background music tracks, specifically created for pen and paper roleplaying! If the campaign reaches the respective goal, our Kickstarter backers will already have a basic library of great background music to get started immediately after the final release of YARPS 1.0!

This video shows a first audio sample of the tracks Sonor Village will produce for YARPS. Don’t forget to turn on your audio!

DUNGEON DUDE

Inspired by old role-playing cartography, the Dungeon Dude creates hand-drawn maps on Instagram. As the name implies, his focus is on dungeon maps, but he also creates fantastic kingdoms as well as fabulous cities.

For the YARPS Kickstarter campaign, the Dungeon Dude will support YARPS with ten hand-drawn maps! If the campaign reaches the respective goal, these maps, from small and larger taverns and dungeons to a whole village, will be available to our Kickstarter supporters in the interactive map manager at the final release of YARPS!

WHY SHOULD YOU PRE-ORDER?

Because you love to experience exciting and complex stories in convincing, vivid worlds like we do. Because, like we do, you love to see your world and story constantly grow and evolve — with every session you play. Because you love to come upon new points of reference for your stories by browsing the clearly illustrated descriptions and relationships of your world and your past adventures, just like us. And, last but not least, because you share our belief that role-playing of all of us could benefit tremendously from a community that is able to share its numerous great role-playing ideas easily — in a large Content Hub where you can find new inspiring elements at any time and integrate them into your world in just a few clicks.

With any pre-order you are supporting us in approaching this vision a little closer. And of course our offers on Indiegogo have a significant discount attached!

ABOUT THE TEAM BEHIND YARPS

Behind YARPS is a community of role-playing enthusiasts, most of whom can look back on nearly twenty years of experience in numerous pen & paper and live action role-playing games. Our joint RPG career began with Advanced Dungeons & Dragons. After trying out many systems and worlds, we finally came to the decision to create our own setting and rules. The Argenekon and YARPS, back then simply the name for our pen & paper rule system, were born.

YARPS and the Argenekon were developed conceptually and substantively over the years. The design of mechanics gradually took a back seat and questions regarding the content and conceptual issues for the creation of plausible, lively worlds became more important. In 2016, we began to develop a prototype for the YARPS web application specifically designed to create and manage complex worlds and support their use in role-playing. In late 2017, we decided to start a company and bring the project to market. Better Than Life UG (haftungsbeschränkt), a German company with limited liability, was finally founded in March 2018 and currently acts as the project owner of the financing campaign on Kickstarter and Indiegogo. The company is managed by Stefan Weidemann who is also responsible for the project’s technical development.  

YARPS is also funded by private investors who provide some of the capital needed for the market launch.

Each filled with functionalities tailored for the components purpose:  (Deutsche Version zur Enzyklopädie auf Youtube ansehen)(Deutsche Version zu 'Entity Linking' auf Youtube ansehen)(Deutsche Version zu 'Attribute Customization' auf Youtube ansehen)   (Deutsche Version zu 'Story Management' auf Youtube ansehen)  (Deutsche Version zu 'Interactive Maps' auf Youtube ansehen)(Deutsche Version zu 'Portrait Generator' auf Youtube ansehen)(Deutsche Version zu 'File Manager' auf Youtube ansehen) Building the YARPS Prototype requires time and hard work, which usually translates into money — as you might have guessed. We’d love to have YARPS in a feature-ready state as early as possible. With money as an undeniable constraint our backers on Kickstarter helped us to focus explicitly on developing YARPS towards its final, feature-complete state and keep the prototype instances running in the meanwhile. Our small software company already invested a lot of time — and money — and we will continue to do so because we believe in what we are doing. What we are asking for is your support to speed up the YARPS development. Any pre-order will help us focus on YARPS' development! That said, you can find our current release roadmap on our Website.YARPS is an ambitious project, and we are glad to have great companions on our side! Besides our great beta testers, all volunteers and supporters, we want to introduce you to the partners who have supported us during our Kickstarter campaign and beyond.To get the latest news on our partners please check out the partners page on our website.THE DESIGN MECHANISMWe proudly announce that The Design Mechanism – producer and publisher of the Mythras roleplaying game – joined our journey!We are highly confident that this partnership will result in awesome and outstanding content for you, the players, in our Content Hub. Especially as we decided to integrate the Mythras Imperative rules in YARPS complemented by even more Mythras content.Together with The Design Mechanism we are delighted to bring Mythras to GMs and players in a new way!PINNACLE ENTERTAINMENT GROUPJust recently we won another companion on our journey: Pinnacle Entertainment which is the group publishing the Savage Worlds rulebook and plenty other intriguing content.Despite we did not had a chance to work out the details yet, we are excited about the many potentials in which this partnership can enrich your RPG experience!THE DARK EYE - ULISSES SPIELEWe can proudly announce that Ulisses Spiele joined us on our journey, one of Germany’s leading publishers of role-playing games! Ulisses Spiele produces the most successful German RPG, The Dark Eye. After our Kickstarter Campaign we’ll offer a prototype version of YARPS specifically tailored to TDE. Furthermore, Ulisses Spiele will offer a selection of TDE content in the YARPS Content Hub after the final release!SONOR VILAGESonor Village deals with audio production and musical creativity for every type of project. In the past years the team, consisting of Antonio Affrunti (director), Daniele Siscaro, and Gianluca Siscaro, has focused on the production of environmental sounds and background soundtracks for pen & paper and digital role-playing games, becoming one of the largest Italian music producers in the industry.For our Kickstarter campaign, Sonor Village will support YARPS with a set of twenty high-quality background music tracks, specifically created for pen and paper roleplaying! If the campaign reaches the respective goal, our Kickstarter backers will already have a basic library of great background music to get started immediately after the final release of YARPS 1.0!This video shows a first audio sample of the tracks Sonor Village will produce for YARPS. Don’t forget to turn on your audio!DUNGEON DUDEInspired by old role-playing cartography, the Dungeon Dude creates hand-drawn maps on Instagram. As the name implies, his focus is on dungeon maps, but he also creates fantastic kingdoms as well as fabulous cities.For the YARPS Kickstarter campaign, the Dungeon Dude will support YARPS with ten hand-drawn maps! If the campaign reaches the respective goal, these maps, from small and larger taverns and dungeons to a whole village, will be available to our Kickstarter supporters in the interactive map manager at the final release of YARPS!WHY SHOULD YOU PRE-ORDER?Because you love to experience exciting and complex stories in convincing, vivid worlds like we do. Because, like we do, you love to see your world and story constantly grow and evolve — with every session you play. Because you love to come upon new points of reference for your stories by browsing the clearly illustrated descriptions and relationships of your world and your past adventures, just like us. And, last but not least, because you share our belief that role-playing of all of us could benefit tremendously from a community that is able to share its numerous great role-playing ideas easily — in a large Content Hub where you can find new inspiring elements at any time and integrate them into your world in just a few clicks.With any pre-order you are supporting us in approaching this vision a little closer. And of course our offers on Indiegogo have a significant discount attached!ABOUT THE TEAM BEHIND YARPSBehind YARPS is a community of role-playing enthusiasts, most of whom can look back on nearly twenty years of experience in numerous pen & paper and live action role-playing games. Our joint RPG career began with Advanced Dungeons & Dragons. After trying out many systems and worlds, we finally came to the decision to create our own setting and rules. The Argenekon and YARPS, back then simply the name for our pen & paper rule system, were born.YARPS and the Argenekon were developed conceptually and substantively over the years. The design of mechanics gradually took a back seat and questions regarding the content and conceptual issues for the creation of plausible, lively worlds became more important. In 2016, we began to develop a prototype for the YARPS web application specifically designed to create and manage complex worlds and support their use in role-playing. In late 2017, we decided to start a company and bring the project to market. Better Than Life UG (haftungsbeschränkt), a German company with limited liability, was finally founded in March 2018 and currently acts as the project owner of the financing campaign on Kickstarter and Indiegogo. The company is managed by Stefan Weidemann who is also responsible for the project’s technical development.  YARPS is also funded by private investors who provide some of the capital needed for the market launch.

story:
OGANIKA: Succesfully launched on Kickstarter!

Oganika is a puzzle game for 1-6 players that's easy to learn, but mind bendingly hard to master! 

Oganika is different than any other games. Where board games are generally variations of similar game concepts (using cards, points, dices), Oganika tiles are a game mechanism itself, that could cater for hundreds of different game types. We hope the word Oganika becomes as known as the word Sudoku over the coming decades. 

From the moment you start, you'll find intriguing differences in Oganika's patterns and shapes, revealing aspects of play that will either help or hinder. Everything connects... until it doesn't, and so your boggled brain will need to think of an alternative way of solving the puzzle.

With each step, the challenge increases - enough to make every solution an enjoyable victory!  

Kickstarter: We have successfully ran a campaign on Kickstarter where we collected over 170% of our original target. As a result we have moved on to the next phase where we are working on finalizing the design and starting the production and logistical process. In order to share our product to a bigger audience we have decided to launch this Indiegogo campaign! If you interested in our Kickstarter campaign please click on the following link: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/oganika/oganika-the-puzzle

Playing Oganika: Choose from a set of 36 left and right-handed tiles, placing your selection of puzzle pieces into a given arrangement, making sure that Oganika's winding path remains unbroken. You'll soon need a strategy, if you're not going to get lost in a maze of your own making! 

Players create geometric shapes from puzzle cards that range from beginner to intermediate through to expert. Due to the different levels, Oganika can be enjoyed by many different types of players from serious puzzlers to casual players. In addition, we have also developed a special kids pack which makes it even more attractive for the younger ones to get involved! 

The main Oganika game gives you 2 sets of 36 tiles which allows you to play 2 different types of gameplay: a puzzle single/dual player mode, or a multi-player game with friends.

Single Player: The Puzzle 

 

The puzzle is a single-player mode in which you have to form the shape on the given puzzle card. The puzzle mode requires little to no explanation, the first puzzles can be solved in minutes for most players. However, the difficulty increases per puzzle, gradually turning into mind-boggling challenges.

Each pledge comes with two sets of tiles (black and white), so the puzzles can be played against each other in a competitive dual mode.

 

Based on trials with relatively new Oganika players, we estimate the average puzzle times to be as following:  

The 55 puzzles start simply and slowly build up the difficulty level. The average play time indicates that the first set of Oganika puzzles (55 cards) will quickly give you 40 hours of playing fun just completing the single player mode - and an infinite amount of hours in the multi-player modes.

Multi Player:  The Game 

 

Oganika can also be played in a multiplayer mode in which 2 to 6 players compete with each other. The gameplay is much more casual than the regular puzzle, and perfect for a nice game evening with friends.  

The goal of each round is to add as many pieces as possible to a single 36-tile hexagon. The game is played with two sets of tiles (included in the game) and players take turns to add tiles to the single hexagon in the middle of the table. 

Plays like blocking players, choosing the right number of new tiles or reducing your play time to pressurise other players make this game fast, fun but most of all strategic. 

Expansion: The Kids Package

 

The Oganika kids package is a a great edition to the standard Oganika games and is aimed at kids from the ages of around 6+, (or younger if they are particularly adept) challenging them to create animals and funny faces. The package has been developed with the help of education professionals and helps to develop a variety of skills such as systematic reasoning, logical deduction, creative & imaginative play and problem solving. 

Each card targets a specific concept or skill and these skills and concepts are slowly developed further as one progresses from card to card. Careful reflection will reveal the connections between each card and children will get a sense of progress and achievement as they make their way through the sequence. 

The Kids package contains 36 puzzle cards in a colourful design. 

 

Limited Edition Box

Oganika comes in a high-gloss, black, limited edition box.  

 

Overview of the game

We offer two different option when you want to purchase the Oganika game: the first option is the full game with 55 puzzles while the second one is the full game + the Kids Expansion pack (including 36 additional puzzles).  A full overview of what is included is shown below.

 This set contains:

  •  36 Oganika tiles (black) - A set of 36 tiles with a black base and white lining
  •  36 Oganika tiles (white) - A set of 36 tiles with a white base and black lining
  •  Tile Number Sheet - An A3 poster depicting all tiles and the numbers
  •  Puzzles: The Core Package - 55 puzzle cards, black design
  •  Booklet - Containing all rules of Oganika
  •  Limited edition Oganika box - A small, high-gloss black box containing all items
  •  Set of counters - Black and white counters which are used for the Multiplayer game
  •  Stretch goals - all backers of the puzzle receive all reached stretch goals

 

Oganika - The puzzle + Kids expansion pack

This set contains all of the above + the kids expansion pack.

 

A great gift

Sick and tired of giving flowers, a bottle of wine or another book as a present? Due to the beautiful design of the box and the pieces, Oganika also forms the perfect gift not only for your friends & family, but also in work related situations! If you are interested in this, please see our multi-pack offers.

 

What Oganika players say

“A proper gem of a game! It’s very much a game for all the ages." — Simon Charters, Pakistan

“A surprisingly simple way to integrate elements from radically different game types and experiences. Kudos to the team behind the project.” — Mikkel Draebye, Professor at Bocconi, Milan, Italy

“甚至我们的孩子都喜欢它 ，并且爱不释手，这个游戏对所有年龄段来说都有吸引力。”

— 傅晓瑞 Beijing, China

 

Planning timeline

As mentioned before, we have finalized our Kickstarter campaign and we have moved on to the next phase where we are working on finalizing the design and starting the production and logistical process.  The goal is to deliver all rewards well before Christmas 2020. 

Meet the team

A group of friends who have a passion for puzzling and gaming. We are hoping to realise our dreams and spend more time playing and less time working!  

Jeremy Dawson: Jeremy is the creator of the Oganika tiles which he developed on a very wet and windy day whilst holidaying with his family in Whitby, England. A puzzle enthusiast, and maths education specialist, he spends most of his spare time pottering with game mechanisms and remembering fondly his many hours of D&D playing.

Jeroen van den Bremer: In his daily life, Jeroen loves playing any type of board or card game. The only team-member whose hair-do is always sharp. Having known Jeremy for over fifteen years he was immediately taken with the game when he was shown it and from there dragged his friends Glenn and Lourens into the mix.

Lourens Keers: Born in Chile, lives in Amsterdam, terrible salsa dancer...but pretty good at devising unusual escape room activities. With a penchant for minimalism and stripped back design, Lourens is responsible for the Oganika look, and for only allowing us to use black and white photos. We are hoping that his skills in working on innovation projects will help with our Kickstarter.

"I learned about Oganika about 2 years ago. The intellectual challenge grabbed me directly and I love the aesthetics of the game. As the gameplays are virtually limitless, we've worked hard the last year on selecting the best game modes that we present today. Hope you enjoy!" 

Glenn Verburg:  Glenn loves shouting at the television whilst watching football and is the first to accuse anyone of cheating when playing any game! This makes him especially useful when dealing with finances and logistics, as everything has to be by the book. We are very confident that Glenn's skills will keep everything on track throughout the project...or we'll get shouted at.

On behalf of our team, a big thanks goes out to the people who helped us in this journey so far: Marlies, Roy, Cathie, Ethan, Lisa  - and all our friends and family who support us.

 

Follow Oganika via other media

  • Official website:  www.oganika.com 
  • Follow us on Facebook  
  • Follow us on Instagram 
  • Follow us on Twitter 

 

Terms and conditions

If you back this project, you acknowledge that the final products and content of the different rewards may be subject to change and could differ from what is presented during this campaign as depicted on this page.

You agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into the Indemand pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We are not able to ship to PO Boxes.

Undelivered shipments and/or damaged or missing parts need to be reported in 45 days after we send you the transport notice through an email. If reported within those 45 days it will remain our responsibility to take care of successfully delivering your reward or replacement parts to you. After 45 days we may treat unreported shipments as successfully finished and any potential re sending or replacing the parts may be at our discretion only.

If you do not accept the terms and conditions as presented for this Indemand campaign then please do not pledge on this project.

© 2020, Oganika.com, B.V. - Oganika is part of NewRoads Gaming. All rights reserved.

Questions about this project? Check out the FAQ

story:
Welcome to the World of Unlocked!

Unlocked: Mansion of Mana is a set collection tabletop game where you take on the role of young wizards competing to become the last great wizard's apprentice. To win you must be the first to make your way through the mansion. But this mansion isn't just any ordinary mansion; each room you enter grants you an ability that can be used to get ahead or put others behind.

Hi, I'm Sean Howard-designer of Unlocked and creator. I have spent the last seven years dreaming up this game and working through it's many iterations. I have been so happy with the success it received at many conventions and the terrific success over at Kickstarter. It is now here on Indiegogo as a preorder system.

What is involved in the Pre-Order?

We are using this platform as an extension to our Kickstarter campaign while we wait for delivery of our product from manufacturing. This gives individuals a discount on pre-order sales and also allows us to get games to the table faster.

So we are offering the game for sale here for $25 + shipping, same as the Kickstarter Campaign.

Unlocked is a sequential set collection, hand management game where players attempt to collect elemental rune stones required to summon magical keys to open rooms. As the players open the rooms, players are able to acquire unique powers and abilities that will help them open more rooms.The first player to enter a room in each section of the mansion reaches the wizard first and wins the game.

General Playthrough

 

 

 All games come with the following components listed. Also, the stretch goals will be included in all versions of the game unless otherwise stated as a "Kickstarter Exclusive".

Shogun Showdown - $5

Copies of Shogun Showdown can also be added to your order. This is for the low low price of $5!

 

 

The Professionals

 

"One of the biggest positives of this game is the amount of replayability - there are a TON of keys and the game feels different based on what keys are available. You end up trying to figure out which keys to go after- Powerful abilities or abilities that combo together or to just go after cheaper abilities because you have the right cards. You end up building this cool engine to make your way through the mansion." - Game Boy Geek

 

"I like how quick it plays, the art, and the solo variant. Normally, I find solo play variants tacked on but it was REALLY enjoyable!" - James at Board Game Spotlight

"I found that chaining abilities and locking others out of keys is where the real strategy of the game lies." - Vincent Paone of Dad's Gaming Addiction

 

"There is a lot of great nuanced gameplay and flavor from using the keys abilities... and the key artwork is FANTASTIC! Blown away by that!"  - Eduardo Baraf of Edo's Game Previews

story:
Game Plan

Cancer touches just about everyone directly or indirectly, and has hit my family pretty hard this year. I decided to try my best at doing something – even if it's not huge – to help the people who are doing their best to find a way to cure this disease.

Since I love footy, I decided to try to create a full set of playing cards of players as if they were in an old Sega game, re-creating each player pixel by pixel. This took longer than I thought but they're finally done – just in time for the pointy end of finals!

A couple different cancers have directly affected my family recently, and while it's hard to say one organisation is more worthy than another, I've seen the great support from The Mark Hughes Foundation first hand so that's where the money will be donated. Wrong code I know – but the sporting community is one community right?

 

Recruitment

Even if you don't feel like buying anything, you can still really help by sharing this around! Whether it's on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, email or word of mouth, every little bit of exposure is really appreciated.

 

Selected Side

2 - Bob Murphy, Jarryd Roughhead, Nathan Jones, Jake Carlisle 
3 - Marc Murphy, Stephen Coniglio, Tom Mitchell, Jarryd McVeigh 
4 - Paddy Ryder, Marcus Bontempelli, Dustin Martin, Jobe Watson 
5 - Jamie Elliot, Brandon Ellis, Isaac Heeney, Christian Petracca
6 - Joe Daniher, Jordan Lewis, Elliot Yeo, Luke Dahlhaus
7 - Nat Fyfe, Adam Treloar, Jack Viney, Jack Ziebell
8 - Matt Kreuzer, Jack Riewoldt, Callan Ward, Kurt Tippett
9 - Gary Ablett, Dayne Beams, Robbie Gray, Rory Sloane
10 - Zak Jones, Scott Pendlebury, Michael Walters, Easton Wood
Jacks - Jack Silvagni, Dyson Heppell, Ben Brown, Anthony McDonald-Tipungwuti
Queens - Joel Selwood, Luke Hodge, Jason Johannisen, Jeremy Cameron
Kings - Nick Riewoldt, Eric Hipwood, Josh J. Kennedy, Buddy Franklin
Aces - Eddie Betts, Patrick Dangerfield, Tom Lynch, Tex Walker
Jokers - Razor Ray, Andrew Stephens

To peep more of the illustrations, check out the Footy Cards vs. Cancer Instagram
story_txt:
Game Plan
Cancer touches just about everyone directly or indirectly, and has hit my family pretty hard this year. I decided to try my best at doing something – even if it's not huge – to help the people who are doing their best to find a way to cure this disease.
Since I love footy, I decided to try to create a full set of playing cards of players as if they were in an old Sega game, re-creating each player pixel by pixel. This took longer than I thought but they're finally done – just in time for the pointy end of finals!A couple different cancers have directly affected my family recently, and while it's hard to say one organisation is more worthy than another, I've seen the great support from The Mark Hughes Foundation first hand so that's where the money will be donated. Wrong code I know – but the sporting community is one community right?

 
Recruitment
Even if you don't feel like buying anything, you can still really help by sharing this around! Whether it's on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, email or word of mouth, every little bit of exposure is really appreciated.
 
Selected Side2 - Bob Murphy, Jarryd Roughhead, Nathan Jones, Jake Carlisle 3 - Marc Murphy, Stephen Coniglio, Tom Mitchell, Jarryd McVeigh 4 - Paddy Ryder, Marcus Bontempelli, Dustin Martin, Jobe Watson 5 - Jamie Elliot, Brandon Ellis, Isaac Heeney, Christian Petracca6 - Joe Daniher, Jordan Lewis, Elliot Yeo, Luke Dahlhaus7 - Nat Fyfe, Adam Treloar, Jack Viney, Jack Ziebell8 - Matt Kreuzer, Jack Riewoldt, Callan Ward, Kurt Tippett9 - Gary Ablett, Dayne Beams, Robbie Gray, Rory Sloane10 - Zak Jones, Scott Pendlebury, Michael Walters, Easton WoodJacks - Jack Silvagni, Dyson Heppell, Ben Brown, Anthony McDonald-TipungwutiQueens - Joel Selwood, Luke Hodge, Jason Johannisen, Jeremy CameronKings - Nick Riewoldt, Eric Hipwood, Josh J. story:
The BYTE Roleplaying Game Rulebook stands at over 400 pages, and gives players everything they need to play tabletop RPGs in any setting. The book includes 10 technological levels and 20 thematic modules that can be combined in many unique ways, with each combination creating a different ruleset. This allows the rules to be tailored to the world in which the players want to immerse themselves.

From cowboys to spies, Roman gladiators to mecha pilots, elven knights to vampires, private investigators to galactic rulers, the book provides everything needed for your game. It allows you to play in any historical era or the worlds of your favorite books, movies, series, or video games. It can also easily be customized for use with any "system-agnostic" settings you own.

 

 

The BYTE Roleplaying Game is a passion project that has been in the making for the past 8 years, with many tweaks and revisions during that time. It is a wide-ranging book that takes inspiration from all sorts of entertainment media to offer a comprehensive resource to players. It has been playtested extensively by veteran players with over 25 years in the hobby.

 

(Yeraksys: Dying World—one of the original BYTE RPG settings)

 

Besides the ruleset itself, the BYTE Roleplaying Game also involves the development of 7 original settings. One of these—No Coin for Charon, an open world, "hex crawl", sandbox style, modern zombie apocalypse mini-setting—will be included as an appendix in the rulebook. The other 6 settings are planned for release in the coming years.

 

(No Coin for Charon—a mini-setting included with the BYTE RPG Rulebook)

 

Each rule and item within the BYTE Roleplaying Game Rulebook was designed and written in such a way to allow players to assess instantly which technological level, and which of the 7 original settings, it is applicable to. Each section of the book will be color-coded, and icons will be assigned to each chapter and element which link them to the pertinent worlds and eras.

As all the necessary rules will be compiled in the BYTE Roleplaying Game Rulebook, the setting books will focus solely on the lore (history, geography, cultures, factions, people, artifacts, etc.) and practical tables to generate thematic events and elements on the fly, assisting players to tell unique and evolving stories customized to each world.

 

(Ashes of the Heavens—wield divine powers and take part in swashbuckling adventures)

 

To tie it all together, the BYTE Roleplaying Game uses an easy to grasp action resolution mechanism. Each character has attributes (such as Dexterity or Presence, with values ranging from 1 to 5) and skills (such as Piloting or Leadership, with values from 0 to 5). When a test is required, the player rolls a number of eight-sided dice equal to the relevant attribute and compares the number on each die to the pertinent skill, aiming to roll lower than or equal to that skill's value. Rolled eights count as zeros and thus are always considered successes, but each seven cancels out a success. If at least one roll remains successful, the character achieves a favorable outcome for the attempted action. 

No other kind of dice besides eight-sided ones are used in the game and there are many design decisions in place to make the game fast and exciting, from trying to pilot a starfighter to ruling a kingdom.

 

(Ghosts of T'Kelti—a dark space opera where technology is molded by the supernatural)

 

Do you want to know a bit more about the campaign settings with the BYTE Roleplaying Game? Want to discover what its innovative Token rule does to support good roleplaying? Want to have an idea on how the rules' modularity works? Want to understand how to customize your character's skills with more than 280 different abilities, making them unlike any other character in their world?

 

Download the free Quickstart Rules Beta Version HERE.

 

(The City and the Numina—a magic realist world where corporations mingle with the occult)

 

What you get by backing now

All perks for this campaign give backers the BYTE Roleplaying Game Rulebook PDF. The second and third perks also come with options for printed copies of the book through at-cost, print-on-demand vouchers from DriveThruRPG. In those tiers, you will be able to choose the full-color Hardcover version (letter-sized, 400+ pages) or its Premium Edition one (with premium-quality print). The art for the book will be composed of both commissioned illustrations and licensed ones (all of them full-color, high resolution, and, more importantly, high quality).

 

(Blades for the Dead Empress—dispense justice and face supernatural threats in an ancient world)

 

Moreover, backers will gain exclusive access to the full Beta version rules document this August—four months before the book's launch—allowing them to start playing right away. They will also have the opportunity to join the private BYTE Roleplaying Game Discord Server—before it opens to the general public in December 2020—and exchange ideas with other players and the author, giving valuable feedback directly to him.

 

 

(Audio Tapes from the End Times—retropunk adventures set during a cold war in a fantasy world)

 

Who we are

This is an independent project being developed by people from different corners of the world.

At the center of it all is the author, R.G. de Barros, an enthusiast of the hobby for many years, who wanted to write the ideal RPG system for all the stories he wanted to tell together with his friends. 

Get in touch!

BYTERPG.COM

Twitter

contact@byterpg.com

Why Print-on-Demand

To keep risks at a bare minimum and focus on delivering the best possible product without having to deal with printers, warehouses, and shipping partners, fulfillment duties will be handled by DriveThruRPG. They will host the BYTE Roleplaying Game Rulebook PDF, as well as printing and shipping the Hardcover and Premium Edition versions.

Please note that the vouchers represent a 100% discount on the publisher's margin only, and backers that use them will have to pay for DriveThruRPG's base printing and shipping costs. As of June 14th, 2020, printing costs for the Hardcover version are estimated around US$ 30 (450 pages, standard color, 8.5 by 11 inches, hardcover, case bound) and, for the Premium Edition version, around US$ 48 (450 pages, premium color, 8.5 by 11 inches, hardcover, case bound). These are estimates obtained with DriveThruRPG's print cost calculator found in this link. Note that printing costs can fluctuate depending on the book's exact final page count or price adjustments by DriveThruRPG.

Risks and Challenges

The BYTE Roleplaying Game Rulebook has been in development for more than 8 years. It is a big book, but the text is already in place, fully written, and edited. Layout is already paid for and most of the commissioned art is already done. Physical copies of the book will be printed and delivered directly to backers by DriveThruRPG, a leading company in the market with more than 15 years of experience. As we, the creators, won't have to deal with printers, warehouses, and shipping partners, and considering that the book is practically done, risks of this project are minimal. The main challenge is having the remaining art, layout, and proofreading done in time. For that, we are giving ourselves plenty of time to have the required printing test so that vouchers for the physical copies may be delivered to backers in time with the PDF version in December.

story:
The Folio: Black Label series are fantasy adventure modules that are compatible with BOTH classic Advanced Dungeons & Dragons and 5th Edition D&D formats.  Each adventure combines what I enjoyed most from the heady days of of the late 1970s and the 1980s swords & sorcery storytelling. 

The Folio: Black Label #4 begins a new chapter in the series, this time pitting the characters against a demonic slaving nation bound to a cursed ruin call The Burning City.  In this adventure the characters will have to try to retrieve a stolen noble before she is taken too deep into the demon insect infested 'ash lands' that surround The Burning City for hundreds of miles.  They must enter a slaver compound and underground lair to retrieve her, fighting terrible creatures along the way.

Taking a page from the previous Black Label trilogy, this one is going to have an even more adult edge than can found in the standard Folio, and yes, there might be some nudity, and maybe some horror, and maybe a twisted quality here or there, but at the base its really just about the unfettered fun of hacking and slashing your way through a pulp style adventure with blatant evil doers, magical treasures, and exposed flesh.  

So, I'm throwing out the standard politically correct playbook, and turning the flux capacitor back to the early days of gaming.  I hope some of you will join me. 

Who is this adventure for?: It will be based around  classic AD&D gaming mechanics, while also have 'grey' stat and  treasure blocks for 5th Edition D&D,  so it is easily playable in  BOTH formats.  It has been designed for  6-8 characters, roughly 2nd  through 4th, and will include incredible maps and artwork that will get your creative juices flowing!   Just check out some of the maps below for what will be awaiting you.

What does the adventure Lair of the Slaver Succubus revolve around? Well, this will be a standard swords & sorcery based adventure that deals with the lair you see above, located in the deadly 'ash lands'.  Characters will be required by an outside contract to return the daughter of a noble that fell victim to the roving slavers, bound for The Burning City.  The question will be, can the characters get in and out before the entire land rises up against them?

Is there any other background on the setting? Yes, we here at Art of the Genre produced a 544 page novel with attached setting gazetteer in the back.  If you like dark (and erotic) fully illustrated fantasy, then The Burning City will put you on the right path to fully enjoy the setting we are creating in this new adventure module trilogy.

What are all the other Folio products? The bulk of the Folio adventure series has  been in physical form and can be found at artofthegenre.com.   For the  purposes of some of the upper pledge levels, these previously  produced  adventures are offered.  Thus far, there  have been  25 Folio standard removable cover adventures, and 7 hardcover Folio books  (4 compile and reprint the Folio campaigns, and 2 are gaming supplements).

What are the 'Orange Spine' books?: These 'Complete' volumes include not only all the information from 6 Folio adventure modules, but also 6 or more 'mini-adventure' supplements  added for extra content, iconic character cards that are playable, and a  gazetteer supplement that defines the world the adventure takes place  in.   These compiled volumes include:

The Complete Roslof Keep Campaign (Folio #1-#6)
The Cities of Sorcery (Folio #8-#13)
The Complete White Ship (Folio #14-#19)
The Complete Curse of Roslof Keep (Folio #20-#25, which is a high level campaign)
Also included is the Storyteller's Arcana, a 128 page DM & Player guide of my own tips and experiences in 30 years of gaming, and the Folio of Fiendish Monsters with 115 new monsters.  ALL these books are in in both AD&D and 5th Edition D&D formats. 
 

*TRADEMARK DISCLAIMER

"D&D" and "AD&D" are trademarks of Wizards of the Coast, LLC. Art of the Genre is not affiliated with Wizards of the Coast LLC. We make no claim to, or challenge to, such trademarks

story:
What is Dirty Cash?

This is a unique, double rondel, dice based game with lots of player agency. As a player you will have many choices throughout game play. From robbing an opposing players business, buying one yourself, building your crew to take over the drug trade or becoming an infamous bank robbing unit. You will have the chance to put a hit out on other players, call a shootout or stop in for hand of poker at the casino, hit the Football Club and bet on a game, even take a loan out from the “Loan Shark” for that dope drug deal you want to make and much much more.

But be careful, the streets are rough in DC City. You will run into rival gangs and cops, make alliances and break them. Your goal?  To rule the streets and be the first to amass $100,000 in Dirty Cash!

Check out the perks for funding. From a digital poster to a first generation signed game, even becoming a character in the game, there are a wealth of options.

 

What will we do with the money?

Over the last few months the Dirty Cash crew have been play testing the game to great result. Test groups absolutely loved this game. The DC team is happy to announce that we are this close producing the first generation (limited edition) Dirty Cash board game... with your help.

This campaign is set up to help the DC team get the game through the final stages of development. Though the game is “play ready”, we need to finalize designs such as 3d printed Figurines, dice and features on the board to name a few. The funds will allow us to grow portions of our team in order to get the game ready for first gen production. Giving us the ability to test print and narrow down where the final game will be produced. The only way to get your hands on a limited edition first gen copy is through donating to our campaign. Our goal is to have these finalize and shipped out by July.

If you can't donate, that's okay, we still love you. Follow us on Facebook for updates and contests with a chance to win sweet perks and even the game itself!

Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/dirtycashgame

Website

www.dirtycash.com.au

Thank you for your time and we look forward to seeing you on the STREETS!

story:
This campaign is now Ovah.  We still got some left though, over at our website.

 

Virtue Signal: The Game of Social Justice is a card game parody of social justice activism.

In Virtue Signal you play as one of several different social justice warriors. The object, simply, is to attract a coalition of NPC followers to your cause, whatever that is. The first player to 15 is the winner.

Virtue Signal simulates the power struggles and one-upmanship that goes on between activist groups. The issues themselves are of little consequence, they are merely useful tools to get leverage over others.

May the wokest warrior win.

 

 "A game for those who are ready to wake up from woke.”  –Peter Thiel

Holding steady at 8.2 on BoardGameGeeks with 50 ratings.

Now on to our show.

The Deplorables expansion adds over a hundred new cards to the game, and allows you (finally) to grief other players as a disgusting internet troll.

Meet the Deplorables

The expansion contains 8 new characters, each with their own personality and special ability.  

This brings the grand total to 20.

 

The deplorables are a game within a game.  The deplorable players use a separate deck all their own, with unique cards, game mechanics and objectives.

In place of NPC followers, the Deplorable player has raiders.  These are the disobedient minions who do your evil bidding sometimes but not really.   

Like NPCs, raiders have a power level of one two or three.  Unlike NPCs they use the new black alignment (nihilist).  The most toxic raiders only have nihilist alignments.  You know, because realism.

Deplorable raiders operate as a kind of collective parasite, infiltrating the coalitions of other players, getting in the way, and being a general annoyance.  The more they infiltrate the more toxic they become, and higher toxicity levels grant the ability to use increasingly more powerful and obnoxious abilities.

As you can see, the Antifa Crusader has a full-blown infestation on his hands.  If he does not win this Info War he will find himself in big trouble.

 

Every bad thing the Deplorable player makes happen gives him the the option of taking a trophy from his opponents (think stuffed heads mounted on a wall.)  When he collects the requisite number of trophies he wins the game.  

Winning as a deplorable character is difficult, but possible.

but a mere taste

 

Chaos.

It wouldn't be terribly realistic if the raiders behaved like an organized group.  While the deplorable player(s) have the most influence over where the raiders go and what they do, they can be controlled by any player if the circumstances are right.  

Unlike NPC's, raiders can be moved around freely once placed: within a coalition and from one coalition to another.  Thus it is possible theoretically for any SJW player to weaponize their autism for xir own advantage.

 

The nonexistent Fantasy Tradwaifu.  Wheat field and bloemenkrans sold separately.

 

From a gameplay perspective, we designed it so the deplorable player acts as a kind of game timer.  His development is slower than other players, but only increases as the game progresses.  If the other players take too long or fight too much amongst themselves, they will find themselves consumed by the batrachian horror.

 

Neato, What Else?

Of course it wouldn't be fair to give all the fun stuff to the deplorables.  There are dozens of new cards for the base deck as well.  Artifacts of power, new specials, new microaggressions and new plots.

Artifacts of Power

Artifacts are unique specials with (mostly) permanent effects.

 

Currently there are 9 artifacts but we keep thinking of new ones so there will probably be more by the time everything is finished.

A New Lease On Life for Alignment and Gender

Alignment and gender mechanics were introduced in the base game, but not a lot got done with them.  This oversight will be rectified in the Deplorables expansion.  Several alignment- and gender-specific cards have already been added and we plan on adding more.  

Female-identifying characters are designed to be uniquely vulnerable to deplorables, but get powerful attacks against them as well. Just like in real life.

 

 

Risks and challenges

We run a tight ship, and we don't make excuses for being slow just because there's a pandemic. As before, the only thing that can go wrong is that the project gets cancelled by some humorless bint.
story_txt:
This campaign is now Ovah.  We still got some left though, over at our website.
 
Virtue Signal: The Game of Social Justice is a card game parody of social justice activism.
In Virtue Signal you play as one of several different social justice warriors. The object, simply, is to attract a coalition of NPC followers to your cause, whatever that is. The first player to 15 is the winner.
Virtue Signal simulates the power struggles and one-upmanship that goes on between activist groups. The issues themselves are of little consequence, they are merely useful tools to get leverage over others.
May the wokest warrior win.

 

 "A game for those who are ready to wake up from woke.”  –Peter Thiel
Holding steady at 8.2 on BoardGameGeeks with 50 ratings.
Now on to our show.


The Deplorables expansion adds over a hundred new cards to the game, and allows you (finally) to grief other players as a disgusting internet troll.
Meet the Deplorables
The expansion contains 8 new characters, each with their own personality and special ability.  
This brings the grand total to 20.
 
The deplorables are a game within a game.  The deplorable players use a separate deck all their own, with unique cards, game mechanics and objectives.
In place of NPC followers, the Deplorable player has raiders.  These are the disobedient minions who do your evil bidding sometimes but not really.   

Like NPCs, raiders have a power level of one two or three.  Unlike NPCs they use the new black alignment (nihilist).  The most toxic raiders only have nihilist alignments.  You know, because realism.
Deplorable raiders operate as a kind of collective parasite, infiltrating the coalitions of other players, getting in the way, and being a general annoyance.  The more they infiltrate the more toxic they become, and higher toxicity levels grant the ability to use increasingly more powerful and obnoxious abilities.

As you can see, the Antifa Crusader has a full-blown infestation on his hands.  If he does not win this Info War he will find himself in big trouble.
 
Every bad thing the Deplorable player makes happen gives him the the option of taking a trophy from his opponents (think stuffed heads mounted on a wall.)  When he collects the requisite number of trophies he wins the game.  
Winning as a deplorable character is difficult, but possible.

but a mere taste
 
Chaos.
It wouldn't be terribly realistic if the raiders behaved like an organized group.  While the deplorable player(s) have the most influence over where the raiders go and what they do, they can be controlled by any player if the circumstances are right.  
Unlike NPC's, raiders can be moved around freely once placed: within a coalition and from one coalition to another.  Thus it is possible theoretically for any SJW player to weaponize their autism for xir own advantage.
 

The nonexistent Fantasy Tradwaifu.  Wheat field and bloemenkrans sold separately.
 
From a gameplay perspective, we designed it so the deplorable player acts as a kind of game timer.  His development is slower than other players, but only increases as the game progresses.  If the other players take too long or fight too much amongst themselves, they will find themselves consumed by the batrachian horror.
 
Neato, What Else?
Of course it wouldn't be fair to give all the fun stuff to the deplorables.  There are dozens of new cards for the base deck as well.  Artifacts of power, new specials, new microaggressions and new plots.
Artifacts of Power
Artifacts are unique specials with (mostly) permanent effects.

 
Currently there are 9 artifacts but we keep thinking of new ones so there will probably be more by the time everything is finished.
A New Lease On Life for Alignment and Gender
Alignment and gender mechanics were introduced in the base game, but not a lot got done with them.  This oversight will be rectified in the Deplorables expansion.  Several alignment- and gender-specific cards have already been added and we plan on adding more.  

Female-identifying characters are designed to be uniquely vulnerable to deplorables, but get powerful attacks against them as well. Just like in real life.
 

 
Risks and challenges
We run a tight ship, and we don't make excuses for being slow just because there's a pandemic. As before, the only thing that can go wrong is that the project gets cancelled by some humorless bint.

story:
Short Summary

We are the community known as St. Clement's Episcopal Church.  Today, St. Clement's continues its worship and its work in a building erected in 1872 on 46th St.   The congregation, though small, has a large, compassionate heart and open, welcoming arms.  But, like many bodies as they age, though the heart beats strongly, the body needs repair, immediate and urgent repair.   Sometimes the cost of those repairs exceeds the capabilities of its members.  A portion of the building's roof needs repaving, repairs made to its facade, and an endowment fund needs to be established for future needs.  Now is the time for renaissance , rebirth & renewal.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Roof:  Replace flat roof both east and west sides. Cost $40,000
  • Buttress east side of building: repair brickwork and bolster support. Cost:$10,000
  • Front staircase repair:Cost: $10,000
  • Electrical Room/3rd Floor hallway ceiling, Serious water leak in the ceiling, needs to be repaired and painted.
  • Back room on the 3rd floor (prop room), broken windows need to be replaced
  • Front door: rehang and add glass doors
  • Office: ceiling wires by fan need to be fixed by an electrician and patch/paint ceiling
  • Fire escape stage left: some of the metal is rusting out. 
  • Smoke Alarms in Electrical Room must be installed and wired into the fire alarm box in the basement.
  • Backstage left wall has holes in the bricks
  • Green Room has water leak on outside wall
  • Sacristy outside wall has water damage
  • 2nd Floor stair well brick work is cracked
  • Red Room ceiling has water damage
  • Stairwell to basement has wet bricks
  • Kitchen Renovation :Costs $10,000
  • Stained glass windows repair


  • The Impact

St . Clement's impact on the community can be seen in the outreach of our food pantry, community interaction, and social and theatrical outreach. We offer a harbor or respite to those looking for peace where they find hope.

Risks & Challenges

St. Clement's ministry is to its neighborhood and the arts community.  A large portion of its members are performing artists seeking to carve a career for themselves.  They struggle to support themselves while seeking work in their chosen fields.  Thus, their income level is lower than the average parishioner.  In addition, their presence within the congregation is more fluid than with the average congregation as they often times are away for significant periods on booked projects or are at the mercy of temporary job schedules.

St. Clement's also draws a number of young professionals who, as they advance in their careers, marry, have children, thereafter move out of the neighborhood to follow their  career paths or grow their families.

Some of the congregation is older and having to rely on fixed incomes.

Still others have special needs, are unable to work or hold positions of responsibility and are dependent on outside assistance to survive.

Each of these groups contributes to the support of St. Clement's as best as they are able, but their numbers are modest and the needs are great.

The challenges St. Clement's faces are somewhat daunting.  There is no endowment from which to draw funds to assist in building repair.   Whatever endowment St. Clement's has had is one.  The congregation is housed in a building constructed in 1872 which requires greater upkeep with each passing year.  

Despite these challenges St. Clement's is and  has been a strong presence in its community, with social outreach through projects like it's food pantry and by providing spiritual nourishment not only to those living in the neighborhood, but also to the many tourists who visit New York each year.  Its members are determined that its rich legacy should continue into a bright and strong future,

  • With your help we hope to raise enough money for  an endowment fund which will allow us to resolve the above issues .
  • Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • We need your help to spread the word.  No donation is too small.  Anything you can do to contribute to this cause would be greatly appreciated.
  • Share this info with your friends!
