 With your help we hope to raise enough money for  an endowment fund which will allow us to resolve the above issues .

Other Ways You Can Help


 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  We need your help to spread the word.  No donation is too small.  Anything you can do to contribute to this cause would be greatly appreciated. Share this info with your friends!

story:
UPDATE:

The campaign is now over. For future updates or purchases, please check out our website:


http://www.domd.be/

 

About Deck of Many Drinks

In 2010, the 4chan message board created a drinking game that combined features of multiple existing games as well as introducing some new ideas. While the game was very fun to play, it lacked consistency, proper artwork and content that could be enjoyed by a wider audience.

Not much later, we made our own version of the game and have been playing it ever since, refining and playtesting it with our friends and family along the way. After some time we started realizing the game was rather popular with anyone we introduced it to. More and more people started asking us where they could get their own deck, so we started seriously thinking about making a version we could proudly offer to a greater public.

Queue another year of designing, creating artwork and testing, and we have finally reached a state where the game is ready for distribution.

What We Need & What You Get

We would like to make a bulk print order to drive the price per deck down, but for this we need an initial investment. To bridge this cost, we decided to opt for a pre-order sales model through a crowdfunding website to minimize the risk for our backers.

The price point of the game is set in such a way that, without making a big profit, we would still be able to print the pre-ordered decks even if our funding goal of € 2.500 would not be reached.

When the campaign is finished and we receive the collected funds, we will immediately place the bulk order. From our experience, the orders take around 1 month to arrive to our distribution center (read: home). From there we will deliver the decks to your doorstep as soon as possible through whichever mailing service is the most beneficial for your location.

 

Risks & Challenges

As we are nearing the end of the production process, most of the risks and challenges have already been overcome. As far as we can see, the only possible problems that could occur are:

  • Problems with our manufacturer (though we have very good past experiences)
  • Shipment delivery problems (this is difficult to predict, but we will look at it on a case-by-case basis)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't wish to purchase the game or lack the money at this time, you can still help us out by sharing this campaign on your social media pages or telling your friends and family about us!

 

Shipping Sidenote

Obviously if we know you personally and can give you the deck in person, we will reimburse the shipping costs. Unfortunately IndieGogo does not support this option out of the box...

 

 

DISCLAIMER:

Drinking can be fun, but please be careful. Never drink more than you can handle, take regular breaks from drinking and don't push other people into drinking more than they want to.

Alcohol is a drug, treat it accordingly.

We are not responsible for any damages related to the playing of this game.

story:
Wicked Ones is a Forged in the Dark tabletop RPG where you play fantasy monsters raiding human lands, hoarding the gold they loot, and building a dungeon to protect it. Your notoriety lures increasingly greedy and powerful adventurers to your dungeon. Can you  stave off the inevitable onslaught of heroism that your notoriety brings?

Wicked Ones is essentially Dungeon Keeper meets Blades in the Dark.  You spend most sessions going on raids and building your dungeon, then every few sessions you put your dungeon to the test against invading adventurers. You play as monsters doing monster stuff and it's a hell of a good time. 

True Monsters are unique monsters that don’t follow callings, instead having their own set of unique abilities and game mechanics.  Bloodsuckers  thrive on feeding on blood but are hindered by their thirst and aversion to sunlight. Augres graft metal parts directly onto their bodies, but have an extreme fixation on metallurgy that drives them to acquire it at all costs. 

Heroes of the Empire are a separate set of cards featuring adventurers with moves inspired by War for the Overworld's Empire units. These are only available to backers who also receive the Toolkit.

Dungeon Builder mode is a solo play mode where you build a dungeon by yourself, send minions out to raid, and defend against adventurers. It simplifies the mechanics of the base game and gives a more strictly defined ruleset for invading adventurers. This mode can also be used for easily generating dungeons to send PCs up against in other games!

WFTO Splatbook is a 20-30 page splatbook containing all of the previous WFTO content plus a new sandbox map based on the WFTO world, factions, NPCs, additional content, and a new Underlord mode that better recreates the gameplay style in WFTO.

 

You play as one of the wicked ones, monsters with the rare ability to see the bigger picture, to develop plans, work together, and use minions to further their goals. Every monster is flawed, with something deep, dark, and terrible lurking inside their heart - and you choose what your flaw is. It hinders you, leading you away from your goals, but play into it and you'll be rewarded with bonus dice called dark hearts to spend in play and XP at the end of each session. This balance makes it fun to play a monster that has goals, but is still pushed towards monstrous tendencies.

Wicked ones follow one of nine callings, each giving unique abilities to choose from and XP triggers that reward you for playing into that calling's play style.

In addition, each player creates a small group of minions - cutthroats, grunts, mages, priests, raiders, thieves, or tricksters. They make up the bulk of your dungeon's denizens. Players can slip into the role of these minions, fully fleshing out and breathing life into the dungeon. Essentially, players play two characters - their wicked one and their minions.

 

Your dungeon is your home, your only safe refuge in a world that despises you. It's your defense against powerful heroes who would see you fall. Before the first session, you choose a dungeon style as a group, giving you a theme to build your group around and access to unique dungeon rooms supporting that theme.  

Most importantly, you draw out all of this on the dungeon sheet together! Every detail matters and comes into play while defending your dungeon. Your dungeon isn't an abstract entity - it exists right there on the paper. The book will have a thorough guide with a lot of advice for those not familiar with drawing out dungeons.

Your dungeon increases in power from tier 0 to tier 4 and consists of weak imps that do the manual labor, minions that players control, creatures that are attracted to your dungeon by your hoard, specialists that you hire to do specific tasks, dungeon rooms which provide powerful bonuses, traps with mechanisms and triggers decided when you build them, and locks to keep adventurers out of sensitive areas.  And at each tier, as your imps dig out your dungeon rooms, you roll to see what you discover underground - rivers of lava, spider queens, gold veins, gnomes, buried ruins, and more. 

The first level of your dungeon houses your minions, dungeon rooms, and traps. As adventurers invade your dungeon, players take on the roles of the minions and try to thwart them. If the adventurers manage to overcome your first line of defenses, they descend to the second floor and into your sanctum where the wicked ones wait for a climactic battle.

 

Wicked Ones has a clearly defined cycle of play: Roaming, Raiding, Lurking, and Defending. The passage of time is important as building a dungeon is a huge task. The cycle of play allows you to skip to the exciting bits, keeping each session action packed, while still allowing for the passage of time.

 Most sessions of Wicked Ones consist of roaming, raiding, and lurking with defending happening about once every 4 sessions. A typical campaign going from a tier 0 dungeon to a tier 4 dungeon would span about 16 sessions. However, it works quite well for one shots and short campaigns as well, and several scenarios for these will be included.

As you raid the world and your notoriety increases, you draw the attention of increasingly powerful adventurers. The players also set a master plan which gives XP when they work towards it, while each faction works towards their own goals as well, leading towards conflict. Monsters are their own worst enemies and for all the plans and machinations the wicked ones have, they are still monsters. This balance and the fun that happens by playing into the flaws or keeping them at bay is what captures the feeling of playing a monster. 

When you finally reach max notoriety, end-game scenarios are triggered. It's a tipping point where civilization recognizes you as a dire threat and will do everything they can to destroy you.

 

 Your dungeon ties you strongly to its immediate surroundings as venturing too far from it risks invasion while you're gone, a minion uprising, or other evil factions moving in. The game works best when the scope is relatively small, zoomed into a local region, a sandbox ready for the wicked ones to rampage through it. However, you can't just abandon your dungeon and leave the sandbox - you'll have to deal with the blowback of your raiding.

The book includes guidelines on creating your own setting with factions and important NPCs, but it also comes with 5 sandboxes ready to rampage through. Each sandbox comes with a regional map, a list of factions and goals they're pursuing, major NPCs, secrets to discover and a starting scenario with some initial raid targets. After the first session, each player chooses a vile friend they've made and a faction they've angered during the initial setup of the dungeon, tying the players more strongly to the sandbox that they help flesh out.

One of these 5 sandboxes is the Forest Village, shown in the map above. Hard-working, pious people live their lives trying to maintain their independence from a baron off map to the east. A garrison of his troops exerts pressure on the region, regularly causing trouble. A community of elves live hidden in the southern woods, their borders protected by enchanted animals. A seedy tavern built outside the village along the forest road makes for a common place for adventurers to gather.

 

Wicked Ones is a game driven by character action, meaning the players roll dice and the NPCs act when the rolls are failures. Every roll has a position which determines the severity of the consequences of failure and four possible results from a roll - a critical success, a success, a mixed success, or a failure. This guarantees that every time you roll, something will happen and move the story forward. A typical raid consists of these actions rolls blending together, rolling into one another as consequences and tension pile up until the monsters come out the other side with loot in hand and a few heavy wounds to show for their troubles.

The game is built on the system made by John Harper for his excellent Blades in the Dark. I haven't discussed most of the concepts and mechanics of that game here for lack of space, but it's a fiction first system where a character's actions and the consequences of those actions are determined by the circumstances surrounding it. It's a flexible system that allows players and GMs to judge a variety of situations and really lets players get creative. It's a framework for ruling on different situations instead of providing specific rules. 

The FitD mechanics have been heavily modified to suit Wicked Ones. Click here to check out the mechanics in a nutshell and some examples of play!

And here's a quick list of some of the cool stuff the Wicked Ones mechanics captures:

  • You draw out your dungeon - its rooms, tunnels, traps, creatures, things you discover, private lairs, and sanctum are all drawn out. It's obviously the most unique feature of the game and the dungeons it makes are creative and awesome.
  • Players can roleplay monsters, meaning they don't feel bad about working against the group's interests because there's mechanical encouragement for sometimes playing up your monstrous nature and at other times, suppressing it to work towards group goals.
  • You collect battle scars which give you permanent XP, making you gain abilities faster. Too many scars and you've been beat into a pulp, though, and your character is retired.
  • You go feral when you take too much stress, a resource used to resist consequences. You become beholden to your flaws, having to act to satisfy them. You're truly a monster. Go feral too many times, though, and your characters slips over the edge and is retired.
  • Magic is creative and on-the-fly. Players detail the spell they want to cast and the GM gives it a tier determining how difficult it is. Magic is very creative.
  • Monster science is possible with insane contraptions, alchemical compounds, potions, and more. The system is flexible and rewarding, but with danger and volatility built in. 

X Card support is built into the Wicked Ones. To put it simply, the X Card is an X on an index card that anyone can point to to signal they're not comfortable with the current scene for whatever reason. The GM then moves past the scene and makes a note to avoid such content in the future. Playing evil characters opens up some topics that might normally be off limits or never come up. This poses a very sensitive issue as what's off limits differs greatly from person to person. The game comes with a default set of "off limits" and "off cameras" that will probably be enough for most groups, but also has advice on having your own conversation about them and how to use the X Card.

Roll20 works great with Wicked Ones and has proven to be a great tool for us during playtests. Drawing out the dungeon together is great fun. Roll20 character sheets and other assets are 100% going to get made prior to release.

We started streaming our weekly playtests recently. It's not so polished and we're pretty new at this, but it's nice to get a look at how the game plays. We play on Thursdays at 7:30pm CST. You can check it out on Twitch at GLScuzz's (the Gromp player) Twitch channel.

You can also check out the latest session below. The first hour or so deals with setting up the dungeon and lurking activities, so you can jump forward to the 1 hour mark to see the gang jumping into some raiding.

 

 

The rewards are fairly simple, with just two tiers. You can either get the full game or the full game and a 72-card tarot deck toolkit that makes playing a bit smoother. There is an additional tier as well which can select to receive a steam code for the PC game War for the Overworld, too!

 

In closing, a quick message from Ben, the designer:

I always wanted to make a Dungeon Keeper-inspired tabletop game. I knew that there was some amazing gameplay in the building up and defending of your dungeon. Once I played John Harper's Blades in the Dark, I became completely absorbed in the idea of making my dungeon building game happen. A year later, here I am with the coolest project I've ever worked on, ready to get it out in front of many more people.

The core game rules are based on a heavily modified version of the Forged in the Dark system. They're mostly complete and we've playtested the heck out of the game. The system feels smooth, with no major hiccups, and really captures the feeling of playing as monsters. The dungeons players draw are unique and interesting and, most importantly, feel like dungeons. They have this awesome emergent quality to them and it's a blast seeing how they develop. And when all your planning pays off and you wipe out an adventurer party, it feels really rewarding. At this point, I feel confident that others are going to love playing Wicked Ones as much as I do. 

So we're on Kickstarter for two main reasons. First, we need more art. Victor Costa (buy him a coffee!) is doing all of the art for this project and creating an amazing, consistent vision that captures the tone of the game perfectly. We're about 25% of the way through the art for the book and great art takes time and money, money which I've paid on my own so far. It's important to me that I felt confident investing my own money in the project before asking others to back it as well.  Second, though, is that I want to expand the playtest. As soon as the Kickstarter wraps up, I'm going to release a playtest packet to all backers. I want to get more eyes on the game to help make it the best dungeon building game we can.

Thank you all for considering backing! After all, these dungeons aren't going to build themselves!   - Ben
story_txt:
Wicked Ones is a Forged in the Dark tabletop RPG where you play fantasy monsters raiding human lands, hoarding the gold they loot, and building a dungeon to protect it. Your notoriety lures increasingly greedy and powerful adventurers to your dungeon. Can you  stave off the inevitable onslaught of heroism that your notoriety brings?Wicked Ones is essentially Dungeon Keeper meets Blades in the Dark.  You spend most sessions going on raids and building your dungeon, then every few sessions you put your dungeon to the test against invading adventurers. You play as monsters doing monster stuff and it's a hell of a good time. True Monsters are unique monsters that don’t follow callings, instead having their own set of unique abilities and game mechanics.  Bloodsuckers  thrive on feeding on blood but are hindered by their thirst and aversion to sunlight. Augres graft metal parts directly onto their bodies, but have an extreme fixation on metallurgy that drives them to acquire it at all costs. Heroes of the Empire are a separate set of cards featuring adventurers with moves inspired by War for the Overworld's Empire units. These are only available to backers who also receive the Toolkit.Dungeon Builder mode is a solo play mode where you build a dungeon by yourself, send minions out to raid, and defend against adventurers. It simplifies the mechanics of the base game and gives a more strictly defined ruleset for invading adventurers. This mode can also be used for easily generating dungeons to send PCs up against in other games!WFTO Splatbook is a 20-30 page splatbook containing all of the previous WFTO content plus a new sandbox map based on the WFTO world, factions, NPCs, additional content, and a new Underlord mode that better recreates the gameplay style in WFTO. You play as one of the wicked ones, monsters with the rare ability to see the bigger picture, to develop plans, work together, and use minions to further their goals. Every monster is flawed, with something deep, dark, and terrible lurking inside their heart - and you choose what your flaw is. It hinders you, leading you away from your goals, but play into it and you'll be rewarded with bonus dice called dark hearts to spend in play and XP at the end of each session. This balance makes it fun to play a monster that has goals, but is still pushed towards monstrous tendencies.Wicked ones follow one of nine callings, each giving unique abilities to choose from and XP triggers that reward you for playing into that calling's play style.In addition, each player creates a small group of minions - cutthroats, grunts, mages, priests, raiders, thieves, or tricksters. They make up the bulk of your dungeon's denizens. Players can slip into the role of these minions, fully fleshing out and breathing life into the dungeon. Essentially, players play two characters - their wicked one and their minions. Your dungeon is your home, your only safe refuge in a world that despises you. It's your defense against powerful heroes who would see you fall. Before the first session, you choose a dungeon style as a group, giving you a theme to build your group around and access to unique dungeon rooms supporting that theme.  Most importantly, you draw out all of this on the dungeon sheet together! Every detail matters and comes into play while defending your dungeon. Your dungeon isn't an abstract entity - it exists right there on the paper. The book will have a thorough guide with a lot of advice for those not familiar with drawing out dungeons.Your dungeon increases in power from tier 0 to tier 4 and consists of weak imps that do the manual labor, minions that players control, creatures that are attracted to your dungeon by your hoard, specialists that you hire to do specific tasks, dungeon rooms which provide powerful bonuses, traps with mechanisms and triggers decided when you build them, and locks to keep adventurers out of sensitive areas.  And at each tier, as your imps dig out your dungeon rooms, you roll to see what you discover underground - rivers of lava, spider queens, gold veins, gnomes, buried ruins, and more. The first level of your dungeon houses your minions, dungeon rooms, and traps. As adventurers invade your dungeon, players take on the roles of the minions and try to thwart them. If the adventurers manage to overcome your first line of defenses, they descend to the second floor and into your sanctum where the wicked ones wait for a climactic battle. Wicked Ones has a clearly defined cycle of play: Roaming, Raiding, Lurking, and Defending. The passage of time is important as building a dungeon is a huge task. The cycle of play allows you to skip to the exciting bits, keeping each session action packed, while still allowing for the passage of time. Most sessions of Wicked Ones consist of roaming, raiding, and lurking with defending happening about once every 4 sessions. A typical campaign going from a tier 0 dungeon to a tier 4 dungeon would span about 16 sessions. However, it works quite well for one shots and short campaigns as well, and several scenarios for these will be included.As you raid the world and your notoriety increases, you draw the attention of increasingly powerful adventurers. The players also set a master plan which gives XP when they work towards it, while each faction works towards their own goals as well, leading towards conflict. Monsters are their own worst enemies and for all the plans and machinations the wicked ones have, they are still monsters. This balance and the fun that happens by playing into the flaws or keeping them at bay is what captures the feeling of playing a monster. When you finally reach max notoriety, end-game scenarios are triggered. It's a tipping point where civilization recognizes you as a dire threat and will do everything they can to destroy you.  Your dungeon ties you strongly to its immediate surroundings as venturing too far from it risks invasion while you're gone, a minion uprising, or other evil factions moving in. The game works best when the scope is relatively small, zoomed into a local region, a sandbox ready for the wicked ones to rampage through it. However, you can't just abandon your dungeon and leave the sandbox - you'll have to deal with the blowback of your raiding.The book includes guidelines on creating your own setting with factions and important NPCs, but it also comes with 5 sandboxes ready to rampage through. Each sandbox comes with a regional map, a list of factions and goals they're pursuing, major NPCs, secrets to discover and a starting scenario with some initial raid targets. After the first session, each player chooses a vile friend they've made and a faction they've angered during the initial setup of the dungeon, tying the players more strongly to the sandbox that they help flesh out.One of these 5 sandboxes is the Forest Village, shown in the map above. Hard-working, pious people live their lives trying to maintain their independence from a baron off map to the east. A garrison of his troops exerts pressure on the region, regularly causing trouble. A community of elves live hidden in the southern woods, their borders protected by enchanted animals. A seedy tavern built outside the village along the forest road makes for a common place for adventurers to gather. Wicked Ones is a game driven by character action, meaning the players roll dice and the NPCs act when the rolls are failures. Every roll has a position which determines the severity of the consequences of failure and four possible results from a roll - a critical success, a success, a mixed success, or a failure. This guarantees that every time you roll, something will happen and move the story forward. A typical raid consists of these actions rolls blending together, rolling into one another as consequences and tension pile up until the monsters come out the other side with loot in hand and a few heavy wounds to show for their troubles.The game is built on the system made by John Harper for his excellent Blades in the Dark. I haven't discussed most of the concepts and mechanics of that game here for lack of space, but it's a fiction first system where a character's actions and the consequences of those actions are determined by the circumstances surrounding it. It's a flexible system that allows players and GMs to judge a variety of situations and really lets players get creative. It's a framework for ruling on different situations instead of providing specific rules. The FitD mechanics have been heavily modified to suit Wicked Ones. Click here to check out the mechanics in a nutshell and some examples of play!And here's a quick list of some of the cool stuff the Wicked Ones mechanics captures:

You draw out your dungeon - its rooms, tunnels, traps, creatures, things you discover, private lairs, and sanctum are all drawn out. It's obviously the most unique feature of the game and the dungeons it makes are creative and awesome.

Players can roleplay monsters, meaning they don't feel bad about working against the group's interests because there's mechanical encouragement for sometimes playing up your monstrous nature and at other times, suppressing it to work towards group goals.

You collect battle scars which give you permanent XP, making you gain abilities faster. Too many scars and you've been beat into a pulp, though, and your character is retired.

You go feral when you take too much stress, a resource used to resist consequences. You become beholden to your flaws, having to act to satisfy them. You're truly a monster. Go feral too many times, though, and your characters slips over the edge and is retired.

Magic is creative and on-the-fly. Players detail the spell they want to cast and the GM gives it a tier determining how difficult it is. Magic is very creative.

Monster science is possible with insane contraptions, alchemical compounds, potions, and more. The system is flexible and rewarding, but with danger and volatility built in. 
X Card support is built into the Wicked Ones. To put it simply, the X Card is an X on an index card that anyone can point to to signal they're not comfortable with the current scene for whatever reason. The GM then moves past the scene and makes a note to avoid such content in the future. Playing evil characters opens up some topics that might normally be off limits or never come up. This poses a very sensitive issue as what's off limits differs greatly from person to person. The game comes with a default set of "off limits" and "off cameras" that will probably be enough for most groups, but also has advice on having your own conversation about them and how to use the X Card.Roll20 works great with Wicked Ones and has proven to be a great tool for us during playtests. Drawing out the dungeon together is great fun. Roll20 character sheets and other assets are 100% going to get made prior to release.We started streaming our weekly playtests recently. It's not so polished and we're pretty new at this, but it's nice to get a look at how the game plays. We play on Thursdays at 7:30pm CST. You can check it out on Twitch at GLScuzz's (the Gromp player) Twitch channel.You can also check out the latest session below. The first hour or so deals with setting up the dungeon and lurking activities, so you can jump forward to the 1 hour mark to see the gang jumping into some raiding.
 
 

The rewards are fairly simple, with just two tiers. You can either get the full game or the full game and a 72-card tarot deck toolkit that makes playing a bit smoother. There is an additional tier as well which can select to receive a steam code for the PC game War for the Overworld, too! In closing, a quick message from Ben, the designer:I always wanted to make a Dungeon Keeper-inspired tabletop game. I knew that there was some amazing gameplay in the building up and defending of your dungeon. Once I played John Harper's Blades in the Dark, I became completely absorbed in the idea of making my dungeon building game happen. A year later, here I am with the coolest project I've ever worked on, ready to get it out in front of many more people.The core game rules are based on a heavily modified version of the Forged in the Dark system. They're mostly complete and we've playtested the heck out of the game. The system feels smooth, with no major hiccups, and really captures the feeling of playing as monsters. The dungeons players draw are unique and interesting and, most importantly, feel like dungeons. They have this awesome emergent quality to them and it's a blast seeing how they develop. And when all your planning pays off and you wipe out an adventurer party, it feels really rewarding. At this point, I feel confident that others are going to love playing Wicked Ones as much as I do. So we're on Kickstarter for two main reasons. First, we need more art. Victor Costa (buy him a coffee!) is doing all of the art for this project and creating an amazing, consistent vision that captures the tone of the game perfectly. We're about 25% of the way through the art for the book and great art takes time and money, money which I've paid on my own so far. It's important to me that I felt confident investing my own money in the project before asking others to back it as well.  Second, though, is that I want to expand the playtest. As soon as the Kickstarter wraps up, I'm going to release a playtest packet to all backers. I want to get more eyes on the game to help make it the best dungeon building game we can.Thank you all for considering backing! After all, these dungeons aren't going to build themselves!   - Ben

story:
Who Are We and What is This OMICRON Thing?

We're Firmer Terra, LLC. and our company was born here 3 years ago when we offered our innovative gaming surface.  Thanks to our original offering we've managed to make many new friends and play a ton of new games.

 
 

 

The OMICRON Battle System is a game organizer for any gamer who has to drag along books, tokens, pieces and gaming tools.  It's a box withing a box, within more organizer boxes and trays.  The whole idea behind this system is to add a touch of rustic class while remaining a practical organizer before, during, and after your game event.

A prestigious gift for all tabletop gamers.

Tired of dice rolling all over the place?  Missing pieces or books that you forgot to pack up?  Running around the room trying to find tape measures, cards, or tokens?  We've got you covered.  In fact, one OMICRON system packs enough organization for your opponent to share.

Some of you may have seen our original shell prototypes at the 2019 Adepticon event.  After a lot of feedback and woodwork we feel the Omicron Battle System will be a great tool for any gamer.  Main Box Dimensions: 13" x 10 1/4" x 4 1/4"

So why wood and not plastics or other materials?  Woodcraft is a dying art.  We want to support a long tradition of woodcraft in a Polish community (Mountains outside of Krakow).  Essentially, you're helping keep an industry, and a craft, alive by choosing the more natural and classic look.  Our system is harvested from Polish Pine trees, finished and laser etched, then hand finished for a unique look. 

 

WHAT'S INSIDE?

  • TOP AND BOTTOM TRAY, MID TRAY, AND TWO SUPPORT/DICE TRAYS.

 

  • DOUBLE DECK BOX AND SINGLE DECK BOX

Double Deck Box Dimensions: 5 3/4" x 6 3/8" x 1 3/4"

Small Deck Box Dimensions: 4 3/4" x 3 3/4" x 1 1/2"

 

Build your OMICRON Battle System by choosing one of two artworks (Devil vs Angel Battle Scene or Skulls) and one of two wood finish: Natural Gold and Chocolate Dark. 

Why Are We Doing This on Indiegogo?

 Raising funds from an initial launch also allows us to predict the first batch size and thus get the finished system in your hands quickly.  We're looking for a batch order to get economies of scale for some aspects like the metal corners and felt liner inserts.

Our initial campaign will run for $4600.00 to be considered a success.  Once we receive our finished system here in the States (our goal is before December 1, 2019) we will use our company distribution channels to get these systems in your hands around the first of December or sooner.  Canadian and EU customers will receive their systems from our European location.

The Impact

Our goal for your support:

  • You'll have a unique table piece that will look classic and be useful for years.
  • Put your money into a crafting industry that is in need of support and growth instead of some giant mass production factory.
  • Save time with game organization.  Better organization means fewer lost pieces and more time gaming.

Risks & Challenges

Business is a risk, and to say that this is 100% fool-proof is silly.  Ships can sink, resources can run into supply issues and people break legs.  We have spent the last year setting-up all supply and craft chains.  These things are ready to go.  We are gathering interest and building an initial batch.  We will keep you updated on each step until they go out to your door.

We are business people before we are gamers in this case.  From past experience, some of you will know, that we take your support very seriously.  In the end, we hope to have this product become another evolving and expanding like for the community. 

What Are We Asking From You Now?

  • Your support of course, but also your feedback.
  • We are running this project on thin margins, so any word that you can spread about us is most appreciated. 
  • If you have specific questions you can always reach out to us.

Basically, there you go.  Have a look at the video.  Ask questions, and keep rolling those dice.

story:
Hey chess lovers!

We know that there’s nothing like playing a game of chess on a real board. But, let’s face it. It’s a busy world, people stay miles away from each other and even if someone wants to come over to play, it requires a hell lot of a planning. Phew! Too much effort. Result, you give up and end up playing chess online. How boring.  

Square Off is all set to redefine the world of board games, starting with chess. Bringing to you the world’s smartest, most connected and the most evolved chess board. It enables you to play your favourite game against a fellow chess enthusiast from anywhere in the world. The automated board is designed to reflect the move of your opponent with precision. Not just that, you can challenge the artificial intelligence of the board too.  

Yes, Square Off is here to bring back those charming old days when people played chess on classic tangible boards. Felt chess from their heart, indulged in the luxury of playing with wooden boards and handcrafted chess pieces. Where on one hand, it has revived the classic charisma of chess, on the other hand, Square Off has also made it smarter, automated and super fun.  

Want to play a game of chess with someone who is as passionate? Possible. What if that person is sitting far away? Possible. What if he doesn’t have the same board? Still possible. Now, what’s not possible is to have an excuse for not playing your favourite game.  

So let’s get connected. Let’s Square Off!

Square Off mode: Challenge anybody, from anywhere in the world. You can either play board vs board or board vs app. The chess pieces shall move on their own, reflecting every move of your opponent.  

Training mode: Play against the artificial intelligence of the board that can challenge you with 20 different difficulty levels. 

 Live streaming mode: Tune into any match, worldwide. It also lets you record those matches and replay them, whenever you want.

  

 

 
  • Chess Base Article (Click here) 
  • Arduino Blog Post (Click Here) 
  • Tom's Hardware Post (Click here)

 

 If above link doesn't work,click here for the press kit.

  

             

 

 

 

It uses a compact 2 axis robotic arm with a magnetic head beneath the box to move the magnetic chess pieces. The AtMega 2560 chip with Bluetooth BLE ensures smooth communication with a smartphone, taking care of decrypting and execution. The most important thing is that it is programmed in a way so that the chess pieces don’t collide during automatic movements.

 

 

Compatible with both Android and iOS (currently in beta) operating systems, Square Off is designed as a user-friendly app. It lets you interact with the board effortlessly; it just takes a click to begin the game.  

But why an app? The idea is to keep the board button-free so that the users can enjoy the classic chess board experience. Be it selecting sides (black or white), difficulty levels, opening moves of computer, challenging friends, analyzing games, using the timer or chatting with the opponent (this feature is being worked upon), everything is controlled through the app.  

Phone is connected to the board all the time via Bluetooth, allowing you to save an incomplete game. Also, it uses your phone’s Wi-Fi to connect to the internet and your phone’s processor to process the data and think of the next possible moves.  

Currently, it works on Stockfish 8 which is one of the best open source chess engine. We plan to offer more chess engines in the future.

 

 

 Additional Features:  

  • Play against 20 different difficulty levels
  • Select opening moves with ease 
  • Load and save an incomplete game 
  • Membrane sensing technology to detect the location of pieces 
  • Receive audio feedback during check, promotion, checkmate and for invalid moves (invalid moves, strictly not allowed) 
  • Get all the instructions through the app, on your phone screen

 

 

In the year 2013, the Chairperson of National Association of Blind (NAB) got in touch with us to understand the feasibility of an idea. He wanted us to design a chessboard for the visually impaired. It’s not possible for them to play chess on computers and smartphones. We, being board game lovers ourselves, simply dived in to explore the possibilities. We researched tirelessly to finally arrive at a design. But, we didn’t have any funds to bring it alive. That’s when an idea struck us.

We started participating in various technical paper presentations and national level tech competitions to earn the prize money, just to create the prototype. Gradually we gathered sufficient money to design our first prototype in 2014. And guess what? It worked.  

The Chairman of NAB who was visually impaired himself, tested the prototype and loved playing on it. We showcased this prototype in many national exhibitions and got a great response. But, on 3rd October, 2014, for the first time we got an opportunity to present our prototype in front of an international audience in Maker Faire, Rome. This was the real turning point.

The tremendous response and exhaustive feedback helped us realise that the board has the potential to connect the entire world. So, the moment we returned, we were driven to work harder. We created 4 more prototypes and visited several events to get as much feedback as possible. We are board game lovers, but not exactly pro chess players. That’s why it was necessary to find out about those features that would really excite a chess player? From the very beginning, we were dedicated to bring alive the features requested by the users. 

More opportunities flowed in. We were invited to showcase the prototype at all the IITs in India, then MIT Boston FAB 11, Startup Istanbul and the Sharjah Chess Club. After 3 years of sustained efforts, finally our Beta product was ready in May 2016. To test the product and gauge the response, we produced a small batch of Collector’s Edition Square Off boards and sold 20 specially created, highly premium boards within no time.  

The struggle to create the manufacturing system

Contract Manufacturer

When you manufacture a product, a lot of things have to happen in parallel. While testing our prototypes with new upgrades, we were simultaneously evaluating contract manufacturers so that we can seamlessly transition from development to production. 

 We've tied up with a US based contract manufacturer (CM) with over 25 years of experience in manufacturing. We have been working closely with them since a few months and completed DFM (Design for Manufacturing) according to the machines and tools available with them. DFM took a little longer as it was kind of redesign phase because of lot of upgrades in the product. 

Pre-Production Process

Our team members at the Motherboard Factory

We are making 20 pre-production units with the CM to test the assembly line as well as the performance of the product. It will be the final test before we proceed with the mass production.

To give you an idea, we are dealing with:

- 30+ vendors for the motherboard components

- 35+ vendors for all the other parts of the product. 

Plan ahead is to manufacture 2000 units (minimum order quantity of this manufacturer) together after the pre-production units are approved. Our CM is capable of handling large volumes and quality check would be absolutely smooth. Also, delivering to all the backers together would be fair and no one will have to wait :-)

We have ordered all the components and parts from these vendors which will allow us to immediately start with the production after confirming the pre-production samples, ensuring that there is no unexpected delay due to unavailability of components during assembly.

 Get in touch with us  

If you have questions at any time, during or after the campaign, you can always reach us at contact@infivention.com or leave a comment on this page.  

Our heartfelt gratitude goes out to the following people for helping us throughout our journey

  In the year 2013, the Chairperson of National Association of Blind (NAB) got in touch with us to understand the feasibility of an idea. He wanted us to design a chessboard for the visually impaired. It’s not possible for them to play chess on computers and smartphones. We, being board game lovers ourselves, simply dived in to explore the possibilities. We researched tirelessly to finally arrive at a design. But, we didn’t have any funds to bring it alive. That’s when an idea struck us.We started participating in various technical paper presentations and national level tech competitions to earn the prize money, just to create the prototype. Gradually we gathered sufficient money to design our first prototype in 2014. And guess what? It worked.  The Chairman of NAB who was visually impaired himself, tested the prototype and loved playing on it. We showcased this prototype in many national exhibitions and got a great response. But, on 3rd October, 2014, for the first time we got an opportunity to present our prototype in front of an international audience in Maker Faire, Rome. This was the real turning point.The tremendous response and exhaustive feedback helped us realise that the board has the potential to connect the entire world. So, the moment we returned, we were driven to work harder. We created 4 more prototypes and visited several events to get as much feedback as possible. We are board game lovers, but not exactly pro chess players. That’s why it was necessary to find out about those features that would really excite a chess player? From the very beginning, we were dedicated to bring alive the features requested by the users. Maker Faire - New York and RomeMore opportunities flowed in. We were invited to showcase the prototype at all the IITs in India, then MIT Boston FAB 11, Startup Istanbul and the Sharjah Chess Club. After 3 years of sustained efforts, finally our Beta product was ready in May 2016. To test the product and gauge the response, we produced a small batch of Collector’s Edition Square Off boards and sold 20 specially created, highly premium boards within no time.  The struggle to create the manufacturing system
Contract Manufacturer
When you manufacture a product, a lot of things have to happen in parallel. While testing our prototypes with new upgrades, we were simultaneously evaluating contract manufacturers so that we can seamlessly transition from development to production. 
 We've tied up with a US based contract manufacturer (CM) with over 25 years of experience in manufacturing. We have been working closely with them since a few months and completed DFM (Design for Manufacturing) according to the machines and tools available with them. DFM took a little longer as it was kind of redesign phase because of lot of upgrades in the product. 
Pre-Production Process

Our team members at the Motherboard Factory
We are making 20 pre-production units with the CM to test the assembly line as well as the performance of the product. It will be the final test before we proceed with the mass production.
To give you an idea, we are dealing with:
- 30+ vendors for the motherboard components
- 35+ vendors for all the other parts of the product. 
Plan ahead is to manufacture 2000 units (minimum order quantity of this manufacturer) together after the pre-production units are approved. Our CM is capable of handling large volumes and quality check would be absolutely smooth. Also, delivering to all the backers together would be fair and no one will have to wait :-)
We have ordered all the components and parts from these vendors which will allow us to immediately start with the production after confirming the pre-production samples, ensuring that there is no unexpected delay due to unavailability of components during assembly.
Shipping plan: 

We have tied up with a Silicon Valley based shipping company who has a lot of experience with shipping of Indiegogo products. They have their warehouse in San Francisco, Ireland and Hong Kong. 
Backers from Europe will get their reward from Ireland, backers from North and South America will get their rewards via US and backers from rest of the world will receive their rewards from Hong Kong. 
We'll email you the tracking numbers as soon as we have them! 
*VAT and taxes extra Get in touch with us   If you have questions at any time, during or after the campaign, you can always reach us at contact@infivention.com or leave a comment on this page.  Our heartfelt gratitude goes out to the following people for helping us throughout our journey

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Watch Cassie Elle walk you through how to play Gadgeteers!

If you're still on the fence about Gadgeteers, check out the low ink Print and Play! We believe in this game so much, we are willing to give you everything so you can see all of the components and try it all out yourself! We are confident that once you play it, you will come back to pledge for a full physical copy!

If you need more information, you will also find the rulebook included in the same link as the Print and Play! 

Gadgeteers is on TABLETOP SIMULATOR on Steam! 

If you would like another way to try the game, check out Gadgeteers on Tabletop Simulator!

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=722782698

 

Dirigible Disaster on Board Game Geek!

https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/letimangames/dirigible-disaster-a-frantic-real-time-co-op-for-2

  • Follow Letiman Games on Twitter  
  • Like Letiman Games on Facebook  
  • Follow Letiman Games on Instagram  
  • Check out Gadgeteers on Board Game Geek

Mike Cofer and Dan Letzring have worked together on a number of projects (in a variety of roles), but this is the first game that they have designed together.  They would not let distance get between them as they would find time to play test new ideas with each other over Skype.  It is a surprise they can get anything done with all of the bickering that goes on between them, but they found a way to power through and create a great game.

Jesse Labbe (Cover Art, Characters, Parts Illustrations) - It cannot be said that Jesse is just an illustrator.  He writes, creates stories, designs games, and he also draws!  From creating a world in the Berona's War graphic novel series to the American Stickman Military vs. Monsters book to the Cross Hares board game, Jesse loves creating worlds for people to play in! Jesse has provided artwork for all of Letiman Games titles (Dino Dude Ranch, Dirigible Disaster and Gadgeteers!).

Alisha Volkman (Gadget blueprint art) - Alisha is a night owl of an artist. She loves making art as much as she loves gaming. She gets her artistic inspiration from friends and life.  When Alisha isn't drawing or gaming, she is taking care of her many reptiles and fuzzy animals!

Letiman Games is a small board game publisher in Rochester, NY whose main focus is great gateway games that are fun for groups of just adults but accessible for kids as well. We have run 3 successful Kickstarter campaigns, with 2 of them delivered and the third in the process of delivering!  We strive to deliver fun products that include high quality components and are priced reasonably.  Our goal is to bring family and friends together at the table with games! See you at the table!

OUR SINCEREST APPRECIATION TO THE MANY WHO HAVE HELPED US ALONG THE WAY!

We would like to thank (in no particular order) Jason Gough, Cassie Friedman, and Matt Holden of the IGA, Dustin Schwartz, Danica Enyart, Mike Wokasch (Fairway3 Games), Forrest Bower (Bower's Game Corner), Andrew Fisher (Gameosity), Andy Matthews (Meeple Mountain), Jonathan Liu (GeekDad), Eduardo Baraf (Edo's Reviews), Ryan Sanders (Inquisitive Meeple), Tom Gurganus (Go Forth and Game), James Hudson (Druid City Games), the guys at TGIK games, and Jimmy Carroll (BoardGameLinks). Lastly, we would like to give a shout out to our official playtesters: Steven Aramini, Amy Barnhouse, Frank Barnhouse, Dorothy Bryan, The Conklins, Carly Cook, Danny Devine, Daniel Grek, David Gumbrell, Eleanor Gumbrell, Nicholas Jamail, Eric Jome, Mike Letzring, Stephanie Letzring, Rick LouAllen, Sean & Karla MacDonald, Nate Moore, Nicholas Moore, Dustin Oakley, Ben Pierro, Simon Reid, Andrew J. Smith, Mike Wokasch, Owen Wokasch, Wes Yeager, Roland Yockell, Nicholas Yu

story:
It’s the 1960s and the Cold War rages. Diabolical super-villains implement plans for market, corporate, and global domination. Scientists craft gadgets to help sexy super-spies battle these villains. You are one of these super-villains or super-spies clashing in exciting and exotic locales...and you have super-powers!

 

CAPERS Covert is a supplement for the BAMFsie award-winning CAPERS roleplaying game, which is set in the  1920s Prohibition Era of the United States. 

BUT FEAR NOT! The core game is also available here...CHEAP!

You can get the core book at a lower price than anywhere else as part of this campaign and play either version of the game...or combine them. Much of what's presented in CAPERS Covert is perfectly usable in CAPERS. Plus, it has a whole new 1960s setting and theme you can play in. 

In CAPERS Covert, you portray a character with extraordinary abilities living in the midst of an ongoing cat and mouse game between super-villains and super-spies. You'll employ your super-powers, gadgets, and charm to aid you in achieving your goals. 

CAPERS Covert offers a complete 1960s Las Vegas backdrop that carries the CAPERS timeline forward 40 years. It also includes new content that can be used in the CAPERS game with no modification required: 

  • Expanded character options
  • Expanded rules for vehicle chases, jury-rigging, and more
  • Gadgets
  • New powers
  • Additional GM guidelines and tools
  • Super-spy and super-villain organizations

CAPERS Covert is a game of subterfuge, chases, espionage, and style. Your character will walk the razor's edge as they seek global domination...or a world of peace. 

Learn more about NerdBurger Games and CAPERS products on our website and Discord. 

 

When playing any CAPERS game, each player (and the GM) uses their own deck of standard, poker-style playing cards (52 suit cards plus 2 jokers) to determine if a character succeeds at difficult tasks.

The pip value of the card you flip (2, 3, and so on, up to ace high) determines success versus failure. The card’s suit determines the DEGREE of success or failure, starting at clubs (the worst) and going alphabetically upward to spades (the best). You’ll be able to flip multiple cards based on your character’s capability. You might flip the king of clubs, certainly a success with a king, but just barely a success. Clubs comes with a complication.

Do you settle for barely successful and a complication or flip another card, hoping for a better result? Each flip is a gamble, risking failure.

 

If you back for a level that gets you CAPERS Covert, this is what you get: 

  • A PDF of CAPERS Covert, in full color, including all unlocked stretch goals. 
  • A link to purchase a softcover book at cost from DriveThruRPG.com later. See “Ordering Physical Books” for more information.
  • A thank-you in the book's credits.

 Refer to individual perks for other rewards specific to that level.

 

 

There will be some support material that comes separate from the book. You'll get all of these items as part of your rewards for the campaign. So far, we have:

  • A 2-page, form-fillable PDF character sheet, customized for CAPERS Covert play.
  • "The Crux of the Matter," an adventure PDF.

 

Every backer gets a PDF of the book(s) they back for. But every backer will ALSO receive a link to purchase a physical book at cost from DriveThruRPG's print on demand service. You'll also pay shipping then. 

CAPERS Covert and CAPERS Noir are softcover only. The CAPERS RPG core book is available in both softcover and hardcover. For the CAPERS RPG book, you'll tell us whether you want a discount code for a softcover or hardcover in your backer survey. 

The at-cost prices are just what it takes to print the book, so they're super-cheap! 

Cost will vary based on which book you're getting printed and cover choice. Approximate costs are provided below. These numbers assume printing in the US and shipping to backers in the US. Shipping to other places will vary. Costs are approximate.

The books can also be printed in the UK. DriveThruRPG automatically figures out which printing location is best for you based on your location.

CAPERS Covert and CAPERS Noir

Softcover: $4.50 USD (printing) + $5 USD (shipping) = $9.50 USD

CAPERS RPG Core Book

Softcover: $10 USD (printing) + $5 USD (shipping) = $15 USD

Hardcover: $14 USD (printing) + $6 USD (shipping) = $20 USD

Go HERE to see estimates for shipping to countries outside the U.S.

DriveThruRPG's shipping services don't include VAT or tax for Canada, Australia, or the European Union (though Brexit may change some of this in the future).   

 

If you back at the Every CAPERS Product So Far level, you'll receive links to purchase the following ADDITIONAL items at cost. You'll pay shipping then, too. 

Approximate costs in USD are:

  • CAPERS Themed Playing Cards: $5 USD
  • Moxie Deck: $4.50 USD
  • Paper Minis: $1.25 USD
  • Poster Maps: $4 USD

These items are optional and not required to play the game. But they're a lot of fun. When you purchase the card decks, you can get a clear plastic deckbox for $1 USD extra. Shipping for these items individually doesn't generally rise above $4 USD. Ordering multiple items together may get you a better shipping rate. 

DriveThruCards only prints these items in the United States and international shipping costs can get pricey because VAT is charged. You have been warned. 

 

 Here are the people who made CAPERS Covert. 

  • Craig Campbell - Lead Designer
  • Tim Eagon - Additional Design (backdrop and GM toolbox)
  • Sharene Gilchrist - Additional Design (backdrops) 
  • Hiromi Cota, Amr El-Azizi, James Mendez Hodes, Claudio Pozas, Kienna Shaw - Culture Consulting 
  • Vincent Harper - Editing/Proofreading
  • Beth Varni - Cover and Interior Artwork
  • Michael Brock - Cartography
  • Owen St. Gelais - Graphic Design/Layout

 

BAMF Podcast: Talking CAPERS Covert and other geeky stuff.

Party of One:A short actual play with host Jeff Stormer. 

Passionerdly: Talking CAPERS Covert.

Character Creation Cast: We talk making characters for CAPERS. 

Roll Out! Podcast: Actual Play of CAPERS Covert.

 

CAPERS Covert is fully designed, playtested, and edited. Final production work (including artwork, graphic design, and layout) are underway right now. Your pledge will go toward funding all of the final work needed to make the book.

The final product will be an 8-1/2”x11” game book filled with color artwork that launches you into a world of super-spies and super-villains...with super-powers!

story:
Welcome to the Den!

So, I've always had a weakness for Rakshasas. In part because I like 1.Kittens with funky paws, 2. Siberian tigers (ever since watching Kurusowa's Dersu Uzala), 3. I have West asian heritage, and to us those literal man-eaters are real.

 

The Miniatures

Sculpted by our very own Boris Woloszyn, they're 32mm scale with the Rakshasa being around 40mm.

The Rakshasa King in all his glory. The hands come on a sprue and can be attached thumbs inside or outside, as you like.

 

The Rakshasa King when he takes the form of a beautiful young man.

 

His Nemesis. A most powerful Rakshesha.

 

His Nemesis' personal zombie attendant. 

 

The Pledge Level

There's just one, it comes with the 4 minis. No add-on's, no pledge manager. Like in the olden days! 

The price for the miniatures is 50 USD. Indiegogo will charge 8 USD for postage on top of that.

 

More Pictures

Do that hand thing if you must.

 

The lady has a knife behind her back!

 

Thanks for checking the campaign out

And please use info@westaliaminiatures.com if you have a query.

story:
Bicycle Magic

 

Since the beginning of times, the art of magic has been present in society.


For the past 5000 years, magic has evolved, progressed and captured the attention of millions of people around the world.

All it takes is practice, knowledge and time, but the tools you have at your disposal also play a huge role.

After all, the hand is faster than the eye...

The Bicycle Magic has been manufactured by the legendary United States Playing Card Company, who have been supplying magicians with beautiful playing cards for decades.

The high-quality stock will ensure your shuffling and performance improves, while the robustness will guarantee they'll withstand constant use for a long time.

 

Bicycle Magic Deck Features 

  • 56 custom playing cards
  • Standard tuck box 
  • Includes 2 gaff cards
  • 4000 decks print run
  • Printed in the USA by US Playing Card Company 
  • This Indiegogo project is limited to 400 decks

 

Tuck Box

 

Uncut sheets

 

 

 

    

 

 

 

Risks and challenges:

The decks are currently being printed by the United States Playing Card Company and should be finished within one month. 

For that reason, we don't foresee any issues as the deck is nearly completed and will ship soon. We promise to stay transparent and keep our backers updated along the way.
You can contact us at prestigeplayingcardsco@gmail.com or send us a message here on IndieGoGo.
story_txt:
Bicycle Magic Since the beginning of times, the art of magic has been present in society.For the past 5000 years, magic has evolved, progressed and captured the attention of millions of people around the world.All it takes is practice, knowledge and time, but the tools you have at your disposal also play a huge role.After all, the hand is faster than the eye...The Bicycle Magic has been manufactured by the legendary United States Playing Card Company, who have been supplying magicians with beautiful playing cards for decades.The high-quality stock will ensure your shuffling and performance improves, while the robustness will guarantee they'll withstand constant use for a long time. 
Bicycle Magic Deck Features 
56 custom playing cards
Standard tuck box 
Includes 2 gaff cards
4000 decks print run
Printed in the USA by US Playing Card Company 
This Indiegogo project is limited to 400 decks
 Tuck Box Uncut sheets
 
         Risks and challenges:The decks are currently being printed by the United States Playing Card Company and should be finished within one month. For that reason, we don't foresee any issues as the deck is nearly completed and will ship soon. We promise to stay transparent and keep our backers updated along the way.You can contact us at prestigeplayingcardsco@gmail.com or send us a message here on IndieGoGo.

story:
What's going on here then?

ORE-SOME is a board game that successfully funded on Kickstarter early in 2017.

Production has now complete, our kickstarter backers and indiegogo pre-orderers have their copies and the game is now effectively a retail product!

You can now buy copies of ORE-SOME directly here from indiegogo, knowing exactly what you're getting - no funding goals, no stretch goals, none of the uncertainty that accompanies a crowdfunding campaign!

Have a look below - we hope you like what you see!

-- One Free Elephant

ORE-SOME's kickstarter and production is complete. The "basic" set of the game includes everything listed below plus a set of extras from the stretch goals listed at the bottom!

Extras included as standard

One Free Elephant believe that there should be no differences between the retail and kickstarter versions of our games, so everyone will benefit from the support of our awesome backers!

Here's the extra bits you're getting:

  • Two extra character cards - James and Silas
  • Upgraded quality - black core, linen finish, 310gsm cardstock on all the cards
  • Branded bag - ORE-SOME logo printed on the ore bag
  • Player 5 - One extra card, one extra dice and two track tiles to take the game to 2 - 5 players

How to win!

In ORE-SOME you'll be playing Jessie, James, Doc Francis, Lewis, Silas or Zoe - miners pushing and pulling unreliable mine carts around a maze-like mine.

They're all competing to gather the most ore, fill the most contracts and ultimately earn the most gold in a single day!

Setting Up

First you'll build the mine.

Players will take turns placing mine tiles. There's normal tiles and a special tile for each player where you'll earn double if you dig there but no-one gets to place their own special tiles!

Everybody Move!

Everybody rolls a dice. Then you take turns moving your cart 1 to 3 tracks depending on the roll. 

Don't like what you rolled? Whack the Lever, Uphill, Oil Slick or Hidden Springs can help you get where you want to be. So can slamming into walls or, even better, other players!

Be careful! Any time ore drops from your cart it stays where it is and someone might swipe it before you can get back to it! 

Watch your back! If other players hit you - you're shunted! You'll end up where you didn't want to be and if your cart's really full you'll drop a piece of ore too!

Dig!

After moving, everyone takes turns working the tile they've ended up on.

On your turn you dig for ore: two on a normal tile, four on your special tiles! Keep your hands steady if your cart is bursting, the dropped ore rule still counts!

You can also (once!) pick up any ore on your tile - whether you dropped it or not!

You can also hand in contracts or sell to the Bank. 

If you want to hand in contracts - you better have the right ore and be in range of the contract agents! They roam the mine looking for the player with the most ore, the least ore, the closest cart or the youngest player so you might need to hold on to that ore an extra turn or two. Or play it safe and sell to the bank for less cash...

Draw!

At the end of your turn you can discard any cards you don't want and then fill your hand back up to five.

And More!

We've not even talked about Dynamite, Cave-ins, Jackpots, Pickaxes or Scraps, our adorable pup who'll ride around in your cart - protecting you from thieves and sabotage!

Y'all might want to have a read of our beautiful rule-book:

or watch the guys from Man vs Meeple talk you through it:

You don't have to just take our word for it, look at all the lovely things people have said about ORE-SOME! 

(Click on them to read, watch or listen to their full thoughts.) 

Video

Text

 

Select Perk for shipping details

story:
Hey there dice rollers !

URBANMATZ team have created special division for 3D printable terrain for tabletop games of all scales. We have created 100 digital STL files (100 pcs of wargaming terrain) to print on any 3D printer that cover all types of wargaming needs. 

What You Get - PERKS

ALL-IN PERK

You will receive ALL available PERKS (100 STL files of 3D printable terrain = 100 pcs of wargaming terrain) and ALL Unlocked Stretch Goals. You can get to more than 200 free additional STL files in possible Stretch Goals. Share it with your friends and benefit from unlocked Stretch Goals. Lifetime Commercial Licence not included.

LIFETIME COMMERCIAL LICENCE

ALL available PERKS (100 STL files) and ALL Unlocked Stretch Goals. You will also get an UNLIMITED licence certificate authorising you to sell PRINTED products from the STL files provided with no time limit (lifetime licence). The licence does not allow you to sell the STL files or sell licences on the STL files. 

CHURCHES AND CHAPELS

You will receive 5 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (5 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

MEDIEVAL FANTASY HOUSES

You will receive 5 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (5 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

GOTHIC RUINS AND GATES (OF ANOTHER REALMS)

You will receive 7 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (7 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

INDUSTRIAL PIPES AND TANKS

You will receive 14 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (14 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

INDUSTRIAL WALLS

You will receive 7 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (7 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

SCIFI

You will receive 10 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (10 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

DESERT SCIFI 1

You will receive 11 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (11 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

DESERT SCIFI 2

You will receive 6 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (6 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

CASTLE AND WALLS

You will receive 6 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (6 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

CEMETERY

You will receive 24 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (24 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

RUINED WALLS

You will receive 5 STL files of highly detailed 3D printable terrain for tabletop games (5 pcs of wargaming terrain). It does not include any Unlocked Stretch Goals.

----------------------------

Each PERK is delivered as an STL file pack ready to be printed on any home 3D Printer. STL files and items printed from STL files may not be sold or used for commercial purposes without Commercial Licence. 

Free Stretch Goals

The more Stretch Goals we hit, the more free models you will get. You can get to more than 200 free additional STL files in possible Stretch Goals. Share it with your friends and benefit from unlocked Stretch Goals.

As we progress we will keep adding Stretch goals.

GOTHIC RUINED ALTAR $5000 - U N L O C K E D !

SCATTER TERRAIN $6000 - U N L O C K E D !

SCIFI BUNKER 1 $6250 - U N L O C K E D !

​SCIFI BUNKER 2 $6500 - U N L O C K E D !

CRATERS  $7000 - U N L O C K E D !

HELIPORT  $8000 - U N L O C K E D !

GOTHIC RUIN $9000 - U N L O C K E D !

FUEL SILO $10000

DEFENSE WALL $10500

GOTHIC RUIN $11000

GOTHIC RUIN $12000

GOTHIC RUIN $13000

GOTHIC RUIN $14000

DICE TOWER $15000

As we progress we will keep adding Stretch goals.

Post-Sales Service

We are here for you and your questions anytime you need anything after the campaign is over. Contact: urbanmatz3d@gmail.com

Risks & Challenges

Please join in and support our campaign to help us develop 3D printable wargaming terrain.

story:
The Cosmos...vast, beautiful, and mysterious. From when humanity first looked up to the stars, we have always wondered...what secrets do they hold? It is time we embark on a voyage like nothing before. 

In the Pieces of the Galaxy collection by HelloFish, you’ll discover hidden surprises as you rebuild a solar system filled unique pieces inspired by history, mythology and astronomy. 

In each of these beautiful, unique planets, no two pieces are alike.  

Pieces of the Galaxy will take you on a journey of discovery. Similar to adult coloring books, Pieces of the Galaxy is a peaceful, soothing challenge designed to de-stress and delight. 

Uniquely shaped pieces. Secrets to discover. High quality craftsmanship. Let Pieces of the Galaxy capture your imagination. 

Our solar system is rich with tales of ancient history, whimsical mythology, and incredible science. Each planet in the Pieces of the Galaxy collection contains pieces shaped after historical, mythological, or astronomy-themed references.  

Each planet puzzle includes pieces shaped after historical, mythological, or astronomy-related references related to that particular planet. For example, you may find mammals on Earth, but symbols of masculinity on Mars, and water-themed icons on Neptune.  

Experience the joy of discovery as you uncover the tales within each planet one by one.  

On this journey, you'll come across unbelievable sights. From important moments in history, such as the discovery of Uranus... 

To the symbols used in astronomy, astrology, and even medieval alchemy to denote the planets of our solar system... 

To myths and legends, such as Apollo, Greek god of the Sun, and his famed lyre... 

To maps of the stars - the constellations that each planet belongs to... 

To strange visitors living humbly on their home planets... 

And many more as you set out to explore the 10 different planets of the Pieces of the Galaxy collection. 

Your Guide to the Universe

The Pieces of the Galaxy puzzle collection is packed with references to astronomy, legends, science fiction and more. In each box, you’ll get a booklet detailing the story and significance of each themed piece in the set.   

This "discovery booklet" will be your guide as you wander through the tales of the galaxy. Take your time and enjoy the experience. 

In the Pieces of the Galaxy collection, each planet contains a hidden secret. Will you find it?  

Mythos-inspired mini-puzzles await inside every box, themed after its featured planet.  

The Moon's hidden puzzle reveals the East Asian myth of the "moon rabbit", while Neptune's hidden puzzle is emblazoned with the Greek god of the sea, Poseidon. 

When building the hidden puzzles, some wood and acrylic pieces are flipped to reveal brown or silvery undersides - opening up a new world of design possibilities. 

Pieces of the Galaxy contains some of the highest quality wood puzzles in world. 

Our secret manufacturing technique gives these puzzles the highest resolution and cleanest finish of any other puzzle on the market.

A special, proprietary blend of wood makes pieces feel solid and hefty in the hand. Pieces are precision-cut to perfection.

Transparent acrylic pieces allow light to pour though some planets, giving life to coursing rivers or streams of gas. 

Acrylic pieces were painstakingly designed to give realism to the Pieces of the Galaxy planets. Polar caps on Mars, gas clouds on Uranus, and Saturn's rings glisten when held up to the light. 

The Pieces of the Galaxy collection looks stunning as a centerpiece in any room. Delight and amaze your family and friends as they gather round these incredible puzzles that emulate real artwork. 

By gluing the puzzles together with any light glue, you can seal your creation together and hang it from the wall with ease. 

We can confidently say that Pieces of the Galaxy is one of the finest wooden/acrylic puzzle sets ever created. It's a bold claim, for sure, but there are 4 elements that make Pieces of the Galaxy truly innovative:

1. We print directly onto the wood and acrylic itself. Other puzzle makers print onto photo paper then apply it to the wood, then cut the wood. This can lead to frayed edges from the cutting process and distorted images from shrinkage from the heat transfer. We cut the pieces, then print directly on the wood. This also means our pieces are waterproof and resistant to humidity. 

2. Our imaging is 1200 DPI (dots per inch), which is an incredible level of resolution. The human eye can only differentiate up to 400 DPI. This means we can create, gorgeous, striking puzzles - perfect for display purposes and more faithful to the original vision of the artist. Most other puzzle manufacturers, including many of the leading puzzle brands, are only 100-150 DPI.

3. Our edge cutting method uses a special carbon dioxide laser. This means no chipped or scruffy edges, unlike puzzles made by traditional laser cutting methods. Our machine also uses a high-powered microscope to ensure maximum precision. It actually takes us 900 times LONGER to make our puzzles than mainstream manufacturers because we are so careful and precise about the quality.

Display Your Collection with Style

The Pieces of the Galaxy collection looks fantastic on any wall. But, sometimes our coffee tables need love too. So we've created a set of add-ons for this campaign to help you display your collection anytime, anywhere: display stands! 

Each planet features 3D elements - like the mountain ranges of Mars, or the eye of Jupiter. Our crystal clear plastic cases are moulded specifically for each planet, wrapping around these 3D elements for a snug fit that makes your planets shine. 

To add display stands to your pledge, simply add the price of the display stands you would like to your pledge. See the Pledge Levels section below for details.

Build with Ease

Picking out tightly slotted pieces can be tricky, but we have just the thing! In every puzzle box, a free "picker pen" is included! This handy tool lets you pull out any piece in a snap. 

In addition, every box contains a "building board" that will guide your construction, as well as let you easily move your work-in-progress puzzles on and off the tabletop. 

Pledge for the full collection of all 10 planets, and you'll be able to construct a micro-model of our solar system. Each planet contains a special gear piece, that when assembled together, create a beautiful, mechanical interpretation of our galactic neighborhood. 

This mesmerizing motion machine can only be built by pledging for the Discover the Galaxy pledge or above. 

Not only this, but if you pledge for the full collection, you'll also receive a BONUS MYSTERY PLANET as a special gift. 

This mysterious bonus puzzle is a free gift to anyone who pledges for the Discover the Galaxy (Full Galaxy Collection) or ALL-IN: Discover the Galaxy + Display Stands pledge levels. 

In addition to these perks, we also have a special announcement...

Not only will pledging for the Discover the Galaxy reward get you a free mystery bonus planet and the ability to construct a micro-solar system, but every Discover the Galaxy (Full Galaxy Collection) and ALL-IN: Discover the Galaxy + Display Stands backer will receive a set of mini-keychain versions of all 11 planet puzzles (including the mystery planet) FOR FREE! 

These keychains are made from shimmering acrylic and have transparent light leak patterns based on the full-sized planet puzzles! Hold them up to the light and watch them come alive!

 

 

Shipping

All IndieGogo pledges will ship before January 2020!

Some important notes:

  • The shipping prices above are estimates, final charges may differ slightly
  • VAT, sales tax, and GST are INCLUDED for US, Canadian, EU, UK and Australian backers
  • Backers from other regions will be responsible to pay their own import duties or taxes (if any) upon receipt of their rewards
  • We cannot ship to PO Boxes
  • We cannot ship to South America for this project
