Each planet contains a special gear piece, that when assembled together, create a beautiful, mechanical interpretation of our galactic neighborhood. This mesmerizing motion machine can only be built by pledging for the Discover the Galaxy pledge or above. Not only this, but if you pledge for the full collection, you'll also receive a BONUS MYSTERY PLANET as a special gift. This mysterious bonus puzzle is a free gift to anyone who pledges for the Discover the Galaxy (Full Galaxy Collection) or ALL-IN: Discover the Galaxy + Display Stands pledge levels. In addition to these perks, we also have a special announcement...Not only will pledging for the Discover the Galaxy reward get you a free mystery bonus planet and the ability to construct a micro-solar system, but every Discover the Galaxy (Full Galaxy Collection) and ALL-IN: Discover the Galaxy + Display Stands backer will receive a set of mini-keychain versions of all 11 planet puzzles (including the mystery planet) FOR FREE! These keychains are made from shimmering acrylic and have transparent light leak patterns based on the full-sized planet puzzles! Hold them up to the light and watch them come alive!  ShippingAll IndieGogo pledges will ship before January 2020!Some important notes:
The shipping prices above are estimates, final charges may differ slightly
VAT, sales tax, and GST are INCLUDED for US, Canadian, EU, UK and Australian backers
Backers from other regions will be responsible to pay their own import duties or taxes (if any) upon receipt of their rewards
We cannot ship to PO Boxes
We cannot ship to South America for this project
 Crowd Pop Marketing is a global crowdfunding agency, partnering with the world's brightest projects.

story:
What is Butchery?

Butchery is a social deception card game based on an informed minority, an uninformed majority, and cannibalism. The game is a major project for our final year at SAE Institute, Sydney.

At the beginning of the game, each player is assigned one of three roles: Inspector (the game's moderator), Livestock (the uninformed majority), and the Butcher (the villain of the game).

The livestock are in the majority, but they don’t know who is who - a fellow innocent could easily turn out to be the villain of the game and send you to the slaughterhouse!

Through card swapping, players must obtain certain combinations to "protect” themselves from being eliminated from each round. The Butcher also has their own special combination of cards to collect in order to win the game, making it a race against time to discover their true identity!

Lying, secrecy, and selfishness are all fundamental parts of this game - a perfect addition to any friendly gathering!

Butchery also comes with a tag-along mobile app (Android only) which acts as a random event generator.

Who are we?

We are final year Graphic Design students from SAE Institute, Sydney (Hunter Lynch and Jonathan Lowe). Both of us are previous graduates of Game Design and Film Production and have worked on various game projects in the past (including Konquest and Superposition).      

    Where's your money going?

    So, why are we asking for your money? Simply put, we're lowly college students, and can't afford to produce the game to the standard we'd like to without a bit of help! Your money will be put towards one thing and one thing only:

     

    Printing and manufacturing costs

    This is the big one! Australia is a pretty bad place to get cards printed, so we have to get our cards printed in America and shipped over here. We also need to print packaging, manuals, and stickers. Printing at a good quality is an expensive process, so we need all the help we can get!

     

     

    Risks & Challenges

    As this is a student major project, there's obviously going to be some hurdles here and there. Both of us have worked on game projects in the past, however, so we're confident in not only our abilities to deliver, but also in Butchery's standing as a great contribution to the social deduction card game genre.

    Not to be cocky or anything, but the biggest risk for us is if our campaign receives more backers than expected, it may cause a delay in distribution (especially for rewards requiring customised cards).

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're not in the financial position to donate, that's okay! Any help is appreciated. The best way to help us out without doling out your cash is to like us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter. Spread the word!

story:
We are a group of students, studying Multimedia and Graphic Design at Cyprus University of Technology.

Homophobia is a serious social issue and it is evident in university environments among students. It is important for university students to get informed and develop awareness in related issues concerning the LGBTQI+ Community.

The aim of this project is to do exactly that.

Get up to date about our process by visiting our Spark page and our Facebook page.

Often, our fellow university students enjoy playing cards while drinking their coffee at the university student coffee shop.

Therefore, we came up with the idea of creating special playing cards, designed to inform young people about LGBTQI+.

To bring our idea to life, your support and contribution are needed. To create our product, we have certain expenses.

We need to collect about $500, which will be used to print the decks of cards.

The decks will be given to the university student coffee shop, where students will be able to borrow them and use them.

If we don’t reach our entire funding goal, the collected funds will be used to print a smaller number of decks.

Please donate and support this effort to address homophobia among university students.

You can also support us by spreading the word about our effort, by sharing our campaign with your friends. 

We are grateful to all who support this effort.

story:
Short Summary

  • I was born and raised in Hamilton Ontario and I have been active in the arts and culture scene here for a few years now. I've made my own comic book and now I am on to making my board game!
  • How the game works: there are Act/Draw cards that you get to choose whether you act them out or draw them out based on your own personal preference every player guesses what is on your card and the person who guesses correctly moved ahead, as does the person who drew the card. They both get to nominate someone to draw from either the Drink or Strip card piles(Nominee's choice) which give you a daring action to perform for the viewing pleasure of the other players. Everyone has "Bitch Out" cards which can be used whenever you don't want to do anything, they can be picked up by another daring player. The Board itself is designed after the human reproductive system, and the pieces are little rainbow sperms. First sperm to reach the egg wins the game!
  • I came up with this idea while playing another game and decided to use the cards differently than they usually were used. This evolved to me writing my own cards, adding more rules and more cards for a more fun experience and then finally I added the board. I have broken out the prototype of this game at many parties and my friends are dying to buy a copy after playing it. 
  • As an artist I can barely afford my own bills, but I want to make as many copies as I can to get this game out there in the world. Your contributions will help me make these affordable and well made without me having to eat plain rice for a month. Also, I will use a small local business to make everything and help boost the local economy instead of using made-in-china-slave-labour products. THINK OF THE CHILDREN.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Look, the more money I get the more games I will make. plain and simple. I get $200, ill make 10 copies and people will be sad cause they didn't get one in time. I get $1000 I'll make 50 copies and everyone will be happy, I'll have enough to give free samples to the board game cafes around town, and even sell them online. plus they will be much cheaper to make in bulk so I'll charge less the more I make. 
  • I will send you a copy of my board game as a perk. donate more and I'll send you an expansion pack with more sperm and more dirty cards!
  • Remember, If I don't reach my goal I'll still make them, I'll just make less and they will be more expensive. So help keep things cheap by giving me more money... as ironic as that sounds...
  • I will be having a launch party when I finally have the games made,  all contributors will be invited no matter how small the donation!

The Impact

  • My game makes parties more fun and dates less awkward. Ever been to a lame party where everyone was on their phone? bleck! Damn millenials... wait I'm a millenial... Or a date where you run out of shit to talk about but you still both want to get naked later? This game helps bridge that gap. (but always ask for consent before doing anything sexual, that's right I mean you. A lack of dress is not a yes!)
  • Everyone already loves the game. Ask anyone who has played it.
  • Trust me, it's good, playing is believing.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Broke? Share my campaign on the Facebooks! If you've played the game write a sweet testimonial!
  • I am supposed to remind you to to use the Indiegogo share tools, consider yourself reminded. 
  •

story:
Thank you for making this campaign a success! To order decks from now on, you can do so at: YPISATHOME.COM

 

Story

My name is Lillian Medville. I created a card game called Your Privilege is Showing that helps players process their privilege. I did this, not because I had any experience in game design - I didn’t. Not because I’m an activist - I’m not. And not because I had a degree or expertise in social justice - I still don’t (but I'm learning everyday).

I created the first version of the game, Your Privilege Is Showing LIVE!, because I realized that I didn’t know how to talk about racism or sexism or privilege in ways that were both direct and personal, and when I looked around my community I saw that, for the most part, neither did anyone else.

I gave a TED talk all about the whole journey. You can check that out here.

I have been running Your Privilege Is Showing LIVE! games for a few years and it's been very impactful, joyful, and educational, but that version is designed for organizations as a professional development experience, and I wanted everyone to have access to at least some version of this valuable tool. It's a valuable tool because it’s effective: it asks us to answer for ourselves in ways that are challenging, while also being fun. Getting this game into more people’s hands is why I created Y.P.I.S. AT HOME!

Y.P.I.S. AT HOME! is a simplified self-guided version of our facilitated LIVE! experience designed for personal social groups to play privately. It is a game for up to 6 players, is appropriate for ages 16+, takes about 90 minutes to play, and is never the same game twice.

Real-life scenarios are used to prompt challenging discussions related to social equity, oppression, marginalization, and the various types of privilege. Players engage each other's perspectives, delve into their own, and utilize personal knowledge and experience to practice how to have these conversations in progressive and productive ways.

It’s not about saying the “right thing”. It’s about saying your true thing and working to get more specific and accurate. The person with the most points at the end of the game is the Perfectly Adequate Human.

What We Need & What You Get

I’ve already play tested this game so I know it works. The entire game and packaging has been designed, prototypes made, suppliers chosen, and I've got the first run of boxed games ready to go! It's all been self-funded so far.

This campaign is for us to get pre-order capital to place the most cost effective inventory order and do all of the additional stuff  that comes with adding a new product line.  The goal will be split 70/30 between the inventory and administrative costs.

If you all help me exceed my goal of $8,000, all of the extra funds will be used as follows:

$8,000+ upgrades the YPIS AT HOME! web presence then website and marketing materials

$15,000+ allows the deployment of targeted brand building and marketing plans

$25,000+ I get to finally start hiring some help!!!

$50,000+  guarantees development of at least 2 expansion packs and one new version of Y.P.I.S. the game with a targeted focus.

The Impact

I hope you, like me, give a shit about the world and want it to be better. This game won’t solve all our problems but it will help us develop the skills to do the work - on ourselves and the world - that we so desperately need to do.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support us financially, sharing this campaign will help us enormously. So please spread the word in all the ways you know how!

story:
"The war between the forces of Light and Darkness just intensified! In a last, desperate attempt to turn the tide, the forces of Darkness managed to open a rift to a dimension where the same war rages, only the forces of Darkness have the advantage. All manner of foul creatures and unspeakable horrors poured from the rift, as well as warriors, archers and spellcasters."

Thus began The Rift War...

From the chronicles of Arack, vol.1

The pledges, visualized! The 50 first backers of the TRW image EXCLUSIVE BUNDLE will get their image (drawn by our artist) on a card in the "Heroes of Legend" expansion coming in 2021 (if you want to of course. You will need to supply us with an image of your face)! This pledge is IDENTICAL to The Rift War Exclusive Bundle in every other way.

(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends as we are negotiating prices. Update: As of October 31st we have reduced shipping cost from around 20 Euro to about 10 Euro, worldwide. Yes, that is right, we will not profit on shipping!) 

Norwegian backers will have 25% MVA added to their pledge/shipping cost after the campaign is successfully funded. 

A complete fantasy deckbuilding game with solo, coop and versus modes. Play 15 minutes skirmishes or week long campaigns, fighting over the nation of Garrandur!

 

The contents of the Exclusive Bundle! Including 5 characters never to be released again, and the first look of the upcoming factions - DO NOT MISS IT!

 

Watch our short introduction describing what we need funding for:

 

Get ready for the exciting new 1-4* player adventure card and dice deckbuilding game from S&M Games, 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War - ALSO featuring skirmish rules for miniatures, allowing you to use the characters from the card game in combination with any suitable minis you own. Please note: We do not produce or supply any miniatures but we are SURE you have plenty that will find a new use now :)

More information about the miniatures game is listed after the card game information.

This is the first release in a series of expansions and compatible games set in the same universe.

*3-4 player games requires an additional copy of the core game.

PLEASE NOTE: This game has no connections to the book series «The Riftwar» by Raymond E. Feist. We just wanted to make that 100% clear since there is a similarity in the title.

Image from the "Cursed Bones" mission. Artwork by EquiN0

 

Welcome to S&M Games AS (Ltd.), a Norway based company that creates card and miniatures games. Our first release will be 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War, an awesome card&dice game!

We are proud to say that it will be MADE IN NORWAY.

(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends)

We have decided to make this campaign as simple as possible, without stretch goals other than making the miniatures game rulebook and tokens available as physical products:

The rules and tokens for the miniatures game will be available as a PDF to all backers of the The Rift War - 2 player core set, and up (Please note: The card game is all physical products).

If we reach 12.500 Euro we will print the miniatures game rulebook and include it in the 2 player core starter set as a physical product.

If we reach 20.000 Euro we will print the miniatures game tokens and include them in the 2 player core starter set as a physical product.

As we have a running dialogue with our printer, and they are only a 40 minute drive away, this will not increase production or delivery time.

Instead we want to deliver an awesome game (two in fact) in the shortest time possible.

Our aim is to start shipping the game 1-2 weeks after the campaign is successfully funded. As we are using a local printing service, Rolf Ottesen AS, with which we have a great cooperation, we can hit that "print" button as soon as we break even. The number of copies of the game is easily adjusted as the campaign progresses, to ensure that every backer gets their copy, as well as not printing more than we need which is good for the environment.

(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends)

Please note: If the campaign is successfully funded, backers from Norway will have 25% VAT (MVA) added with the shipping cost.

Watch us unbox the very first demo set of 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War.

THE CARD&DICE GAME:

The Rift War card game will be a soft introduction to the lore, the world and many of the characters that reside there, while at the same time being a unique card and dice deck builder game combining elements of traditional RPGs with tactical deck building and miniatures games. If this sounds complicated, do not worry. The game has an incredible intuitive mechanism and EVERY playtester has loved it (even without forcing their arms)!

The games are suitable for ages 13+

Zombified warrior - one of the many playable characters in both the card and miniatures game. Artwork by George Seryapov

1-48Fantasy: The Rift War lets you lead a party of adventurers on dangerous quests, expeditions and adventures to become more powerful, and recruit new party members. Eventually you'll have to fight the Final Encounter, but can you complete the mission without the help of your opponent? Which side will you take in the ongoing war?

Every card in the game has beautiful, original art, made by our international artists

The "Mysteries in the Mist" mission. Artwork by EquiN0

 

This deckbuilder card and dice game is a new twist to the genre! Not only does it play very fast (an experienced player can win a game in 15 minutes) but you can play it solo, coop, versus and multiplayer coop or versus (multiplayer requires an additional copy of the 2 player starter set, for every 2 players).

Actual cards from the game. Morgoth the Mortician has a very useful ability, letting you bring back your best characters. A ghoul is powerful, especially in the miniatures game, but is limited by which characters he may join in the card game. Birk's ability allows you to plan those "challenges"!

 

Coins allow you to purchase upgrades for your party at the marketplace. Counties you aquire while playing gives you permanent bonuses to your party, giving you the upper hand in those thrilling Player vs Players combats (requires the Exclusive bundle), and makes the missions easier to succeed! 

Actual cards from the game (but still subject to slight alterations). Counties and Marketplace cards requires the Exclusive bundle

 

It combines strategy, luck and immerses the player into that RPG-feeling through stunning art and captivating lore! The way you play is easy and intuitive so make sure to check out our "How to play 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War" videos:

PART 1/5

PART 2/5

PART 3/5
 
PART 4/5
 
PART 5/5

 

The name of the game lends itself from Baueda Wargames' 1-48Tactic miniatures ruleset which we have a license to use. You will also see images and models from Mantic Games in the rules and how to play videos as we have permission to use those as well.

                        www.1-48tactic.com                                                    www.manticgames.com

The music you hear in our videos is made by Christer Price from Norway.

 

One of the important aspects of the game is that even if you end up being the underdog, seeing your opponent run away with all the victory points, you can still come out on top, claiming the victory. This is possible with our unique Player vs Player combat mechanism where, with a little luck, you can claim victory from almost certain defeat. This is made possible with the added randomness of the dice element.

Two EXCLUSIVE six sided dice are included in the 2 player core starter set. The "Translucent Smoke" design matches the grey of the unaligned faction you will be playing as.

Further expansions will introduce colored dice for all the different factions - truly EPIC!

 

The different mission decks let you play against both "the game" and versus your opponent. You do not have to confront your opponent until you feel it is the right time to do so, and in this respect both players have total control over how the game plays.

You can of course also embark on a SOLO quest to gain RENOWN and counties in Garrandur! Three levels of difficulty is provided for beginner, experienced and advanced players. 

Image from "The Rift Cult" mission. Artwork by EquiN0

 

If you pledge for the Exclusive bundle you will get access to some cool extra features where you will actually be rewarded with a county in the nation of Garrandur (where the game takes place) when you win a Final Encounter, and access to the marketplace. There is also added features to the miniatures game.

(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends)

Image from "The Artifact" Final Encounter mission. Artwork by Evelinn Enoksen

 

At the marketplace you can spend those hard-earned coins gained by risking your (party's) life, purchasing weapons and spells to further aid your party in the coming struggle. The "save sheet" included in the A5 full colour rulebook lets you record your progress if you decide to play a campaign that can stretch over many games, depending on what you agree with your opponent.

The nation of Garrandur with its 15 counties. This nation has been ravaged by war for hundreds of years, and the appearance of The Rift did NOT improve matters. Artwork by Evelinn Enoksen.

 

Garrandur is one of nine nations on the continent of Kyro (shown on the opposite side of the full colour A5 map), and where this game takes place. Throughout the game you will go on missions across Garrandur, learning more about the counties and history as you explore and rise in power.

Image from the "Rescue the mayor's daughter" mission. This mission takes place in the county of Barak'Thar, once an Orc stronghold and home to one of the most ferocious Fighting Pits in Garrandur. Artwork by George Seryapov

 

THE MINIATURES GAME:

 We had originally been working on a massive Fantasy miniatures skirmish game for about 1 year when we decided to create The Rift War card&dice deckbuilding game. 

As we had a working ruleset for miniatures (use whatever suitable minis you have, we do not produce miniatures and no miniatures are supplied with either games) we decided to adapt these for use with the characters in the card game, essentially giving you TWO games in ONE package! There is even SOLO play!

Artwork by Evelinn Enoksen

 

We sent an early copy of the PDF rules to northern norwegian Youtuber, DiceyGuy as we know he makes honest and REAL reviews (i think you can tell he loved the game, and playing with his kids):

 

Not only do you get an awesome STAND ALONE miniatures game, you can even play the miniatures game as part of the card game's Final Encounter, to decide who is the ultimate victor. If you prefer Solo play there are rules for that as well, with 3 increasingly difficult scenarios. The 3rd one, "Army of Darkness" even lets you post your high score (and the party you used) in our Facebook group: S&M games AS (Ltd.):

https://www.facebook.com/groups/211437163405634

Who knows, maybe you'll earn yourself your very own character in an upcoming expansion!

In the PDF rulebook you will also find scenarios taken directly from the card game so that you may play those missions as stand-alone skirmishes.

The miniatures game supports upgrading your characters with items from the marketplace, loot from treasure chests and even picking up the weapons of fallen enemies or party members (requires the Exclusive bundle) in addition to having (for us) essential actions your characters may perform!

- Melee 

- Charge

- Ready (lets you prepare for a melee attack against you)

- Ranged combat

- Move&Shoot (you may shoot first, then move, or move and then shoot, as part of the same action)

- Spellcraft attacks (ignores both cover and armor but are harder to succeed with because of the delicate nature of casting a spell in the midst of a raging battle).

- Take cover (a reaction you can take to make it harder to be hit by ranged attacks)

- Search (search a chest, a fallen character, an area etc. If you find an item you may equip it as part of the search action)

- Open/Close (open or close a door, portcullis, trapdoor or similar)

- Jump/fall (yes, it will wound you, or even kill you, but might save you from that Darkbeast, but remember that the further you try to jump the harder it is!).

- Climb (The reward is great if you get your marksman on a higher level than the target. In THIS game, cover rules are actually EASY to understand).

- Push (off a cliff, or just to get out of that deadly melee, the choice is yours, let us just hope you succeed).

 

As the rules are based on the mechanics of baueda Wargames` 1-48Tactic ruleset, the game plays extremely fast and the rules are very straightforward, leaving little room for misinterpretation, and more importantly, discussion. 

It lets you build a party of adventurers from the cards supplied in 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War       2-player core starter set, balanced with a cost for each character. Add one miniature for each card and you are ready to do battle in a rich fantasy world (well, on a 3x3 table populated by your selection of terrain), fighting your opponent for loot, treasure and victory! (PDF token sheet is also supplied).

 

You can even begin a campaign, stretching over several games, where you fight for ownership of the counties of Garrandur, gaining their bonuses as you emerge victorious (this mode requires the county cards found in the Exclusive bundle)! You can even fire and hire party members between games!

 

We hope you are as excited about these games as we are and we cannot wait to start shipping the rewards, as soon as the campaign is successfully funded.

We will deliver!

Svein and Martin

Please note that shipping fees will be collected after the campaign is successfully funded as we will negotiate with several shippers during the campaign in an effort to reduce the cost as much as possible. The more backers, the lower the shipping cost!

UPDATE: October 31st 2020: We have successfully reduced shipping cost from about 20 Euros to around 10 Euros, worldwide. This even takes into account the added miniatures rulebook and tokens if we reach 20.000 Euros!

(in other words - we will not profit on shipping)

 

We are unfortunately only able to ship to the following countries, determined by Posten Bring Norge (our shipping provider). If you pledge from another country than this we will contact you and arrange shipping, although the cost might be a bit higher.

Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends and backers from NORWAY will have 25% MVA added to the pledge/shipping cost.

story_txt:
"The war between the forces of Light and Darkness just intensified! In a last, desperate attempt to turn the tide, the forces of Darkness managed to open a rift to a dimension where the same war rages, only the forces of Darkness have the advantage. All manner of foul creatures and unspeakable horrors poured from the rift, as well as warriors, archers and spellcasters."
Thus began The Rift War...
From the chronicles of Arack, vol.1
The pledges, visualized! The 50 first backers of the TRW image EXCLUSIVE BUNDLE will get their image (drawn by our artist) on a card in the "Heroes of Legend" expansion coming in 2021 (if you want to of course. You will need to supply us with an image of your face)! This pledge is IDENTICAL to The Rift War Exclusive Bundle in every other way.
(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends as we are negotiating prices. Update: As of October 31st we have reduced shipping cost from around 20 Euro to about 10 Euro, worldwide. Yes, that is right, we will not profit on shipping!) 
Norwegian backers will have 25% MVA added to their pledge/shipping cost after the campaign is successfully funded. 

A complete fantasy deckbuilding game with solo, coop and versus modes. Play 15 minutes skirmishes or week long campaigns, fighting over the nation of Garrandur!
 

The contents of the Exclusive Bundle! Including 5 characters never to be released again, and the first look of the upcoming factions - DO NOT MISS IT!
 
Watch our short introduction describing what we need funding for:


 

Get ready for the exciting new 1-4* player adventure card and dice deckbuilding game from S&M Games, 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War - ALSO featuring skirmish rules for miniatures, allowing you to use the characters from the card game in combination with any suitable minis you own. Please note: We do not produce or supply any miniatures but we are SURE you have plenty that will find a new use now :)
More information about the miniatures game is listed after the card game information.
This is the first release in a series of expansions and compatible games set in the same universe.
*3-4 player games requires an additional copy of the core game.
PLEASE NOTE: This game has no connections to the book series «The Riftwar» by Raymond E. Feist. We just wanted to make that 100% clear since there is a similarity in the title.

Image from the "Cursed Bones" mission. Artwork by EquiN0
 
Welcome to S&M Games AS (Ltd.), a Norway based company that creates card and miniatures games. Our first release will be 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War, an awesome card&dice game!
We are proud to say that it will be MADE IN NORWAY.
(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends)
We have decided to make this campaign as simple as possible, without stretch goals other than making the miniatures game rulebook and tokens available as physical products:
The rules and tokens for the miniatures game will be available as a PDF to all backers of the The Rift War - 2 player core set, and up (Please note: The card game is all physical products).
If we reach 12.500 Euro we will print the miniatures game rulebook and include it in the 2 player core starter set as a physical product.
If we reach 20.000 Euro we will print the miniatures game tokens and include them in the 2 player core starter set as a physical product.
As we have a running dialogue with our printer, and they are only a 40 minute drive away, this will not increase production or delivery time.
Instead we want to deliver an awesome game (two in fact) in the shortest time possible.
Our aim is to start shipping the game 1-2 weeks after the campaign is successfully funded. As we are using a local printing service, Rolf Ottesen AS, with which we have a great cooperation, we can hit that "print" button as soon as we break even. The number of copies of the game is easily adjusted as the campaign progresses, to ensure that every backer gets their copy, as well as not printing more than we need which is good for the environment.
(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends)
Please note: If the campaign is successfully funded, backers from Norway will have 25% VAT (MVA) added with the shipping cost.
Watch us unbox the very first demo set of 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War.

THE CARD&DICE GAME:
The Rift War card game will be a soft introduction to the lore, the world and many of the characters that reside there, while at the same time being a unique card and dice deck builder game combining elements of traditional RPGs with tactical deck building and miniatures games. If this sounds complicated, do not worry. The game has an incredible intuitive mechanism and EVERY playtester has loved it (even without forcing their arms)!
The games are suitable for ages 13+

Zombified warrior - one of the many playable characters in both the card and miniatures game. Artwork by George Seryapov
1-48Fantasy: The Rift War lets you lead a party of adventurers on dangerous quests, expeditions and adventures to become more powerful, and recruit new party members. Eventually you'll have to fight the Final Encounter, but can you complete the mission without the help of your opponent? Which side will you take in the ongoing war?
Every card in the game has beautiful, original art, made by our international artists

The "Mysteries in the Mist" mission. Artwork by EquiN0
 
This deckbuilder card and dice game is a new twist to the genre! Not only does it play very fast (an experienced player can win a game in 15 minutes) but you can play it solo, coop, versus and multiplayer coop or versus (multiplayer requires an additional copy of the 2 player starter set, for every 2 players).

Actual cards from the game. Morgoth the Mortician has a very useful ability, letting you bring back your best characters. A ghoul is powerful, especially in the miniatures game, but is limited by which characters he may join in the card game. Birk's ability allows you to plan those "challenges"!
 
Coins allow you to purchase upgrades for your party at the marketplace. Counties you aquire while playing gives you permanent bonuses to your party, giving you the upper hand in those thrilling Player vs Players combats (requires the Exclusive bundle), and makes the missions easier to succeed! 

Actual cards from the game (but still subject to slight alterations). Counties and Marketplace cards requires the Exclusive bundle
 
It combines strategy, luck and immerses the player into that RPG-feeling through stunning art and captivating lore! The way you play is easy and intuitive so make sure to check out our "How to play 1-48Fantasy: The Rift War" videos:
PART 1/5

PART 2/5


PART 3/5


 
PART 4/5

 
PART 5/5

 
The name of the game lends itself from Baueda Wargames' 1-48Tactic miniatures ruleset which we have a license to use. You will also see images and models from Mantic Games in the rules and how to play videos as we have permission to use those as well.



                        www.1-48tactic.com                                                    www.manticgames.com
The music you hear in our videos is made by Christer Price from Norway.
 
One of the important aspects of the game is that even if you end up being the underdog, seeing your opponent run away with all the victory points, you can still come out on top, claiming the victory. This is possible with our unique Player vs Player combat mechanism where, with a little luck, you can claim victory from almost certain defeat. This is made possible with the added randomness of the dice element.

Two EXCLUSIVE six sided dice are included in the 2 player core starter set. The "Translucent Smoke" design matches the grey of the unaligned faction you will be playing as.
Further expansions will introduce colored dice for all the different factions - truly EPIC!
 
The different mission decks let you play against both "the game" and versus your opponent. You do not have to confront your opponent until you feel it is the right time to do so, and in this respect both players have total control over how the game plays.
You can of course also embark on a SOLO quest to gain RENOWN and counties in Garrandur! Three levels of difficulty is provided for beginner, experienced and advanced players. 

Image from "The Rift Cult" mission. Artwork by EquiN0
 
If you pledge for the Exclusive bundle you will get access to some cool extra features where you will actually be rewarded with a county in the nation of Garrandur (where the game takes place) when you win a Final Encounter, and access to the marketplace. There is also added features to the miniatures game.
(Shipping cost will be collected after the campaign ends)

Image from "The Artifact" Final Encounter mission. Artwork by Evelinn Enoksen
 
At the marketplace you can spend those hard-earned coins gained by risking your (party's) life, purchasing weapons and spells to further aid your party in the coming struggle. story:
Hello! We're Evan and Josh, two goofy guys that have a soft spot for charts and nerdy humor. In 2019, you helped us Kickstart the original Charty Party, an adult card game centered around making absurd graphs.

When we launched the original Charty Party, we had one goal: make a clever, irreverent party game that made you think. But, as soon as it went live, we started getting dozens of emails like this:

"Hi there! I am a high school physics/math teacher, and I was wondering if you had a school appropriate version to use in my classroom? Students often struggle with interpreting graphs, but Charty Party makes it fun and engaging!" -Elizabeth

We realized we'd stumbled onto a game that could be as educational as it was fun. So, we interviewed teachers, parents, and students to make an equally hilarious version of the game that's appropriate for anyone, from at home with your entire family or in a classroom setting. Charty Party: All Ages Edition is a standalone game, but it can be used as a hilarious expansion pack to the original version, too.

So, whether you're an educator looking for an intuitive way to teach graph literacy that students can't stop playing, or just want a clever card game you can break out in mixed company, please help us make this new game a reality. Thanks all,

Evan + Josh

A New Kind of Stretch Goal

If you're not familiar with Stretch Goals, they're milestones many successful crowdfunding campaigns set for surpassing their funding goal, usually in the form of higher quality items, exclusive content, etc.

For this campaign, we thought we'd do something different. We've been overjoyed to see the impact teachers say Charty Party: All Ages can have in their classrooms, so we wanted to do our part to get this game into the hands of more students. To that end, we're donating a Departmental Set (10 games) to schools around the country for every $5,000 raised during our first month of crowdfunding. We passed the $80k mark, so here are the 16 schools receiving games!

story:
WHAT IS THE BOARD GAME DESIGN LAB?

The BGDL is a podcast, website, and community that helps fledgling game designers get better at the craft, so they can design great games people love.

The podcast airs weekly episodes that interview the best of the best designers, publishers, and insiders in the board game industry.

The website is a massive resource hub with TONS of links to everything board game design related.

And the community is an incredible group of people who have come together to help each other grow as designers and make better games.

WHO'S IN CHARGE HERE?

WHY BACK THIS PROJECT?

Supporting this project will:

  • Help pay for all the costs of operating the website and podcast. (servers, hosting, etc.)
  • Allow the BGDL to go bigger. (more giveaways, design contests, improved quality, etc.)
  • Help board game designers all around the world.
  • Give you the chance to win FREE games! (more details below)

And you'll receive some awesome perks! (listed below)

 

STRETCH GOALS

The 2018 Game Design Challenge

Because we hit this stretch goal, the BGDL will be sponsoring a board game design competition that will run from late April to mid July.

To learn more about the upcoming contest, click HERE.

IGNITE Conference

IGNITE will be an online conference held on a Saturday in late 2018. It'll be hosted through a private Facebook group.

Professional game designers and publishers will give talks on various topics, and you'll be able to ask them questions. And because it's online, you can experience it from your couch.

Also, if you can't make it to one or all the talks, the videos will remain available in the Facebook group, so you can come back and watch them later.

Click HERE to learn more.

Board Game Design Star

This will be a design contest like no other. It'll have a bit of a reality show vibe as contestants work their way through design challenges and compete to be the best.

There will be eliminations, community voting, guest judges, and more. I'm really excited to see this thing come to life.

 

THE PERKS OF BACKING

If you back this project for $10 or more, you'll get some awesome stuff:

Board Game Design Mentors (PDF and/or Paperback)

Over the last 4 months, I've been interviewing the best game designers in the world and picking their brains for as much wisdom and insight as I could. And this book is the result.

Game design is hard. We all need mentors to guide our work and help us become better at the craft. In these pages, you'll find incredible advice from 60+ of the top designers in the industry today.

You'll learn things like:

  • What Rob Daviau would tell his younger self.
  • How Matt Leacock gets into the zone and flow of design.
  • ​Lessons Jamey Stegmaier learned from his biggest failure.
  • The best advice Richard Launius would give a designer who is just 
    starting out.
  • What recent purchase has helped Jon Gilmour's designs the most.
  • The life philosophy that improves Richard Garfield's game designs.
  • ​What Bruno Cathala would tell you after a discouraging playtest.
  • Donald X. Vaccarino's advice on pitching a game to a publisher.
  • The behavior that has helped Ryan Laukat's designs dramatically improve. 
  • What Richard Bresse does when he feels overwhelmed or unfocused.
  • How Martin Wallace knows when to walk away from a design for a while.
  • ​The game Bruno Faidutti recommends most to fledgling designers.

Other mentors include Gil Hova, Daryl Andrews, Mike Fitzgerald, Alan Emrich, James Ernest, Edo Baraf, Sen-Foong Lim, Jay Cormier, JT Smith, Tom Lehmann, JR Honeycutt, Luke Laurie, Colby Dauch, Mac Gerdts, Jerry Hawthorne, Reiner Stockhausen, Isaac Childres, Geoff Englestein, Chris Kirkman, Vital Lacerda, Matthias Cramer, Alf Seegert, Andrew Looney, Don Eskridge, and many more.

Find out about the questions I asked HERE.

Download 3 sample chapters HERE.

Backers of this project will receive the book at least 2 weeks before it's available on Amazon.

If you would like to order more than one book, simply add $20 to your pledge for each extra book you want. (US or International)

 

2018 Board Game Design Coupon Book

My main goal with the BGDL is to provide you with as much value as I possibly can. So, I've reached out to a TON of companies and freelancers who provide services that game designers would benefit from.

And they've come together to offer incredible discounts and coupons on things like rulebook editing. game components, development, playtesting, Kickstarter consulting, and more. You'll see the specifics at the bottom of this page.

The savings from using just one coupon in the book could cover its cost.

The coupon books will be emailed to backers a few days after this campaign ends.

The books will be individually numbered.

 

Meal at Dice Tower Con

Going to Dice Tower Con? Want to hang out and grab a meal together?

Back the project at this level to join Gabe for lunch or dinner during the convention. The cost of food is included.

 

Skype Sessions

Have you hit a design wall and can't figure out how to get past it? Need to work on your elevator pitch before meeting with a publisher? Got a sell sheet that needs another set of eyes to look it over?

Discuss these things and more with Gabe over Skype.

At this level, you'll get 3 (one hour) Skype calls to talk through anything game design related.

Calls will be scheduled throughout 2018 at the backer's and Gabe's convenience.

 

REFERRAL CONTEST

As a way to both get the word out about the project and thank the people who do so, there will be a referral contest running throughout the campaign.

The 3 people who bring in the most money to the project through their referral links will win FREE games from Cool Stuff Inc.

  • 1st place will get a $50 gift certificate
  • 2nd place will get a $25 gift certificate
  • 3rd place will get a $15 gift certificate

To count as a referrer, you must promote the campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools (located at the top of the page) while logged into your Indiegogo account. This is important because otherwise, your unique ID won’t be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.

Example:

When Funder A is logged into their account and uses Indiegogo’s share tools to send a tweet, for example, the link in the tweet includes Funder A’s unique ID. Then, when Funder B reads the tweet and clicks through the link to contribute, Funder A is recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by Funder B.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

The book is 90% done, but as with any creative venture, there's always a chance for delays. Printing and fulfillment are being handled by a subsidiary of Amazon, so the likelihood of a delay in printing or shipping is possible but highly unlikely.

The books will be printed in multiple locations around the world, so the wait time for shipping will be drastically shorter than most crowdfunding projects. (No waiting for a ship to cross the ocean!)

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If now's just not a good time to help support the show, that's okay! Here are a couple other ways you can help:

  • Get on social media and help spread the word about the campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to refer people to the project. You'll win FREE games from Cool Stuff Inc if you're one of the top 3 referrers!

(Please note that you must be logged into your IndieGoGo account when using the share tools to get credit for any referrals.)
story_txt:
WHAT IS THE BOARD GAME DESIGN LAB?
The BGDL is a podcast, website, and community that helps fledgling game designers get better at the craft, so they can design great games people love.
The podcast airs weekly episodes that interview the best of the best designers, publishers, and insiders in the board game industry.
The website is a massive resource hub with TONS of links to everything board game design related.
And the community is an incredible group of people who have come together to help each other grow as designers and make better games.


WHO'S IN CHARGE HERE?

WHY BACK THIS PROJECT?
Supporting this project will:

Help pay for all the costs of operating the website and podcast. (servers, hosting, etc.)
Allow the BGDL to go bigger. (more giveaways, design contests, improved quality, etc.)
Help board game designers all around the world.
Give you the chance to win FREE games! (more details below)

And you'll receive some awesome perks! (listed below)
 
STRETCH GOALS

The 2018 Game Design Challenge
Because we hit this stretch goal, the BGDL will be sponsoring a board game design competition that will run from late April to mid July.
To learn more about the upcoming contest, click HERE.

IGNITE Conference
IGNITE will be an online conference held on a Saturday in late 2018. It'll be hosted through a private Facebook group.
Professional game designers and publishers will give talks on various topics, and you'll be able to ask them questions. And because it's online, you can experience it from your couch.
Also, if you can't make it to one or all the talks, the videos will remain available in the Facebook group, so you can come back and watch them later.
Click HERE to learn more.


Board Game Design Star
This will be a design contest like no other. It'll have a bit of a reality show vibe as contestants work their way through design challenges and compete to be the best.
There will be eliminations, community voting, guest judges, and more. I'm really excited to see this thing come to life.

 
THE PERKS OF BACKING
If you back this project for $10 or more, you'll get some awesome stuff:
Board Game Design Mentors (PDF and/or Paperback)

Over the last 4 months, I've been interviewing the best game designers in the world and picking their brains for as much wisdom and insight as I could. And this book is the result.
Game design is hard. We all need mentors to guide our work and help us become better at the craft. In these pages, you'll find incredible advice from 60+ of the top designers in the industry today.
You'll learn things like:

What Rob Daviau would tell his younger self.
How Matt Leacock gets into the zone and flow of design.
​Lessons Jamey Stegmaier learned from his biggest failure.
The best advice Richard Launius would give a designer who is just starting out.
What recent purchase has helped Jon Gilmour's designs the most.
The life philosophy that improves Richard Garfield's game designs.
​What Bruno Cathala would tell you after a discouraging playtest.
Donald X. Vaccarino's advice on pitching a game to a publisher.
The behavior that has helped Ryan Laukat's designs dramatically improve. 
What Richard Bresse does when he feels overwhelmed or unfocused.
How Martin Wallace knows when to walk away from a design for a while.
​The game Bruno Faidutti recommends most to fledgling designers.


Other mentors include Gil Hova, Daryl Andrews, Mike Fitzgerald, Alan Emrich, James Ernest, Edo Baraf, Sen-Foong Lim, Jay Cormier, JT Smith, Tom Lehmann, JR Honeycutt, Luke Laurie, Colby Dauch, Mac Gerdts, Jerry Hawthorne, Reiner Stockhausen, Isaac Childres, Geoff Englestein, Chris Kirkman, Vital Lacerda, Matthias Cramer, Alf Seegert, Andrew Looney, Don Eskridge, and many more.
Find out about the questions I asked HERE.
Download 3 sample chapters HERE.
Backers of this project will receive the book at least 2 weeks before it's available on Amazon.
If you would like to order more than one book, simply add $20 to your pledge for each extra book you want. (US or International)
 
2018 Board Game Design Coupon Book

My main goal with the BGDL is to provide you with as much value as I possibly can. So, I've reached out to a TON of companies and freelancers who provide services that game designers would benefit from.
And they've come together to offer incredible discounts and coupons on things like rulebook editing. game components, development, playtesting, Kickstarter consulting, and more. You'll see the specifics at the bottom of this page.
The savings from using just one coupon in the book could cover its cost.
The coupon books will be emailed to backers a few days after this campaign ends.
The books will be individually numbered.
 
Meal at Dice Tower Con

Going to Dice Tower Con? Want to hang out and grab a meal together?
Back the project at this level to join Gabe for lunch or dinner during the convention. The cost of food is included.
 
Skype Sessions
Have you hit a design wall and can't figure out how to get past it? Need to work on your elevator pitch before meeting with a publisher? Got a sell sheet that needs another set of eyes to look it over?
Discuss these things and more with Gabe over Skype.

story:
NatureMatch, the all-Canadian nature art game!

Designed by award-winning Canadian artist Aleta Karstad.

To share her fascination with nature's enchanting diversity, Aleta has selected 36 miniature wildlife portraits in watercolour from her illustrated nature journals, and created a card game for everyone to play with her paintings!

The NatureMatch game allows Aleta to promote the legacy of a lifetime of original illustrated nature journals, and to encourage others to learn more about the beauty and complexity of nature..... and of course, it allows her to share her nature art in a beautiful, educational, and durable hands-on game for all ages!

 

Aleta Karstad, creator of NatureMatch

Award-winning nature artist/conservationist and author, with a passion for inspiring a love of nature through paintings and nature journaling,

Aleta Karstad was awarded the Canadian Nature Federation's ROBERT BATEMAN AWARD in 2018, and in 2020, with her biologist husband Fred Schueler, won the World Wildlife Fund Canada GLEN DAVIS CONSERVATION LEADERSHIP PRIZE.

"I've always said that I haven't seen a thing until I've drawn or painted it. I've traveled across Canada many times with my biologist husband, writing, drawing, and painting in my journals. The fascinating thing about art is how the experience of the artist is directly transmitted to others. So you will find snapshots of my life in these cards - and be able to meet some of the creatures I've painted in our travels - all part of a bigger story that's depicted in my illustrated nature journals."  

 

 

Every day we lose species from the world. Many people will never get to see some of the creatures that may still be plentiful now, but have already been made vulnerable by climate change or human impact. Aleta's detailed art allows you to see them up close and personal. Their descriptions in the accompanying booklet turns you into "the expert", as you share your favourites with others. Aleta's 50 year award-winning legacy of writing and painting in nature has captured the biodiversity of Canada, and NatureMatch helps to expand this legacy to all Canadians - something we can be proud to share! 

 

How this all started :

In March of 2019 Aleta struck up a conversation with a pleasant looking stranger in the Edmonton airport. Hours later they flew off in different directions, having forged a strong bond around the love of nature, and Aleta's art. The next time they saw each other, Natasha Prosser presented her idea... a matching card game of exquisite, close-up nature portraits in watercolour. This started Aleta scanning watercolours from decades of her hand lettered nature journals, and editing them to fit on 2-inch tiles. 

 

The project not only got a lot more exciting, but entirely possible when they found an all-Canadian game manufacturing company, The Playing Card Factory, in Mississauga, Ontario. They are all tooled up to manufacture the cards and the boxes, ready to produce the Limited Edition of 20 NatureMatch games which we will be shipping to our backers in August 2020. In November NatureMatch will be on the shelves as well as carried in their online store.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're so excited that NatureMatch has graduated to InDemand, having nearly tripled our initial campaign goal. With your continued support, we will be able to keep producing NatureMatch in Canada and build a following for this beautiful game that inspires nature art and conservation across Canada and internationally. 

Our backers will still be able to choose any number of NatureMatch games as "perks", with deeper discounts for volume, that will thank them for their continued support. This will also give our partners and retailers a chance to get in on the action. We also will giftwrap games so your friends and family will know not to open them 'til Christmas!

Thanks to all of our backers

- we couldn't have gotten this far without you! 

Now it's up to you as our supporters, to back us as we launch into the retail market. You are helping make this legacy of Karstad watercolours and their celebration of Biodiversity, something that everyone can enjoy together while they play the NatureMatch game.

 

Thanks also to our team, that continues to support, grow, and evolve with us! 

... a true Canadian treasure - The Playing Card Factory, an all-Canadian, FSC certified printing company based in Mississauga Ontario. They've been in the printing business for 28 years and producing card games since 2011, using ethically sourced paper and wood products that come from responsibly managed and verified recycled sources. The Playing Card Factory will be custom printing our cards and boxes, holding the inventory, and shipping out orders, as well as featuring our games on their site. We are thrilled with the many ways they're supporting NatureMatch!

Clever, creative, and keen Graphic designer Chris Chinkiwsky of CoBa Studios in Merrickville, Ontario,  has worked his magic in preparing the NatureMatch tiles to be print-ready, and designing the print elements of both game boxes with Aleta's forest oil paintings.

Natasha Prosser is still enthusiastic about her role as cofounder, and looks forward to the challenge of marketing an all-Canadian product to the world!

... and Aleta Karstad is still revelling in the fact that  her paintings will be played with by nature lovers everywhere, and is looking through her journals, planning future editions of NatureMatch. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Take photos of family and friends playing NatureMatch and post to our FaceBook page. 
  • Use the Comments section of this campaign to leave reviews of NatureMatch! 
  • Join our mailing list and you'll be kept in the loop as NatureMatch gets out there, including announcements of up and coming editions of the game!
  • and don't forget the Indiegogo share tools for social networking are an easy way to spread the news!

story:
A friend has passed to the great beyond, and a funeral has lain him to his final rest. Something, however, seems hollow and different about the affair. There is unfinished business, and everyone knows it — yet nobody knows just what it is that everyone seems to have forgotten.  It feels almost that the dearly departed has some other task, some incomplete goal that must be achieved before it can move on. Something damning has trapped them in the Underworld and only through the deeds of their closest friends may a final and lasting rest be achieved.

One Last Thing is an adventure designed for characters of 7th-10th level that takes place in a familiar town setting, but eventually leads to the edges of Styx and the entrance to the Underworld itself. The characters explore the plains of the dead on their way to the forbidden Necropolis of Ankev, and in the city of corpses they face demons, devils, and dreaded liches while they track down the spirit of the dearly departed ... to discover the crucial one last thing.

The Project 

Frog God Games projects on Indiegogo are simple, focused, and short.

  • Short in duration (2-3 weeks)
  • Fast delivery of PDF once funding is completed
  • Limited to a single title
  • Have options priced between $5-$30
  • Stretch goals and project bonuses (if any) affect the principle reward only (usually both the PDF and the softcover).
  • Are the only guaranteed method to get the premium* print copy (NOTE: the softcover versions  in this printing will not be sold on our website: see FAQ for explanation).
  • Have a simple fulfillment process that does not use Backerkit

*Premium means heavyweight glossy interior pages enhancing the art and color elements. The  thick, glossy cardstock brings out the vibrant color of the cover illustration. These are the nicest softcover books we have ever sold and we only print a title this way once.

Any reprint would use print on demand service that, although nice, do not approach the quality of our INDIEGOGO funded books.

Why the Tiny Print Run?

Since 2012 our crowdfunding approach has been extravagant in every way. Ambitious with massive page counts, plus numerous add-on options and stretch goals. All supporting a primary title itself as many as 990 pages.

This has resulted in Kickstarter's with memorable pledge rewards that include top-quality hardcover books with sometimes dozens of stretch goal bonuses and add-on extras. These are awesome AND they are expensive to buy for customers like you because they are very expensive to make for publishers like us.

Why not use Kickstarter?

We will still be using Kickstarter, frequently, for our large-scale projects, but we hear the request for less expensive options for our products all the time, especially smaller, faster-paced adventures that can be completed in 2-3 sessions.

 

Product enhancements tied to project success 

During the funding period for One Last Thing and after the funding goal is met we will  improve the delivered product based on additional sales. There are no special tiered collectors editions or add-on purchase extras. Thus, as total project funding increases, the better the final product will be for everybody.

Examples of improvements made to earlier products:

  • Additional commissions for interior color art specific to the adventure. 
  • The previous Indiegogo project added 2 interior art pieces and 3 extra creature illustrations for its appendix.
  • Downloadable Options designed for popular virtual table-top software (The rewards for both How Orcus Stole Christmas! and In Vino Gigantus included the new creature/NPC tokens and player maps). 
  • High-resolution files of illustrations to share with players at the table.

 

Project Delivery

PDF Perks

We will email the instructions to all eligible supporters with instructions on accessing PDF items. The PDF files are distributed using Constant Contact service and our web store. You will need to have a customer account on the Frog God Games website to get your PDF; it's how we keep track of everything and grants unlimited access by you to your reward.

The Indiegogo perk PDF files are 'purchased' at zero cost by supporters (as they are paid for during the Indiegogo promotion) at the Frog God Games web store using a coupon code. That code we will be sent via Constant Contact to the address provided by Indiegogo. Please contact us with any questions/requests about this.

Softcover Perks

Softcover perks will be mailed to the address provided by us via Indiegogo. 

 

Overseas Shipping

NOTE TO INTERNATIONAL BACKERS: Shipping international has become very expensive. We understand this. Likewise, some countries charge VAT tax or other fees to our customers on receipt. We cannot fraudulently lie about the value of materials we mail out. We are happy to ship you anything regardless of where you live, but we have to stay in business at the same time thus even our lightest books are affected. In the near future we expect to have a print on demand system in place for everyone overseas, It is not ideal, as the final book is not printed at the highest-quality when compared to the ones we fulfill in Indiegogo.

To explain what we mean, please see the shipping calculator for UPS

story:
Darwin's Choice contains 273 cards, 187 cardboard chips, a box and a rule book. The basic version of the game is available in German and English.

Heads, tails, wings and pairs of single legs

Body and double legs

 

 

The cards of Darwin's Choice (sizes: 75x50mm; 100x65mm) will have 300gsm blackcore quality. Box and chips are made of 2mm grey cardboard. The rule book is printed on high quality gloss paper. 

It is particularly important to us that only wood from FSC-certified sources is used for all game components (incl. box and rule book), i.e. the wood comes from sustainable forestry.

 

The core elements of Darwin's Choice are the vegetation zones and the animal cards. All vegetation zones have an individual food supply and different requirements to fulfill.

Example of a vegetation zone and an optimally suitable animal card

The objective for each player is to create animal species that are as optimally adapted as possible. Only these can obtain enough food for themselves in the vegetation zones, which is crucial for their survival.

A player places a new animal species in the vegetation zone polar desert.

 

Between the eras played, vegetation zone changes plus effects of event cards transform the prevailing conditions. Using sophisticated mutations, players can improve already established animal species or save endangered species from extinction.

Mutations can completely change the appearance and even the diet of an animal species over time.

 

Next to mutations, players may also move their animal species to other vegetation zones to ensure their survival or even establish the species at the top of the food chain.

Adaptable animal species can survive in a wide variety of vegetation zones.

Throughout the game, players try to collect as many Darwin points as possible with their most adaptable and strongest animal species. But they have to stay focussed until the very end. If a species dies out, then all but one of its obtained Darwin points are lost.

The objective of all players, animal species with as many Darwin points as possible.

 

Everything you need to know about the rules of Darwin’s Choice can be found here, in our rules explanation video and in the rule book.

With a click on the yellow banner below you will find the English and German rules for Darwin's Choice.  

Our declared goal (also see Language Stretch Goals) is the professional translation of Darwin's Choice into as many additional languages as possible.  

Please note that the rules are not yet in latest design (reason: this is very cost intensive). The final game issued, however, will contain a professionally designed layout for the rules. The text ratio then will be significantly lower, along with many more graphical elements and explanatory images.

 

Watch Phil, Samuel and Marc demonstrate a full game of Darwin's Choice. They are clearly having a lot of fun.

 

Darwin's Choice was shipped to persons in 14 countries around the globe. We hope that each of you can find a reviewer whom you trust, and who can describe Darwin's Choice in your own language.  

We have offered a small expense allowance to only 6 reviewers. These previews are marked with an asterisk *. Note however, that we have never paid for a positive opinion. Thus, each reviewer may freely express his opinion on our game.

World map with the location of all reviewers

                                                     The Dice Tower*,             Undead Viking*,                 Geek Dad

Board Game Quest*, Everything Board Games,  Meeple Mountain, The McGuire Review

             Roll for Crit,                Blue Peg Pink Peg,         Jeff Fuzzy Wenzel

                                                     École du Jeu,                                                              Covil dos Jogos
 

                                                The Game Gallery,                                              The Dice Men Cometh

 

                                                 We're not Wizards,            Polyhedron Collider,           Ludovox*
 
       Análisis-Parálisis,                       Unna,                          Gioconauta,                     Just Nerd
 
 

        Epitrapaizoume,             Lautapeliopas,            As a Board Gamer,           Game Troll TV*
 

       Brettspielgeeks*,          Brettspielblog.net,        Brettspiele Runde,     Victoria Parta Spiele

 

       Brettspiel-Hero,                    Spielkult,                        Brettspiel Box

 

The stretch goals have been designed to enhance Darwin's Choice as a whole, e.g. new beautiful artworks. No new components will be included into the game, because Darwin's Choice is already complete in its basic version.  

 

Considering that many stretch goals got unlocked, the planned delivery date for InDemand costumers would be May 2019. This is due to the fact that our artist, Rozenn draws all artworks by hand, thus, needing enough time. Our expectation is, of course, that Darwin's Choice will be in your hands earlier, i.e. as soon as possible. 

We have placed much effort into finding options to send Darwin's Choice to your home at a fair price. For this reason, the shipping prices are also subsidized, i.e. a part of the cost is covered by ourselves.

Switzerland: 10 $  

USA: 12 $  

EU, Canada, Australia: 15 $  

Rest of Europe, Brazil, South Africa, Japan, South Korea, China, New Zealand: 20 $ 

Rest of the world: 25 $

Unfortunately, we cannot deliver Darwin's Choice to the following countries due to international regulations and problematic delivery conditions: Afghanistan, Iraq, Yemen, Kazakhstan, Myanmar, North Korea, Pakistan, Russia, Sudan, Syria, and Ukraine.

We would be delighted to see our game on the shelves of retailers around the world.  

If you are a retailer interested in Darwin's Choice please contact us at info@treecer.com. We look forward to working with you.

We would be honored to welcome you to our community. Be part of the story of Darwin's Choice and tell your friends about us. Thank you very much!

The idea for Darwin's Choice originally came from Marc, who is a huge animal enthusiast and therefore always had the dream of developing a game with animals. After a conversation with Samuel over a cup of tea, the basic game mechanics behind Darwin's Choice were born. Marc then created the first prototype with printing paper and chips from other board games. In countless test games Darwin's Choice was improved and optimized. New ideas found their way into the game, while others were dropped. In addition to internal test games, Marc and Samuel drove the prototypes all over Switzerland visiting over 15 game clubs and festivals. The feedback gained was intensively discussed during return journeys with best ideas and concepts finding their way into the game. After numerous prototypes and game versions, we are hereby proud to present the final version of Darwin's Choice. We hope that you and your fellow players will enjoy it as much as we do.

The development of the Grizzly head card from the first prototype to the small series produced for reviewers.

Rozenn Grosjean's workplace covered with the artworks of Darwin's Choice

Rozenn Grosjean is a French freelance illustrator and the genius behind all of the artworks in our game, Darwin’s Choice. Over months she has by hand lovingly illustrated all the cards, chips, icons and of course our unique box cover. Each stretch goal achieved means that even more wonderful illustrations by Rozenn will be integrated into the game, and that we will work with her for several more months.  

The cooperation with Rozenn was excellent and we all had a lot of fun. Her professionalism, reliability and flexibility impressed us very much. We could not consider ourselves happier, and can warmly recommend a cooperation with her to everyone. If you wish to follow Rozenn on social media or contact her about a collaboration, please find all relevant information on Rozenn's website (yellow banner below).

 

Marc, Samuel and Elio have been friends for ages, so they have stopped counting the years. They know and appreciate each other very well, knowing what they have in each other. The different skills in the team make for a perfect complement. Marc holds a Master's degree in Business Administration (University of Zurich) and enjoys drawing a lot. Samuel completed his Master in Microbiology and Immunology (ETH Zurich) last year, and is a big fan of everything that is a bit geeky. Last but not least, Elio is the technical genius in the team, giving 3D printer courses and currently studying toward a Bachelor of Electrical Engineering (ETH Zurich). In addition to his help with Darwin's Choice, Elio is currently developing his own product, which he will bring to Kickstarter in early 2019.  

Beyond their friendship, the three are also connected by their love of board and card games. It does not matter whether a strategic heavyweight like Scythe or something lighter such as Munchkin. Darwin's Choice is a dream come true, which the three want to bring to the tables around the world. The entire team has invested countless hours and a considerable amount of capital - because the game should meet the highest standards and, above all, provide something for everyone to enjoy!  

Want to get in touch with us? No problem; write us an email to info@treecer.com or a comment in the comments section. We look forward to your feedback or questions, and with pleasure quickly respond.

Without these fantastic people, none of this would have been possible. Our deepest thanks to all of you.

 

Darwin's Choice has been tested, improved and optimized by us over months in countless test games. The game we present here is final and works without restrictions. All pictures/designs of the basic game (without stretch goals) are ready for production. 

Since only printed products are used in Darwin's Choice, the risk of production complications is rather low. In addition, Darwin's Choice has explicitly decided not to use a complicated system of add-ons and additional rewards. This decision significantly limits the scope for shipping errors and allows us to focus entirely on the perfect finalization of the game. 

Nevertheless, there are always unforeseen circumstances that can affect the process during the production/shipment of a game. Delay by third parties, shortage of materials, strikes and natural disasters can never be fully excluded. You can rest assured, however, that our team will do everything to reduce the influence of unfavorable circumstances to an absolute minimum. In addition, we promise to provide regular and transparent information regarding current status via updates and social media, so that you will always have a clear overview of the overall standing.

Darwin's Choice is our first Kickstarter campaign. But as is clearly visible from the campaign, we have become quite familiar with the topic and have done our homework. We know what to expect and where possible risks lie. Swiss people worldwide are considered punctual, organized and reliable, and we want to and will fulfill this cliché. We would be happy if you support our project, in return we deliver you a functioning, high-quality produced game on time.

Darwin's Choice contains 273 cards, 187 cardboard chips, a box and a rule book. The basic version of the game is available in German and English.Heads, tails, wings and pairs of single legsBody and double legs  The cards of Darwin's Choice (sizes: 75x50mm; 100x65mm) will have 300gsm blackcore quality. Box and chips are made of 2mm grey cardboard. The rule book is printed on high quality gloss paper. It is particularly important to us that only wood from FSC-certified sources is used for all game components (incl. box and rule book), i.e. the wood comes from sustainable forestry. The core elements of Darwin's Choice are the vegetation zones and the animal cards. All vegetation zones have an individual food supply and different requirements to fulfill.Example of a vegetation zone and an optimally suitable animal cardThe objective for each player is to create animal species that are as optimally adapted as possible. Only these can obtain enough food for themselves in the vegetation zones, which is crucial for their survival.A player places a new animal species in the vegetation zone polar desert. Between the eras played, vegetation zone changes plus effects of event cards transform the prevailing conditions. Using sophisticated mutations, players can improve already established animal species or save endangered species from extinction.Mutations can completely change the appearance and even the diet of an animal species over time. Next to mutations, players may also move their animal species to other vegetation zones to ensure their survival or even establish the species at the top of the food chain.Adaptable animal species can survive in a wide variety of vegetation zones.Throughout the game, players try to collect as many Darwin points as possible with their most adaptable and strongest animal species. story:
Hello! I'm Kobey Gordon, the lead and as of currently, only designer and producer of Zenith. I've always been interested in creating games, especially those of the tabletop variety. A couple friends and I built Zenith after expressing our frustrations with current modern TCGs. This is a project I have been working on since middle school, and after going through build after build, prototype after prototype, I'm ready to show the world what a fresh pair of hands can bring into the realm of tabletop gaming.


     Zenith is a Strategy card game for two players that takes inspiration from games like Pokemon and Hearthstone. There are stylistic and mechanical choices that give Zenith an identity, such as:

  • Pixel art style reminiscent of 16 and 32 bit sprite based games.
  • A simple but deep combat system where Unit cards change the way they act each turn.
  • No dedicated resource cards, like lands or energy. Instead, any card can be played face down as your resource.

     As opposed to other collectible card games, Zenith uses the "Living" card game model. Instead of buying randomized booster packs with cards of varying rarities, Zenith discards rarity entirely, and a pack comes with one copy of each card in an entire set! This puts all players on a much more even playing field, encourages experimentation, and erases the existence of "chase" rare cards that can skyrocket in price.

     In order to play Zenith, you and a friend (Or rival, or arch nemesis) build a deck of exactly 40 cards. Each player draws three cards. If your going second, draw an extra card on your first turn. To play cards, you have to "Tribute" cards. Tributing a card means you put it in front of you face down. This card is now an energy card, and can be "Rested" (Turned sideways) to add one Energy to your stock. You can use energy to play cards or use attacks.

Huggy Slime is  a unit card. These cards stay on the field and use attacks once each turn. You don't need any energy to play this card, indicated by the blue number in the diamond. This unit also has two attacks, one that does 1 damage, and one that costs two energy, but heals and does more damage.

This is an Art card, and a card of the Fire type. Art cards have special one-use abilities that can help you.

Here's another fire card, this time an Item. Items attach to your units, giving them extra attacks and abilities. For example, if you attached this card to Huggy Slime, it could use the Throw attack, which is stronger than it's default attacks.

The key to being a great player is finding a strategy that's adaptable and synergistic. Good luck experimenting with the three elemental schools of Fire, Water, and Earth! 

     You may be asking, "What's in it for me?". You might not. I can't read minds. But what I can do is tell you about our perks and our flexible funding method.

  • Zenith WILL eventually release, whether we fully fund it or not.  I am asking for funding to hire many diverse and talented pixel artists, so my project can have as much aesthetic and flair as possible. I am also raising funds for the manufacturing costs of a bulk order, so I can travel around to local game stores and offer my product in as many places as possible.
  • The perks to your right allow you to be put on a special thank you card, get the game at a discounted price, get special alternate cards, and even let your original character, or even you, on a super powerful Zenith card!

Here's a handy dandy pie chart I fully intend to be following regarding the funds:

Why no Stretch Goals?

     I have a very clear vision and goals for my project, and am aware of my limitations. Due to these factors, I am deciding not to bite off more than I can chew and will not be providing any stretch goals. However, all funds I receive in excess will be spent on commissioning more artists, and, more importantly, developing a second set of Zenith.
