story:
All assets and artworks shown are not final, but in case of change they will only be improved!

 

 

We provide CUSTOMS FREE shipping to:

  • the United States of America
  • Canada
  • EU members
  • Australia
  • China
  • Latin America
  • Singapore
  • Japan
  • Russia
  • New Zealand

Shipping costs 25$ for every country. 

We do NOT ship to these countries:

the Democratic Republic of Congo, Eritrea, Iraq, Liberia, Libya, Somalia, Sudan, Yemen, Iran, Central African Republic, North Korea, Syria.

The Price

A long time was spent to find quality manufacturing materials. The price is justified with quality materials for meeples, thick tiles, beautiful dice and hard box. Meeples and Factories' average height is 4.5 cm (~1.8 inches) and the thickness is 1 cm (~0.4 inches) and they stand very well. Tiles are from thick cardboard, the side of a tile is 8 cm (~3.2 inches) and the thickness is more than enough for comfortable playing. The sizes of the box are: 35 cm (~13.8 inches)  * 35 cm (~13.8 inches) * 7 cm (~3.2 inches) and weighs about 3 kg (~6.7 lbs). So that's why the shipping costs 25 USD, the shipping duration is 10-14 days after having the game produced. You can expect the game to arrive sooner.

 

You are the last people of your village, and you have to survive. You are in the safe zone, which is becoming smaller and smaller due to a storm. In this matter of life and death you will fight enemies, wild animals, and you will face adventures and traps. You will need friends, smart tactics, and economical management skills.

  •  Catapult is a strong weapon for holding your positions and it can help you keep enemies at a distance. Charge it with a stone to shoot.
  •  The Tiger is an angry animal. Don't go by him alone, unless you want to die. He becomes afraid when you attack with a friend!
  •  The Horse is a very fast animal. It can give you a big advantage, but only if you use it smartly. You can slice your enemies while jumping on them with a horse.
  •  Aborigine is very dangerous. Don't try to visit him with your friend. He is afraid of nothing, and will eat both of you at once.

  •  The Abyss limits your way and creates an obstacle for your enemies too.Try to use it effectively and it can also help you, but stop your enemies in their tracks. 
  •  The Forest is dark and silent, but you can hear the guiding voices of others and must follow them. 
  •  The Pit can be critical for you, because when you fall, it takes time for you to climb, giving your enemies an advantage in giving them time to find and defeat you.
  •  The Trap is an unpleasant thing for an individual. Landing in a trap means that you cannot free yourself and must wait for a friend to come free you!

  •  The Stone is one of the many types of resources. 
  •  The Chest is a big treasure in a game. Finding it will give you resources that you need in game.
  •  The Road Sign is an effective way to move faster helping you make an escape from the enemy. Use it effectively and it can help you, but it can also bring you troubles.
  •  The Tunnel is the fastest way of moving through the map, because it sends you from one tile to another, helping attack enemies as you appear suddenly. Be careful as your enemy can use it and you'll end up being the victim.

And a lot of other cards that can be used as a part of your tactic!

  • At the beginning of every game you get 2 soldiers. Soldiers can both kill enemies and build factories so he's the most economically important villager. He only has cold weapons, so he can only attack his neighbor enemy. You can only have 5 soldiers on your board at one time.

  • Thief has no attack power but he can defend when he needs it. The thief moves twice as fast than other villagers and his main goal is to steal enemies' resources and keep them tense in anticipation.

  • The Wizard is the most dangerous villager, because he has magic powers with which he can attack from afar. His disadvantage is that he can't fight in a close distance. Make sure to use the wizard from afar, because if you are close and your enemy attacks, the wizard will lose.

  • Factory is a mean of getting resources. It can be placed only by a soldier, and only on an appropriate territory. To place a factory, villagers need to pay the mentioned amount of resources. The more soldiers you have building a factory, the less time it will take due to more manpower.

 

To start a game you need to connect borders and place tiles inside borders. Then choose a color, take 2 soldiers, open the central tile of one of the sides of hexagon and place your soldiers on it. That tile is considered as a free space. It cannot harm you or be used in any way. Place the counter on one of the corners of hexagon, which will be the counting point. After finishing the preparation choose the first player by rolling the dice, the queue will be determined clockwise. The goal is to survive and be the last man standing.

 

​

 

Each of villagers can do one action in each turn. The actions are: moving to neighbor tile, buying another villager, killing enemy villagers. Villager can move only to neighbor tiles (the tile which has common side). He must open the unopened tile after moving on it, if the tile is not closed by the storm. He can also carry the resources with him to the new tile (maximal quantity of each resource is mentioned on villager’s section), but resources only of one type.

 

 

 

The best defense is attacking, so during the game you will appear in some situations where you have to kill your enemies. After death all the loot that was carried by dead villager stays on the appropriate tile, and it can be taken by other villagers.

 

 

One of the most important mechanics of the game is building factories. To build a factory you have to use appropriate amount of resources. The factories are the main resource sources and each factory has its own way of mining resources.  

 

 

The Polemos doesn't only make enemies from player, but also teaches you to make effective alliances. So you can exchange mined resources by demands.

 

 

During a game you can appear in irredeemable situations, in that case, unfortunately, your villager will die, sorry.

 

 

If villager stands on a safe zone he will immediately strengthen his positions so be careful not to appear in the enemy's tile, he can immediately kill you, as you are too close. Remember you don't want to lose any soldiers. 

 

 

One of the villagers can be caught in a trap during the game, but it's not a big trouble, another of yours can help him. 

 

 

If you open a chest tile, you must be happy. It's a great opportunity to get extra gold for your army. Gold is the most expensive and hard to mine resource so try to spend it reasonably.

 

 

Using gold in your villager's tile you can buy others right there. Choose consciously which one to buy, it can change the whole your tactics. The villagers are getting more expensive related to their powers so The Soldier costs 1 gold, The Thief 2 gold and The Wizard costs 3 gold. If you have more than 2 villagers in the game, you will have to pay bread to feed them. 

 

 

It's a good fortune to find a catapult in your way. You shoot it with stone and you can defend your positions with it. The Catapult is the most powerful weapon in the game, as you can kill all the enemies standing on one tile.

 

 

If you passed through all the obstacles of the land , fought with deadly enemies and stayed the last man standing, congratulations you won the game. The Polemos is for people who appreciate the entertainment. Good Luck!

 

 

The Storm is the thing you must always be afraid of. Because of The Storm all villagers are running to the center. Each player, must move the storm counter, after finishing his turn. After each rotation of what we call a "storm counter", one layer of tiles closes, and the counter goes to the inner layer, and continues to move after each turn. Every villager or factory, which is located on the closing layer, will be destroyed when the layer closes.

 

 

The main feature of the Polemos is the battle royale storm mechanics. Storm is what makes the 50% of the game's dynamic.

 

 

When there are only 2 layers opened in the game, the storm counter mechanics change, and the dice shows which tile should be closed. 

We are a small but creative team, who decided, that board games are missing battle royale games for a long time. In some months we have organised and overcome all  difficulties. We are very grateful to all the people who have helped our project to become real, and especially we are grateful to our illustrator for his hard work.

Box Evolution

The first idea of the box art.

The first colored version of box art. missing 'T' :)

Poorly detailed box art version. again that same 'T'

The final art grayscale sketch.

Tadaaam!!! Meet the final box art.

Tile Evolution

The Evolution of The Horse Tile!

The Evolution of The Tiger Tile!

The Evolution of The Cave Tile!

 

During our long work we have many confusions and we were trying to choose the best material for the game. And finally, we are producing the best option for us.

We have also spent a lot of time to choose the final style for the game, and this all only for one thing, to show you a high quality game.

Model Evolution

Model early printed version.

Today's models.

Our Apologies

After having the game in our hands, some confusing situations happened to us. First of all we uploaded the game to Kickstarter and some misunderstandings happened related to the campaign, that were not understood correctly, and we couldn't do anything more. Now we accept all our mistakes and apologize for them and assure you that they will not be repeated.  We are grateful to all people who pointed to our mistakes. It is probable that there are ones who we are not trusted by but we will do our best to fix that. Thanks.

We are very grateful to all our backers, to those people, who have helped us to make this project real.

We have tried to make the most possible dates for the shipping, to not make our impatient consumers wait, and we want them to be able to enjoy The Polemos as soon as it's possible.

  •  Find our artist's works on Behance 
  •  Follow us on Twitter 
  •  Like us on Facebook 
  •  Subscribe to our Instagram 
  •  Be notified in Telegram

story:
Short Summary

Thanks for checking out this project!   

When was the last time you had an actual conversation with your friends? What do you know about their hopes and dreams, their most cherished memory, the one thing you can wake them up for in the middle of the night, or how they would spend their last day on earth? We are so caught up in our own lives, with our phone in hand, that we seem to forget to connect with the people that are right in front of us. About things that matter to us. With these cards, you can put your phone away and start listening to each other and reconnect. You will never run out of topics to talk about anymore and you will learn a great deal about the hopes, dreams, drives, fears, motivations and habits of your conversation partners. Whether you have known them for years or you just met! 

Let's put our phones away and have a meaningful conversation.

Sometimes, when I'm around people, it's just a habit to scroll through my phone aimlessly. Diverting my attention to my phone seems to be easier. And other times, I simply don't know what to talk about. And I dislike meaningless small talk. So I decided to do something about this!  

Simple, elegant, light-weight card deck. Easy to carry around.

I came up with over 200 questions that aims to dive deeper into one's personality, figuring out what shaped their story, how they work the way they work and what makes them tick. I culled the questions to 100, which will offer plenty of conversational topics for a long time! Putting them together in a simple card deck allows people to carry the cards around wherever they go. It's an easy conversation starter and doesn't take up much space.

There are no rules. Just questions. 

You can choose whether you play this game with two people or twenty, whether everyone has to answer the same question you draw, or whether someone draws a different question for someone else to answer. You can use a couple of questions as inspiration for a conversation or you can decide to tackle all 100 (and make it a very long day/night!). You can do anything you like. Just start picking up a question and (re)connect with the people around you! Let's put the phone away and engage with each other, face-to-face, whenever we can.

What We Need & What You Get

The funds raised will help to start production of the cards. I want to print 500 decks of cards for which I received a quote for $1800. Other costs involved are costs for the boxes (around $300) and promotion costs. You will help me greatly if you could support me to reach at least half to start production! As a backer, you will receive one of the printed decks.

Dimensions of the cards are 56 x 87mm, with a gloss finish on 300 gsm card board. The cards will be delivered in a box containing 50 cards each. Production will start end of May, with the first batch ready to be dispatched early June. Depending on your country, it may take up to three or four weeks to get delivered via standard postage. 

The Impact

My aim is to get people more connected and realize we have so much more in common together than we think. Really listening to someone else's story is one of the best gifts you can give someone. And this card game will help start this! 

Risks & Challenges

I've been in contact with a few printers, and have printed three prototypes. None of the prototypes were completely satisfactory and according to my standards and my design. The risk here is that the quality will not live up to my standards. I am getting there with one of the suppliers, but it is a process. Meaning that the first batch that will be printed could contain some errors. The last error that was made, was solely double printing of some questions. The card itself, the size, the colour and the design was printed as specified. So we're getting there! This might mean that the cards might take a bit longer to be produced than anticipated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Share, share, share! <3

Thanks!!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Thanks for checking out this project!   
When was the last time you had an actual conversation with your friends? What do you know about their hopes and dreams, their most cherished memory, the one thing you can wake them up for in the middle of the night, or how they would spend their last day on earth? We are so caught up in our own lives, with our phone in hand, that we seem to forget to connect with the people that are right in front of us. About things that matter to us. With these cards, you can put your phone away and start listening to each other and reconnect. You will never run out of topics to talk about anymore and you will learn a great deal about the hopes, dreams, drives, fears, motivations and habits of your conversation partners. Whether you have known them for years or you just met!

Meaning that the first batch that will be printed could contain some errors. The last error that was made, was solely double printing of some questions. The card itself, the size, the colour and the design was printed as specified. So we're getting there! This might mean that the cards might take a bit longer to be produced than anticipated.

story:
MAGE Company is a board game publisher based in Greece and Bulgaria. The company was created back in 2010 for the purpose of creating new and exciting board games. Since then MAGE Company has published a variety of titles such as 12 Realms, Wrong Chemistry, Hoyuk, Raid & Trade, Res Publica: 2230AD, Carrotia, the Cohort and more. You can check more info for our board games on our official profile at Board Game Geek here.

The company is growing step by step, building new partnerships with well known publishers and distributors, like Edge Entertainment, Heidelberger, Ninja Division, Redbox, TenDays, BrainTeasers, Chaos Publishing, Blackfire and more. Recently we published a new line of products, the MCG Premium Sleeves that you can find available in our shop. We will keep growing this line by adding new sleeve sizes in order to cover most of the games of the market. Currently we offer 14 different sleeve types including the matte ones. Among them and unique sleeves for games like Kingdom Death, the mini square sleeves, and the special ones.

 

MAGE Company develops and publishes games that offer a different playing experience and always supports the main titles with news expansions that enrich the games with new mechanics.  Following the standards of the marker, each board game includes components of high quality. Few titles are published each year, each with its own style, theme, and mechanics. Our priority is to keep a very special line of board, card and miniature games. Our current titles are divided in two different parts: the Family Zone and the Original Games.  We build our lines based on games for the kids and families and for those who are more experienced gamers.

This project is worldwide friendly to avoid the additional fees when you receive your package. Delivery of this project will take place between October 25 - November 25 2018. More info in the Shipping Section and in the FAQ section. 

 

1. High Quality:  The MCG premium sleeves are known for the high quality, clear plastic, smooth feeling and nice shuffling of the cards. Our quality is what we are proud of. 

2. Production: We need the funds from this campaign to reproduce more of the old sizes plus to extend the line by adding a lot new sleeves sizes. Funds will be strictly managed for the production and shipping of this project. 

3. New Unique sizes: We will use the funds to produce new sleeves sizes which are unique like those for Kingdom Death. This time we focus on games of Cmon like Zombicide, Game Workshop games and more.

4. Deep Discount: Through this campaign is a chance to get sleeves and protect as many games as you want since the pricing is lower and as more sleeves you get as more you earn.

5. Early Delivery: You will receive the new sleeves before the distributors or retailers. We will monitor the production at all stages to deliver the sleeves on time.

 

 

 
 
 

 

We need about $25.000 to complete the new production at minimum quantities plus the shipping from China to our warehouse and then for shipping out the packages to you. Along with the stretch goals we will be able to reach the desirable production we want to make and offer a wide sleeves range.

July 25th: We will give the production order to the factory, how many sleeves we need from each size, the packing way and so on.

August 1st: The factory has made the necessary preparations and starts the production. The production we want to make will be complete along with the packing process, around 35 days. We add 2 more weeks just in case. So, total 50 days.

September 20th: The factory has packed all the sleeves in pallets. We book the ship from China to our warehouse through our shipper partner. Transfer to the post, and loading takes 4-5 days, shipping time is 30 days, customs and delivery to the warehouse takes about 7 days.

October 30th: We receive the sleeves in our warehouse. We need 2-3 days to separate all cartons and pallets and depending the amount of orders about 7-10 days to ship out all packages. 

November: During this month people will receive the sleeve packs.

 

 

This campaign is based on a flexible system giving multiple choices. Each pledge level gives you a specific quantity of MCG Premium Transparent sleeves and you can choose the sleeves you want from the ones we offer in the "Sleeves Board" only from the Sleeve Board!

If you have a game but you do not know what sleeves you need then download this file where we have added games and the corresponded sleeves:

DOWNLOAD

 

 

 

 

 

4 out of 5 by Michael / Square Sleeves: “I love these sleeves, they are the best! I use these for my kingdom death gear cards, they work awesomely, as everyone says. "  

5 out of 5 by Greg Kliffel / Dream Sleeves: “I spent months searching for sleeves that would work with the gear cards for Kingdom Death. The sleeves sold by other sites were either too flimsy, too sticky, or cut to weird and irregular sizes. Enter Mage Company. These sleeves are perfect. They are good quality sleeves that don't stick, are cut evenly, and hold the card in place rather than letting it slide out when transitioning from box to table like some others did.”  

4 out of 5 by Robert / Best at this size: “I bought a bunch of these for Kingdom Death's 52mm square gear cards. They're definitely the best sleeves I've seen at this size. I had previously purchased similar sleeves, but they were the same thickness as penny sleeves and they stuck together a lot. Neither of these are issues with Mage Company's. I'm very pleased with the ones I bought here.”  

4 out of 5 by Lee Martin: "Amazing card sleeves, these are the ones that Kingdom Death gear cards will fit into."  

Chengkai Yang: I can also vouch for Mage Co. I had some issues with the initial order as I placed it during Essen and they were swamped. They got my sleeves to me in like 2 weeks from Germany after that was settled. Amazing customer service and the product works. They're FFG quality in terms of thickness and feel. A few of the packs were a bit tighter than others but all my KDM gear is now sleeved! I just need to make a custom insert now because of how much room the sleeves took up.  

Seth Stewart: I will also vouch for Mage Co. I really like the sleeves. I would say in about 5 packs, I'v only found maybe 2-3 sleeves that were slightly miscut. I have yet to open them all; I bought a lot. I am very pleased so far.

 

 

 

1. Delivery of this project will take place between October 25 - November 25. 

2. Most packages will be shipped from Athens, Greece. We have built a co-operation with ELTA the Greek post offices. Some packages for US and Canada may be dispatched from our US vendor.

3. Tracking number applies only for package over 2kg.

4. In some countries like Australia, Singapore, Brazil, big packages may be subject for inspection and that can cause delay. We retain the prices in low level to avoid further taxes and duty fees. 

5. For the packages that will be dispatched from Athens:

5a. For EU countries delivery time is 3-5 business days. In countries like Sweden, Finland, Norway, Spain, UK it may take additional days. It has to do with the delivery speed of the local post offices.

5b. For Australia, China, Singapore, Japan, Brazil delivery time is 10-12 days. Do note that we have noticed cases in Singapore and Australia that may take more days to be delivered.

6. For US and Canada delivery time 7-10 business days.

7.  For the shipping rates we have added in the perks, please note that the actual shipping value is 50-100% more than the value we have in the perks. This additional amount is covered by MAGE Company.

8. Once the packages are our we will send message to each backer to inform about the course of the package.

 

 

 

PRODUCTION RISKS 
Even though we do our best to ensure quality products and delivery on time, there is always the risk of delays. Supplier shortages, holidays, weather conditions, etc are few of the reasons which can create a delay. MAGE Company will handle any unexpected issue on a timely manner and will keep all backers updated through Kickstarter's Message Service and personal e-mail.

 

REFUND POLICY 
We can refund you until we begin the shipping process. Once we begin shipping out packages, refunds will not be available.

 

MISSING / DAMAGED ITEMS 
If you receive your package and you have missing/damaged items, please contact us at : magecompanyinfo@gmail.com and we will make sure to send you replacements/spare parts.

 

DELIVERY DATE 
Our current estimation for delivery is November 2018. For detailed production and delivering planning, please check the "Shipping" section.

 

UNDELIVERED PACKAGES 
If a package is not delivered, due to a wrong address given, unreachable address, a backer who did not claim the deliver packages from local Post Office / Courier Center (that counts for the untracked packages) etc, the backer maybe asked to pay additional shipping fees in order to dispatch the package again.

Thank you very much

MAGE Company LTD

story:
Board an enemy star ship, loot and plunder, complete your objectives and survive!

Take on the role a fierce band of space pirates who have boarded an enemy vessel, set on accomplishing your mission while each pirate also has their own secret goal to fulfill.

Explore and loot the vessel of its bounty, fend off a seemingly unending wave of enemy defenders and encounter a potentially lethal series of events around every corner; All this while keeping morale high as the clock ticks down to your potential capture. 

Be wary of the possible traitor lurking among you, out for personal glory at the expense of the rest of the crew! 

Will you make it off the ship with all of your goals accomplished and your crew intact? Find out in Into the Black: Boarding Party!

  • Quick Player Turns - With 2 actions per turn it will be your turn again in no time! 
  • Re-playable -  10+ player boards,14 personal goals, 7 primary missions and a completely modular game board mean no two games are likely to be quite the same! 
  • Semi Cooperative - Players must work together to complete the primary mission while also dealing with their own personal goal, complete with the possibility of a traitor in your midst!
  • No Player Elimination - Everyone is in the game to the end! 
  • Solo Play Integrated - With a complete enemy AI system, Into the Black: Boarding Party is fully playable solo, by design!
  • The first in a SERIES of Games - Into the Black: Boarding Party is the first in a series of games in the Game of Space Piracy world, with a prequel and a sequel game currently in development!

Each player selects a Player Board to represent the crew member they are playing, equips that character and selects their secret personal goal, one of which may be a Traitor!

A Primary Mission is then selected, for the entire group to complete.

Place the Airlock and initial set of corridors and rooms tiles and you are ready to play!

A Typical 2 Player Setup

  • Players take turns determined by the leadership value on their player board. 
  • Take up to two actions on your turn. 
  • Each player board has its own special abilities to utilize! 
  • Any time a player moves in to a new room that tile is flipped face up and a number of events cards are drawn and resolved. 

 

  • Any time a player encounters enemies their turn ends and they will enter combat at the end of the round. 
  • At the end of each full round the Apprehension Track is moved up, new corridors and rooms are placed and the enemy defenders will move about the ship seeking out the intruders!

To win, as a group you must meet the requirements of the Primary Mission AND each player must meet the requirements of their own personal goal.

Just like the cold, dark emptiness of outer space, Into the Black: Boarding Party is harsh and unforgiving;

  • If, at any time during the game, the apprehension track reaches 24, morale reaches zero or there are no more character boards left to select from the game ends in a loss for all of the players.
  • If, at any time during the game, the traitor completes and plays their personal goal, the traitor has won the game and all other players have lost!

  • Pledges to the EU will ship from within the EU, VAT/Duty Free.
  • Pledges to North America will ship from I Will Never Grow Up Games in Canada.
  • To keep costs low, shipments will not have tracking.
  • All listed prices are in CA$

Last, but definitely not least, let's not forget our play testers! You spent hundreds of tireless hours playing and breaking this game in order to help us make it what it is today!

story:
The Quick Start guide is available HERE.

 

Unlocked content is available to all Mortal backers and above! This content comes courtesy of our generous backers!  

Bri, Sonia, Denyse, Chris C, Kevin, Joseph, Marco, Cathy, Casey, Jay, Michael, Chris G, Karyn, Fara, Szymon, Lazarus, Doug, Terry, and Pedro!

This heroic tactical RPG is set in a mythic land, a place where heroes build their legend in the pursuit of immortality and fantastic creatures inhabit the untamed world. The Lost Age is powered by a new class-free, skill-based system, with goal driven XP, dice-less GMing, and resource management-focused gameplay.

 The Quick Start guide is available HERE.

“Verdict: If you enjoy games like Burning Wheel, Pathfinder, or Gloomhaven, I suggest checking out The Lost Age.”  

- Sophie Lagacé, veteran gamer - Read the full in-depth review.

TLA Lets Play

Pre-Orders

We will be offering pre-Orders for the core rule book in both digital and hardback versions

The core rule book will Include:

Hardback cover

250 full-color pages

All rules needed to run and play

The setting of Khem, complete with primers on technology, magic, and the gods

More than 50 full-color illustrations

Page Layout

Art

The Lost Age is different from standard fantasy games and the visual reflect that. Our primary artist, Audre "Chramath" Schutte, has done a wonderful job bringing the characters and creatures to life with vivid colors and fantastic creatures. While Brandon Burt has captured the world with his equipment and landscapes illustrations. 

The Lost Age is set in a mythic bronze age where belief fuels reality: gods seek to gain strength through spread worship, dead deities still warp the land and its creatures into mysterious new forms, and mortal heroes cultivate their own legends to claim divinity for themselves. Civilizations have both risen and fallen; forgotten deities and ruins still linger, while new, shining cities are carved out of the dangerous continent.

Heroes

Atalanta, Gilgamesh, Karna. In Khem this is the level of heroism that characters aspire to. Building a legend and performing mighty deeds worthy of that legend is the point of your existence. Work hard enough, keep from angering the gods and then a hero may ascend upon their glorious death to take their place will the gods. Even the lowliest heroes have an impact in the world.

Magic

In the setting of The Lost Age, there are two main paths to magical power: spiritual power granted by the gods, and esoteric magic unearthed by long study. Even those granted power by a deity are generally polytheists, and only the most zealous worship a single god. By comparison, esoteric magic is mastered by those who instead seek the secrets of the world and control over its elements.

The People of Khem

The Land of Khem

 Creatures of Khem

Many strange creatures live in Khem. Many of them are transformed from contact with the essence of dead gods. Essence is distilled belief which can be used to make things true. For animals this enhances their innate behaviors and mutates their form into something new, different, unique.

 

The setting features:  

A shifting pantheon as gods die and heroes ascend 

 Deep cultural histories and 6 unique non-human races 

 Granted spiritual magic and free-form elemental magic 

A dangerous land where unknown creatures and races are common sights

 

Check out the System overview here!

 

The TEN system is designed to make players feel like a hero. Players will manage their health and combat options with simple calculations. GM's don't need to roll dice allowing them to create evocative content mid-game. Instead GM's assign target numbers to tasks: the average is seven, and players must meet or beat that number on a d10. On any role players may spend a character's health, known as trait points, to gain a bonus. Rolling a one is an automatic failure, while rolling a ten is an automatic success. 

 

Traits

Characters are made up of five traits, each corresponding to a part of the body, which represents their health. Spending points from these traits can activate Skills, add bonuses to d10 rolls, or enable faster movement. Every point in a trait increases a character's health, while every ten points in a trait increases its rank and grants a +1 bonus to tasks. If a trait is reduced to half, characters receive a second wind, which grants a +1 bonus on attack rolls and damage.

Skills & Talents

Characters gain skills and talents over time. Skills unlock powerful bonuses, activated abilities, or magical powers, while talents grant fame and knowledge. Every ten points is a rank and increases the power or bonus of that skill or talent.

Progression

Characters gain skill and trait points through leveling or by accomplishing their goals, such as avenging a loved one or converting a person to their god. Characters level up every session, adding points to their traits and skills.

Action Points

Every turn in combat players gain action points to move, attack, and interact. Actions can be performed in any order, allowing for skirmish style combats. Players may spend trait points to gain additional action points.

Tri-Fold Character Sheet

The tri-fold character sheet lets you focus on the information that's important to you, whether you're teaching The Lost Age to a new player, jumping into the heat of combat, or roleplaying your character's background.

Enemies & Encounters

When designing adventures, the system gets out of the way. GMs set a target number and are then free to craft the encounter. Nemesis enemies offer deep combat options with individually tracked traits and armor, while cohort enemies have a weakness and a single pool of health to create fast group combats.

 

The system provides:

A simple but evocative system for progression

Mechanical rewards to perusing character goals  

Action point system in tactical combat

Quick set-piece combat encounters

Health as a resource for heroic actions

 

 

Fulfillment will be handled by traditional methods using well-packed boxes and the USPS. Delivery of the core book is slated for September 2018 barring unforeseen circumstances. Fulfillment of any stretch goals will be assessed and communicated to all backers upon successfully completing the campaign.

story:
Welcome to the World of Steampunk ...

  

ARISTO STEAMPUNK PLAYING CARDS is a brand-new project that was inspired by XIXcentury industrial steam-powered machinery & American “Wild West” fantasy world. Steampunk today can be defined in multiple ways, however, aesthetic can lead to some truly breathtaking designs. That’s why we've put together some awesome ideas of Steampunk in art and playing cards, that really epitomize its incredible style. 

 

What the past would look like if the future had happened sooner ?!

Let us introduce a modern science fiction deck of playing cards with 54 STEAMPUNK themed retro-futuristic drawings!

A real thing of exclusive artwork. We desired to create something a bit more rare, giving Cardists something more meaningful. It's all about mixing old and new: fusing the usability of modern technology with the design aesthetic and philosophy of the Victorian age. Welcome to the mysterious and breathtaking world of Steampunk.

♠️ The Court Cards follow the characters in Steampunk outfit with heavy gun, bowler hat, goggle and military-inspired garments that have been anticipated by mainstream high fashion, the Lolita and Aristocrat styles.

♦️ The Pips combine elements of technofantasy imagery in mechanical "steampunk" style. Aspects of such dim & dark design emphasise a balance between form and function that fantasized US Wild West-era gadgets.

♥️ The ACEs are decorated in clockwork mechanism style with spiral springs and set of gears details. Such graphic design makes every single card unique and interesting thing.

 

The JOKER card is a presentation of the distinctive "look" of a Plague Doctor. And depicting the most extraordinary part of the costume, The Mask.

Charismatic & Magnetic 

But it’s not for the fearsome appearance, the plague doctor might has been considered a Hero and in many ways represents superstition over science.

We look at the mask as some sort of adornment! 

It is remarkable! 

♣️ The Back Side of the cards is a wall piece that represents the concept of the clockwork mechanism. At some point, this is the level of sophistication in technology that once was lost or forgotten. The clockwork holding the various metal pieces together really adds to the Steampunk aesthetic as well making this one an eye catching piece of art.

We are extremely proud of the card back design. It’s exceptionally detailed!

 

The unique feature of this deck is one-of-a-kind fantasy story style and highly complicated and advanced hand-drawing.

We wanted to add this touch for enthusiasts, collectors, cardists, and of course illusionists. 

The goal of this project is to employ appropriate elements (such as iron, wood, and leather) with specifically designed concept and craftsmanship. To present SteamPunk in a completely imaginary realm coexisting with steam-era and other anachronistic technologies.

♥️ Deck features:   

  • 52 Cards + 2 Jokers
  • Poker Size
  • Artwork on both side of the card
  • Printed by USPCC
  • Air-Cushion Finish
  • Traditional Cut
  • 100% completely custom designed cards, including art, pips, royalty, backs, etc.
  • Packaged in a Custom Tuck Case
  • Everything was drawn by hand

 

ARISTO STEAMPUNK UNCUT SHEETS 

Let us introduce the custom sheets of the printed cards feature remarkable Steampunk artwork: front & back before they are cut into the individual cards. 

Uncut sheets are taken straight off the press and varnished uncut sheets are perfect for framing. 
It’s a very much a collector’s item for all card players & enthusiasts.  The USPCC sheets measure approximately 26" tall and 22" wide.

 

UNIQUE ARISTO GRAPHIC ALBUM

 

We were inspired to create another exclusive artwork: Aristo Graphic Album!

This unique custom-made album goes in A4 format with Steampunk style hand-drawings of all face cards, pips and 2 jokers.

Just take a look at the album cover. It’s all about details ...

 ARISTO GRAPHIC ALBUMS are with author signature! 

 

ONLY HIGH STANDARDS OF QUALITY 
 

We ensure you in mastery of the print process & the logistics of distribution and delivery — each of these steps are equally important to achieving our goal: bringing You the finest cards.

ARISTO SPPC will be printed by The United States Playing Card Company. With their outstanding papers, superb inks and exceptional finishes, we know that their decks will be the highest possible quality.

Our cards will be USPCC Bicycle Standard with Air Cushion Finish. 

We provide worldwide shipping. And we guarantee that the deck will arrive in the PERFECT Condition.

 

Help To Support 

 

By being part of this campaign you actively support an independent artist while ensuring that ARISTO SPPC gets into full print production.

When the campaign is successfully completed, and the funds are collected, we will send out a Backerkit survey. There you can fill in your shipping address and check your order.

 

About

 

The concept for the ARISTO SPPC deck is by professional illustrator. The artist for the deck has captured audiences by his works. He has a deep affinity for fantasy, which have injected itself into his work.

The artwork is complete and ready for printing at USPCC, The United States Playing Card Company.

 

WE HOPE YOU ENJOY THE DECK AS MUCH AS WE ENJOYED CREATING IT!

Risks & Challenges

 

We promise to consistently update and communicate with our customers in order to keep them informed on our progress.

There are might some risk of production delays, but whatever problems arise, we will rapidly resolve any appeared issues. There's nothing more important for us than getting your rewards delivered on time.

All the products have been designed, and once we achieve our goal, we will produce them.

Thank You for Your Support!
